Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Global Treasury Management Analyst position is a two (2) year rotational program across the J.P. Morgan Treasury Services division that prepares and trains entry-level Analysts with a bachelor’s degree for a permanent position upon completion. During the two year period, Analysts support teams that provide critical services to corporate and institutional clients for their cash management and payment needs. Analysts will be required to support the business through meaningful and challenging work assignments where they will strategically assess and analyze situations and develop creative and workable solutions with the supervision and mentorship of their teams and managers. Analysts are challenged on their analytical skills, strategic thinking, creativity and diligence, along with their technical and theoretical knowledge. The experience in the program provides Analysts valuable exposure to businesses and projects. These tasks are to be accomplished by the integration of the Analyst’s practical skills and theoretical knowledge, with the supervision and guidance of experienced colleagues and senior managers. Analytics   Structure and develop detailed and flexible quantitative models that analyze a variety of financial and non-financial business data on a product, solution, or client. 	 Financial Forecasts:   		 Build dynamic financial projection models for a particular business segment, product, or solution based on a detailed set of assumptions and an understanding of the business, the industry, and the financial forecasting principles. Present these financial forecasts to senior management for their review and agreement in order to drive future business decisions.   Market Sizing:  Estimate the market size and opportunity value of new or existing products, product features, and solutions. With a background on market sizing techniques and the manager’s guidance on the business, be able to determine the variables to obtain the opportunity value.   Cost-Benefit Analyses:  Assess the value add of our products and solutions to our clients. – Through a quantitative approach, calculate the dollar value of the benefits and costs associated with the use of the product or solution as well as the synergies of our partnership. 			         Optimize existing business focusing on profitable growth and improved efficiency, including international expansion, new business, market entry, and efficiency initiatives. 	 Client Targeting:  Following various client targeting strategies and the guidance of the sales specialists on the team, elaborate a list of top clients to target and focus sales efforts on. Though Analysts will be guided and supervised, they are expected to comprehend the basics of a company’s business operations, industry fundamentals, and the potential opportunities for our products and solutions.   Market Share Analyses:  Incorporating different market share analysis methodologies and market research, assess how well our products and business are performing compared to the industry, external competitors, and with other products and businesses within the bank. Provide managers with insightful analysis and recommendations on rationale, strategy, and product development opportunities.   Competitive Analysis:  Assess the top list of competitors and evaluate their key strengths and weaknesses and how they compare to our product offering. Evaluate differences and develop an insightful recommendation to management on the best market placement strategy for our product to address the competition and develop competitive advantage. 			Strategy       Create, own, and help deliver presentations to top executives and higher management within the firm. These include but are not limited to: 	 Strategy documents, business reviews, business offsite presentations, product roadmaps, etc. Analysts will be expected to incorporate their strategic thinking, insight on new trends and business techniques, and broader knowledge of business. These value adding contributions provide managers with fresh and new perspectives on the stories and problems they seek to address.   RequirementsCommercialization   Assist clients to make and receive payments, and enable them to buy, finance and sell goods globally, invest and manage cash to increase their returns, and monitor and manage financial risks Work on solutions to help clients maximize the value of their working capital by optimizing their cash flows from transactions e.g. creating marketing materials and Pitchbooks. Foster innovation by identifying new and emerging business opportunities, such as data analytics, visualization, mobile applications, and accelerate speed-to-market through inorganic growth including partnerships. Identify, assess, and execute against acquisition opportunities that have strategic benefits to existing business (e.g., new capabilities, client segments, geographies). 	 Leverage competitive and market share analyses to assess emerging opportunities for the business and provide managers with insightful and informed recommendations to grow the existing business through new initiates, partnerships, and/or acquisitions.   Collaborate with functional partners in Product, Sales, Technology, Operations, Client Service, Marketing, and Finance around the world to gather information and insight.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description Overview This is a vital role for Iris Singapore and APAC, and one that can go as far as your ambition. We have a multi-disciplinary team working on these accounts – with a Business Director, Concise Analysts (our business, data and analytics consultancy), design, creative and account managers all working together to manage our best-in-class offering. We are looking for a Planning lead on the account to lead the strategic vision of the account, answer briefs and challenge clients. You will lead senior client relationships, building an environment of challenge and trust so we can generate the best work we ever have on the account. The role will require passion, insight, flexibility, strategic and entrepreneurial thinking, pragmatism and a drive for excellence. You bring your experience, enthusiasm, hunger for greatness, can-do attitude and energy to the table and we’ll all get along mighty fine. Responsibilities  Working with the Business Director, and other team members and planners on Personal Health campaign briefs. Push our digital responses to new creative heights. Thinking beyond video content, and being more innovative and challenging in our responses - what about search, reviews, UX to help achieve the client’s objectives? Work with Iris Concise (our business, data and analytics arm) as necessary to use data to power our strategies. Identify which briefs are ones we can push for creative greatness, and ones which we deal with efficiently and professionally. Working on new business pitches that require innovative, cutting edge relationship thinking, alongside the senior leaders of the business. To lead proactive client initiatives, to keep our clients inspired, motivated and seeing Iris as a valued and trusted partner. Working with creative leaders in Singapore to ensure we are briefing, inspiring and pushing creative to new heights. Work with the team to lead a measurement agenda to ensure that our work get the recognition it deserves from our peers for its effectiveness and creativity. RequirementsRequirements  Min. Diploma/ Degree in Mass Communication or its equivalent 3-5 years relevant experience Fast paced work environment Team player with positive attitude Excellent command of English and project management

Roles & ResponsibilitiesOverview Iris Singapore works across key regional markets for each. Both are specialised healthcare businesses that focus on different elements of the healthcare spectrum. It covers more of the higher-cost, healthcare-focused products such as MRI scanners, and consumer-focused healthcare products such as personal diabetes care. Our work across these clients is multi-faceted – covering consumer campaigns, understanding the healthcare stakeholder ecosystem, using social to target specific segments, and the need to understand important legislation to keep our communications the right side of the marketing law. We have a multi-disciplinary team working on these accounts – with a Business Director, Concise Analysts (our business, data and analytics consultancy), design, creative and account managers all working together to manage our best-in-class offering. We are looking for a Senior Planner to be the day-to-day planner on each of the accounts, but working closely with the planning leads on each. The planning leads will help define overall strategic visions alongside yourself, and help lead senior client relationships, but your role will be to lead specific campaigns and liaise with clients on a daily basis. You bring your experience, enthusiasm, hunger for greatness, can-do attitude and energy to the table and we’ll all get along mighty fine.   What’s expected in the role? Iris has entered its ‘era of product’ and the ultimate aim is to produce the best work we’ve ever produced. You will have a key role in ensuring we elevate our output. We want the next era of the agency to be the most rewarding for all within it. Responsibilities  You should have a passion for healthcare marketing and see the perceived limitations of the category as an opportunity for strategic greatness. Understand and share latest guidance on healthcare marketing within the agency and the client team: who does it well? Why? Who can we learn from? To lead proactive client initiatives, to keep our clients inspired, motivated and seeing Iris as a valued and trusted partner. Working with creative leaders in Singapore to ensure we are briefing, inspiring and pushing creative to new heights. Work with the team to lead a measurement agenda to ensure that our work get the recognition it deserves from our peers for its effectiveness and creativity. RequirementsRequirements  Min. Diploma/ Degree in Mass Communication or its equivalent 5-7 years relevant experience Fast paced work environment Team player with positive attitude

Roles & ResponsibilitiesGet to know our Team:   Grab is Southeast Asia's leading ride-hailing platform. We solve critical transportation challenges and make transport freedom a reality for 620 million people in Southeast Asia. Grab began as a taxi-hailing app in 2012, but has extended its product platform to include private car services (GrabCar), motorcycle taxis (GrabBike), social carpooling (GrabHitch) and last mile delivery (GrabExpress). Grab is focused on pioneering new commuting alternatives and for drivers and passengers with an emphasis on speed, safety and reliability. The Company currently offers services in Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam  The day-to-day activities:  Build the entire operation plan including defining key KPIs and the launch plans Responsible for scaling up operations within the country. Leveraging business data to address latent demand and plan resourcing / assets accordingly. Managing vendors, ensuring compliance to govt regulations and Grab policies  Process development and improvement Build, lead and coach the team to grow them into leaders. Build a culture that strongly aligns with Grab’s Vision, Mission and Principles Be a servant leader; Lead by example RequirementsThe must haves:  Minimum 5 years of work experience with 3 years in a managerial capacity Experience in running a start-up (with on-ground operations) as the founder preferred.  High degree of comfort with data. Able to manage both junior operational staff as well as business stakeholders. Prior experience in Operations preferred. Prepared to be hands-on when the situation calls for it Adaptable; Enjoys working in a fast-paced, fast-changing environment Strong motivator and collaborator Strong planning, execution and coordination skills Excellent leadership, management, problem solving, negotiations, interpersonal and communications skills

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, App Store Analytics - Business & Marketing
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAt Apple Media Products (AMP) Analytics, we analyze large-scale data across customer and content provider touch points in order to develop metrics and deep insights to measure performance and drive strategy.  Our culture is about getting things done iteratively and rapidly, with open feedback and debate along the away; we believe analytics is a team sport.   We encourage independent decision-making and taking smart risks. AMP Analytics collaborates deeply with stakeholders across product, design, engineering, and business teams: our mission is to drive innovation at Apple through deep quantitive research of the App Store, Apple Music, iTunes Video, iBooks, Podcasts amongst other services.  Dive deep into large-scale data to uncover trends and identify key insights that will propel the App Store business and marketing strategy. Shape how best to monitor, measure and understand business performance with a focus on Asia. Collaborate with business, marketing, finance and executive teams to generate regular presentations for C-level. Partner with other Apple organizations on data gathering, data governance, evangelizing KPIs and democratizing data.   Requirements Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics or relevant field. Ideally, Masters in related field. 4+ years of experience in a Data Scientist or Data Analyst role, preferably for an app or digital subscription business. Strong and curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action. Well-versed SQL languages. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark preferred. Familiarity with Python or R and data visualization tools such as Tableau for full-stack data analysis, insight synthesis and presentation. Experience using relevant statistical packages to build predictive/ML models. Familiarity with A/B test experimentation design. Outstanding communication, interpersonal and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail. Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage work to tight deadlines and handle the pressure of executive requests and product launches.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesA key member of the Application Management Services team within the Process & Innovation Group, you will be responsible for identifying areas for business intelligence process automation and efficiency improvement, as well as developing and maintaining proper records of management policies and processes.    You will provide business application analysis and data modelling design to collect, standardise, maintain, monitor and audit business data for effective centralized data warehouse. This entails developing and maintaining processes of automated data and using various business analytics reporting tools to create dashboards, graphs and visualization to meet both end users reporting needs and facilitate sharing of business intelligence between multiple data systems.  You will also work with internal and external stakeholders to identify, evaluate and implement services and tools to support data validation and cleansing.  RequirementsRequirements:  Degree in Electronics Engineering / Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Mathematics / Statistics / Business or equivalent 5 or more years of relevant experience Strong ability to understand, analyze and communicate business processes, requirements, technical designs, solutions and implementation Proactive and independent team worker with excellent organizing, leadership and interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders to prepare, present business intelligence for decision making and ability to explain data Expertise in at least two of the following:-     Scripting language such as Matlab and Python Querying language such as SQL Programming such as Java, XML Data Visualization BI and reporting Analysis Tools such as Qlikview and PowerBI ETL Tools such as Data Warehouses / Data Marts / Data Lakes and System databases    A competitive remuneration package will be offered to the successful candidate.   Interested applicants can email to hr@pseraya.com.sg with your full resume, complete with your current and expected renumeration. (All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality and we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

job_title: APAC Capacity Management, Global Technology Infrastructure, Associate
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesInfrastructure Lifecycle management (ILM) is responsible for managing the Line of business Infrastructure requirements for server and storage products end to end from Demand management to Decommissioning. The main functions involved are the supply chain operations, Customer engagement and experience, Infrastructure build, Refresh and Decommissioning.  In this role you’ll be the single point of contact for capacity management and customer issues within APAC. You will drive communication with LOB teams to understand their business strategy and how that impacts the existing footprint in region. You will also liaise with the data center, project management and GTI ILM teams to provide needed support to deliver the data center strategy in region.   Key Responsibilities include:     Manage the data center compute and storage capacity for the 14 countries in Asia Pacific region   Lead the Asia pacific customer forum with the different Lines of business and understand the impact of their roadmap on existing capacity footprint   Support the data center strategy in Asia Pacific region to deliver new data center capacity by partnering with Lines of business, Data center strategy and project management teams   Work with GTI ILM Supply Planning and Production Control colleagues to ensure demand is met   Assist in brokerage issues and ensure that supply is allocated to customers   Drive improvement projects for capacity expansion and infrastructure reclamation  RequirementsQualifications:  Minimum 2 years of data reporting, analysis and delivery experience Minimum of an undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field required Expert level MS Office skills with Excel and PowerPoint Self-starter with the ability to think creatively and laterally Strong analytical skills Experience with Business Intelligence & Data Visualization platforms (e.g. Qlikview, Qlik Sense) is desirable.  Strong organizational skills, and ability to track large amounts of data and activities Detail-oriented, with strong issue resolution skills Strong oral and written communication and ability to multi-task.  Our Global Technology Infrastructure Group is filled with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and cost-effective approach to deliver a wide variety of high-quality products and services. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive.   When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.   At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Support presales effort as needed in response to proposals, and conduct demonstrations and       presentations.    Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions with colleagues  Key Performance Measures (KPM)  Ability to define solution to meet customer requirement Established experience working on customer sites managing and delivering quality technical services against formal service levels and timeframes Strong demonstrated presentation and facilitation skills:   Confidence in presenting to, and discussing solutions with, various audiences and groups of different sizes Experience in running and facilitating workshops   Proven ability to support MM & SD pre-sales activities including:   Preparation of solution market content Preparation of sales proposals and statement of work documents including project resource plans and effort estimates Carry out systems demonstrations   Capable in building, establishing and maintaining trust, and strong, productive and effective relationships, including with clients and ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholder groups and individuals Ability to provide leadership and mentoring RequirementsQualifications & Certifications Distributions (SD) and Logistics Execution (LE) with proven depth of skill, knowledge and expertise Prerequisites include:   5-7 years of SAP MM, SD & LE implementation experience Multiple end-to-end methodology Ability to closely collaborate with Developers, writing Functional Specs and testing Forms  Reports, interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements and Workflows  Ability to take full ownership and responsibility for the stream deliverables, including integration points with other modules and teams.   Outstanding functional knowledge and gap analysis experience; detailed understanding of business operations to ensure the best solutions are provided to our customers Passion for quality and demonstrated high standards of service delivery Strong issues resolution experience with excellent analytical, conceptual, troubleshooting andproblem-solving skills:   Demonstrated ability to extract, scope and document requirements and translate these into technical specifications Passionate in analyzing customers’ issues as well as to build and improve existing processes Strong experience in troubleshooting of process problems and technical developments, as well as implementation of new functionality   Enthusiastic about learning new SAP-related technologies, with flexibility to quickly adapt to rapidly changing cultural and business environment with a strong desire to excel Outstanding interpersonal and collaboration skills:   Excellent client relationship skills, strong customer service orientation with a convincing and creative personality Exceptional skills in managing stakeholder expectations Solid skills in managing and collaborating with a team of professionals including customers, provide leadership and mentoring   Solid time, task and people management skills  - Well organized with strong management skills, and an ability to establish and work to priorities A high positive, motivated, proactive and responsible self-starter able to work in a team as well as independently Exceptional business communications skills: Excellent written and verbal communication High quality documentation delivery (including functional specifications)   Adaptable to the consulting lifestyle with flexibility to travel which may be minimal or extensive depending on project requirements Additional knowledge and experience in any of the following areas will be and added advantage:   Other SAP Logistics modules SAP ByDesign Awareness of HANA or Fiori in relation to MM & SD

company: ALEXANDER MANN BPO SOLUTIONS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Bank of America Merrill Lynch:  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 40 countries. In the U.S alone, we serve almost all Fortune 500 companies and approximately 59 million consumers and small-business customers. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.                              Connecting Asia Pacific to the World Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 23 offices in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.   Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission.   Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer.     Position Description Responsible for performing Product static duties for the Japanese market for equity stock, convertible bonds or JGB market and Client Static functions. Key tasks will include: Key Responsibilities • Provide correct Product Indicative data to our Merrill Lynch Japan Sales & trading systems as well as other regional trading systems. • Liaising with various departments within the firm and also external organizations, stock exchanges, custodians and business data vendors to resolve any Product Data issues impacting our transaction execution, trade processing and settlement functions. • Engage Tokyo-based stakeholders across the Trade Lifecycle. • Supervise daily workflow of Client Account creation and amendment. • Act as Control Function to offshore team. • Clearing of discrepancies of static data between systems via Data Quality Reports. • Contribution to Projects (global and regional) • Proactive management of Risk & Control issues.Requirements  Key Requirements  The successful candidate with knowledge in cash equity/ fixed income products is preferred. Candidates must be analytical in nature, creative, show initiative and have a mature approach to business. This role involves a lot of internal and external liaison and so outstanding communication skills as well as developed interpersonal skills are essential to your success.  Essential Education:  Degree in Finance is preferred.  Systems Experience:  Proficiency in Microsoft applications is essential.  Knowledge of Bloomberg skills is helpful but not necessary.

Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.   Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission.   Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer.     Position Description Responsible for performing Product static duties for the Japanese market for equity stock, convertible bonds or JGB market and Client Static functions. Key tasks will include: Key Responsibilities • Provide correct Product Indicative data to our Merrill Lynch Japan Sales & trading systems as well as other regional trading systems. • Liaising with various departments within the firm and also external organizations, stock exchanges, custodians and business data vendors to resolve any Product Data issues impacting our transaction execution, trade processing and settlement functions. • Engage Tokyo-based stakeholders across the Trade Lifecycle. • Supervise daily workflow of Client Account creation and amendment. • Act as Control Function to offshore team. • Clearing of discrepancies of static data between systems via Data Quality Reports. • Contribution to Projects (global and regional) • Proactive management of Risk & Control issues.Requirements  Key Requirements  The successful candidate with knowledge in cash equity/ fixed income products is preferred. Candidates must be analytical in nature, creative, show initiative and have a mature approach to business. This role involves a lot of internal and external liaison and so outstanding communication skills as well as developed interpersonal skills are essential to your success.  Essential Education:  Degree in Finance is preferred.  Systems Experience:  Proficiency in Microsoft applications is essential.  Knowledge of Bloomberg skills is helpful but not necessary.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesDatabase design They ensure that data is clearly defined and they refine the logical design of the database so that it can be translated into a specific data model. In so doing, IT Senior Database Administrators take responsibility for the mapping out of the conceptual design for a planned database in outline. They take ownership for the writing of database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata). In so doing, they create, test and execute data management languages.  These individuals monitor the performance and manage the parameters of the database to ensure the provision of speedy query responses to front-end users. They monitor production databases regularly or respond to any database issues by bringing down the database or taking the database offline.  Utilities and Reporting They advise on and assist with the development of database utilities and automated reporting. He/she sets up data sharing and disk partitioning. This enables front-end users to access data concurrently in a way or form that suits their particular needs. The IT Senior Database Administrator provides support in critical situations.  Change Control and Release Management IT Senior Database Administrators assist the Change Control and Release Management functions by commissioning and installing new applications and customising existing applications in order to make them fit for purpose. They apply the patches and upgrade the database as required by the design team. They communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational employees to ensure database integrity and security.  Data Security Maintaining data standards in accordance with business requirements, Dimension Data policies and the Data Protection Act is important in this job. These individuals have a good understanding of security information procedures and work in accordance with these requirements.  Behavioural Skills The IT Senior Database Administrator demonstrates good written and verbal communication skills. They have a very good understanding of business data requirements and apply their highly developed attention to detail.  They are able to work with multiple stakeholders in the organisation and display excellent interpersonal skills. They are proactive have good problem solving and good client service ability comes naturally.RequirementsPlease email to justin.chen@dimensiondata.com

Roles & Responsibilities Be the key contact person to manage queries, information dissemination and communication for new and existing shareholders as well as board members of the company. Serve as the main point of contact with the corporate and financial medias by responding to inquiries and partnering with internal stakeholders. Collect, analyse business data and partake in corporate planning required for annual board meetings, investors report and other related stakeholder inquiries, including sustainability reports and queries driven by clients, investors. Be one of the key contributor for analysis of macro and micro trends of the business. Assist and support CEO in preparation of materials for board meetings and investor meetings. Lead the identification, development and placement of Qoo10’ stories in business and financial media (print, broadcast, digital, etc.). Plan, arrange and coordinate board meetings for stakeholders and investors. Involve in internal communications, community relations and government affairs. Support Internal Communications with strategy and execution of corporate updates. Support the communications and PR team in crisis management, Corporate and financial related media releases. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree 7-10 years of experience in the business and finance field, corporate affairs, or corporate secretarial services. Candidate must be financial savvy, business minded with strong business acumen. Ability to have a clear sense of business trends of the company, competitors, economy and highly attuned to trends of the global e-commerce environment. Ability to be forward looking by thinking and analyzing strategically for the business to gather different decision-making options for business plans. Well verse with local and international current affairs related to business and economy. Strong collaboration, critical thinking and communication skills is essential. Highly disciplined and organized individual who is able to commit and take ownership of projects. Ability to transform data and business information into strong, persuasive and informative presentation materials to stakeholders by leveraging on Microsoft Excel, Word, PPT, and other software.    Interested candidates are strongly encouraged to send their most updated resume to sea.recruit@qoo10.com with subject (Corporate Affairs Manager) for a better response.

job_title: VICE PRESIDENT, STRATEGIC PLANNING [MNC, Marine / Maritime Industry]
categories: Risk Management, Banking and Finance, Engineering, General Management
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesVantage HR Solutions (EA LICENSE NO 10C4871) is a professional executive search consultancy company registered under the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), Singapore. The keen eye we developed over the years enabled us to make accurate assessments about jobs and candidates. We distinguish ourselves through our direct working experience as industry-specific professionals from the industries that we serve. Hence, we have the trade know-how, professional network and track record to recruit the right talents for different business needs. Whether you are seeking the best talents for your organization or looking for a dream career - Vantage HR Solutions has the edge to meet your expectations.  Visit  http://vantage.com.sg/  to find out more about our services and other available positions.  Our client is from a leading multi-national corp. in the Marine industry. It has established itself as an Employer of Choice due to its' global branding, drive for innovation as well as its' emphasis on human capital development.   THE ROLE:    The incumbent will play a leadership role with full responsibility for the strategic planning, budgeting, forecasting and analytical activities. As a global employer that is experiencing rapid growth, they are looking for a senior-level hands-on leader who has seen best practices, particularly around managing long-term and annual strategic planning processes, leveraging enterprise planning systems and forecasting. The position includes developing and driving the long-term strategic planning processes, annual and quarterly budgets, financial forecasts and analyses, overseeing the development and delivery of management reporting environments, monitoring key performance indicators and driving companywide financial performance initiatives. A key aspect of the position will be to partner closely with the Company’s executive and senior management to drive business insight and companywide financial results, and to provide fact-based thought leadership on key strategic and financial decisions.      Key Responsibilities:  Working closely with the executive team and business units to develop long-term strategic plans, annual budgets and operational analysis and reporting; providing thought leadership in the creation department level key metric dashboards Leadership role in provide analytical perspectives to important strategic decisions, Leading company-wide strategic planning, budget and quarterly target-setting processes, including forecasts and key performance monitoring Leading the development, monitoring and reporting of key operational metrics and driving processes to improve consistent productivity and efficiency improvements Playing a leadership role in the area of business intelligence, trends, competitive environment and regulatory changes of the marine industry Identify, research and recommend new directions and opportunities for growth Guide and review business planning and optimization of resources across the business units Working with executive management to maintain 5-year long range plan that incorporates the financial impacts of Company strategies and initiatives Performing ad-hoc financial analysis to support key business decisions.      THE REWARDS: Short listed candidates can expect an attractive remuneration package in line with relevant experience and job knowledge, the opportunity to work for among the best in the industry and excellent prospects for personal development. Due to the size of the organization, global operations and diversity of business, this is an excellent place for horizontal and vertical career prohression and development.   OTHER INFORMATION:  Permanent Position New headcount due to expansion   RequirementsREQUIREMENTS:  Degree in any discipline Experience in Marine, Offshore, Engineering or related industries will be advantageous At least 10 years of finance-related experience, with deep financial planning and analysis experience in a leadership role Strong communication and relationship building skills at senior levels, with the ability to interpret and summarize data to aid management in achieving strategic and operational goals    APPLICATION:  Apply via jobsBank or email CV in MS Word format to: careers@vantage.com.sg Please include your recent photo, expected salary, last drawn salary, availability/notice period and reason for leaving past employment(s) in your CV.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSupport the branch to identify and facilitate process improvements through improved efficiencies and quality of existing processes. Evaluate, analyze and prepare data to be and analyzed and develop insightful reporting enabling the company to make better decisions, strengthen customer service and increase profits. Continually strive to expand the utilization of our data, grow analysis techniques and broaden our application of data.  Support DBO to assist department and branch management in developing and implementing new customer and internal processes that positively impact operations and productivity Support DBO to analyze existing data and processes to identify opportunities for cost reduction and improved efficiencies. (Digital Transformation) Provide regular updates in the management meeting for deployment and project identified. Support DBO to monitor data and processes for continual process improvement. Closely measure and validate internal and customer related key performance indicators. company: SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC IT LOGISTICS ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis position provides visibility to the business leaders of the IT Division on their business performance, to enable them to successfully execute defined initiatives through the provision of insightful & accurate business analytics, dashboards and track the deployment of initiatives over the International Ops Region*. The key internal customer of this position is the International Ops SVP, the zone and country business VP (BVP), as well as the VP driving strategic growth initiatives. The business analyst works hand in hands with the finance and Sales Operations community, at the Region and at the zones level.  Single point of Contact of the business analyst team to the Greater India, Asia and Pacific Operations Zones. Supports these defined zones on the use of business intelligence tools linked to bFO (Salesforce.com) and “Greenberry” business intelligence tool (inhouse development, Tableau based) Supports these defined zones Sales Operations teams in improving data quality of bFO, driving proper application of bFO “Golden Rules”. The business analyst would be the advocate for the adoption of pipeline management best practice by the defined zones, by supporting the use of Greenberry dashboard, and driving regular cadence and data cleansing; Supports the zones in preparing their business reviews for the pipeline management part; Has a critical contribution in predicting the end of quarter or end or year landing of the business. At IT Division International Ops level, the position provides ITD monthly business performances reports over its market segments, across all BU’s, for Datacenter and for Commercial & Industrial Governances. This position also assist other regions (particularly Europe) in generating their reports of this type. At IT Division International Ops level, manages the documentation and the performance tracking over the strategic initiatives: he coordinates the process to plan the initiatives and handshake their targets with the BVP’s, document the targets, coordinate the activity to publish the monthly performance dashboard. Supports the zones in preparing the strategic initiative score card for their business reviews.  * The Region encompasses the following zones: South America, Middle-East & Africa, Greater India, East Asia, Pacific, Japan.Requirements University degree with focus on quantitative methods/ econometrics/ statistics/ mathematics correlated degree programs MBA with background in computer science around data science.is a plus Min. 3 years of hands on experience in using advanced analytical techniques to solve practical problems from prototyping to business impact Deep understanding of machine learning and statistical methods with their underlying theory and math Experience with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server etc. Strong business acumen Basic financial and accounting acumen will be critical to translating financial reporting requirements into reporting solutions. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to apply knowledge and creativity to resolve standard and complex issues. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The ability to work with finance, accounting and operations teams to understand, document and translate their needs and then work with the technical development teams. Experience in providing the results of analyses in clear written form and presenting the findings to the audience Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with people from various disciplines and various cultures. Good project management, organizational and prioritization skills with attention to detail.  Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes. Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities. Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a high pressure on-call environment. Relentless passion for independent learning:  The tools and needs for data change rapidly and we need to push ahead of the curve. It’s expected that you are always improving, bringing new ideas to the table and learning to make better use of the existing tools.

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition : SAP BPC Consultant  Mandatory skills - SAP BPC 10.x Relevant year of experience min 4 years Type of project  - Support  Requirements:  Bachelor Degree Strong in communication and presentation skills experience in cross- functional collaboration with IT and Business. Must have certificate and on Sap BI (Business Intelligence), BPC (Business Planning and Consolidation), SAP S4/HANA, and Business Objects. Must have done SAP BW 7.5, SAP BPC 10.1 Embedded S4/HANA, and SAP Business Object 4.1. Must have done SAP BPC 10.1 Embedded Integrated Planning S4/HANA. Strong foundation and a clear understanding and appreciation of BI/DW design and development techniques, as well as associated technical skills and related tools. Knowledgeable in multi-system landscape architecture and integration in modelling, security & authorization, data provisioning, reporting, SAP BW on HANA and HANA Admin. Understand different perspectives in HANA Developer Studio. Develop HANA data models using HANA Studio, including analytical, attribute and calculation views, stored procedures and complex schemas. Install and enhance HANA Live content. Must have 5 experiences in implementation end to end for legal (statutory) and management consolidation, Develop and conduct BI tool training for business power users. Good understanding of filters and parameters in HANA views. Strong in the accounting. Have 5 cycle of implementation of SAP BPC Consolidation for both legal and management consolidation. Have an accounting background for legal consolidation. Able to start work immediately 	    Positions based in Singapore.   RequirementsCandidate should possess good soft skills as mentioned below:  Should possess excellent problem solving, and is able to work effectively in a less structured environment and manage time. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Work closely with onsite and offshore team members  Roles & Responsibilities: What impact will you make? We offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and society. Whatever your aspirations, Deloitte offers you unrivalled opportunities to realise your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.  So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.  Work you’ll do    Provide consulting services during the business case development requirements, planning, design, and implementation in  BI (Business Intelligence), BOBJ (Business Object), BPC (Business and Consolidation) in top down planning, legal, and management consolidation solution with S4/HANA platform. Design BI, BPC, and Business Object, S4/HANA solutions with the strategy, roadmap, architecture, technical, and functional based on the best practise solution. Ensure the integration with S4/HANA ERP and others Non-SAP systems. Provide solution gaps and technical solution for BI, BOBJ (Business Object), and BPC (Business Planning and Consolidation) on S4/HANA. Ability to interact with both SME business and technical stakeholders of the clients to provide the technical solutions. Ability to provide the accounting, business processes, and consolidation advice which align to the proposed solutions to the client and stakeholders. Ability to translate the business goals and requirements SAP solutions through participation in blueprint workshops, facilitating decision on best practice solution, guiding configuration, and facilitating subsequent testing, and providing Go-Live support. Ability to conduct and lead SAP technical and functional related with customer. Develop training and other technical documentation. Conduct the training to key users and business users. Conduct the user acceptance test end to end, until sign-off. Ability to prepare the production by doing transport and liaise with other team for both configuration and other development system. Monitor, maintain, and optimize production system. Investigate and resolve the issues for both technical and functional. Identify opportunities to automate, consolidate, and simply platform by using S4/HANA. Improve the BI and BOBJ governance on the standard, processes, and templates.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesRole As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will hold a highly visible analytical role that requires interaction and partnership with leaders across the businesses. You will be responsible to conceptualize, design, and produce visually compelling business intelligence (BI) reporting solutions (reports, dashboards, cubes, interfaces, etc.) using reporting tools, applications, and queries or scripts through the use of reporting and visualization techniques.  This is a highly impactful and autonomous role where the insights provided will directly impact the bottom line of the business. You will work extensively with product management teams, marketing teams, technical teams, finance, and operations team and help find opportunities to grow the business. You should be an expert with analyzing large data sets, enjoys diving deep into data analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions. The candidate should be an effective communicator capable of driving resolutions and communicating insights to non-technical audiences.   Responsibilities   Design and develop metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business and product decisions to improve performance and reduce costs.   Conduct deep-dive data analysis for business insights and recommendation   Collaborate with software engineers to implement the data architecture and design   Combine knowledge of statistical methodology and analysis with programming skills to support complex analyses   Detailed knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments   Strong understanding of software development life cycle and/or agile development environment with emphasis on BI practices   Solid understanding of source data, its strengths, weaknesses, semantics and formats; solid knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional)   Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related technical field  5+ years of years of relevant professional work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence, market research or related field   5+ years of Experience with BI tools with at least 2 years working in Tableau or any other BI tool   Experience gathering business requirements, using industry standard business intelligence tools to extract data, formulate metrics and build reports   Experience using advanced SQL (OLAP, CTE etc) and databases in a business environment with large-scale, big data, complex datasets   Experience identifying and communicating analytical outcomes in person and in writing to both business and technical teams   Experience with statistical modeling and analyzing large data sets     Bonus Points   Experience surfacing automated insights using descriptive analytics   Experience in BI projects converting business needs to data warehousing and reporting solutions   Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organization   Demonstrated ability to coordinate projects across functional teams, including engineering, marketing, finance, and operations   Experience writing ETL scripts in python or any other language.

company: NIKE GLOBAL TRADING B.V. SINGAPORE BRANCH
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNike is looking to hire a Performance Management Analyst for the Southeast Asia & India business, based in Singapore. This role acts as an enabler for the SEA&I operations, driving the performance required to meet goals through analysis and solutions for improved operational efficiency. A strong background in performance and info-analytics is a requirement, where a single-minded focus on performance metrics is fundamental in aligning local and virtual teams towards the common strategic and business goals. By combining business insights and performance outcome, this role is expected to identify areas of improvements and recommend corrective actions. Working with multiple countries and stakeholders requires strong influencing and communication skills to drive definition, direction and support towards enabling stakeholders in achieving their targets. This role will also need to monitor business performances regularly and generate performance reports to management; experience in developing business presentations to facilitate conversations is a plus. This role needs to be adept at analysis and the development/usage of info-analytical tools. Preferred experience in SAP and reporting tools are required to understand the system-related information that drives fact-based performance tracking. To be effective you’ll need to operate at a high degree of comfort with multi-tasking and handling multiple tracks of performance-related work and conversations. Most importantly, you should be very excited about the opportunity to make a significant impact at Nike. Responsibilities  Drive a collaborative process that provides visibility to supply chain performance and enables improvement of our logistics performance management capabilities Evolve, facilitate and manage the budgeting, forecasting and monthly reports submission processes with timeliness Be adept at analyzing correlation between processes and performance numbers Recommend and build solutions that address process gaps, that lead to performance improvement and traction against the business targets Provide the needed visibility and fore-sighting capability to ensure performance excellence Collaborate with metric owners in geography and territory to identify improvement opportunities for performance metrics Lead performance reporting (Delivery Precision, Logistics Costs, and Coverage) and be the center-of excellence, facilitating conversations & business reviews that drive operational performance Support digital performance metrics of EDD, working with the Digital operations team Champion, utilize and lead adoption of dashboards and business intelligence tools Strong understanding of SAP and related reporting capabilities, for monitoring of transactions and business information Requirements Minimum educational qualification: Bachelor’s degree At least 3 years in Logistics Management, Supply Chain or a related field Team player who is able to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Meticulous and well organized, with a good grasp on numbers Able to multi task, work well under pressure and deliver within tight timeline Experience in SAP Strong background in business intelligence and industry analytical tools

Through our subscription products, insightful reports, online panels, and industry-leading intelligence platform, GlobalData delivers high quality business information to global audiences. We supply must-have independent content, premium analysis and industry networking opportunities to thousands of senior decision makers.   GlobalData is currently looking for an experienced BDM as an addition to our growing global sales team, representing the GlobalData Energy Sector Practice which covers Oil & Gas (Upstream, Midstream & Downstream), Power Generation (Fossil/Renewables) and Petrochemical. A successful candidate in this fast paced and innovative environment will be able to sell high value information services to an executive-level audience, establish and execute new market entry strategies and train/manage other sales team members in achieving their targeted KPI’s.   Essential Job Functions:    Develop and implement a sales strategy to grow an industry-specific revenue stream Connect and develop business relationships with key stakeholders (senior executives, government agencies, and functional users at clients and prospects) in the Oil & Gas, Power and Petrochemical sectors & Technology Sectors Conduct sales conversations to identify and qualify prospective customers and recording sales prospecting activity in Salesforce CRM Liaise with internal stakeholders to drive the direction and output of our Energy Practice content and coverage for local audiences Achieve sales targets both on new business and account retention KPI’s via effective sales pipeline management  for APAC   Represent GlobalData at relevant international events in the Energy sector and Technology Sector Carry out account review/renewal calls at regular intervals with Key Account clients   RequirementsJob Qualifications Include:    Business Development experience with specialization in Energy and Technology Sector Experience across both new client sales and account renewal sales in the Energy and Technology sector Experience in new market entry strategy development Strong understanding of subscription based services and solution selling Excellent communication skills, especially the ability to articulate a compelling message and influence, persuade and negotiate with all levels of people to achieve win-win situations Excellent presentation and negotiation skills Effective prioritization and time management skills Proficient in MS Office Suite Experience with Salesforce.com or similar CRM applications Bachelor’s Degree Required

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWho we are At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. Roche Diagnostics is committed to create a great place to work for its employees and we have been recognized as the Best Employer in a number of countries in Asia Pacific.  The Position We are seeking a Controller to join the Regional Controlling team in strategic planning, financial evaluation and business partnering for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. Support the annual strategic planning to deliver market-driven insights and align regional and local business operations to achieve a sustainable competitive advantage. Actively partner with regional commercial teams to share financial insights on business performance, support commerical launches, feasibility studies and process improvement. You have strong communication and influencing skills coupled with the ability to engage and partner a myriad of stakeholders including senior management. Shortlisted candidates will be notified within 4 weeks from the application closing date.

Resolve any operational matters that may affect your label partners You will offer guidance and insight into service functionality towards the music industry You will analyze streaming data to identify emerging artists and music trends You will act as liaison between Spotify and artist / label partners You will connect other Spotify teams with the music industry to help drive and execute opportunities driven by Spotify and our partners RequirementsWho you are    You have at a strong combined music and technology background, preferably from the Philippines You have developed relationships with labels and are confident with your ability to collaborate with the community, primarily in the Philippines You have account management experience with an established digital music service, established record label or media company You have a proven track record of key results in marketing, strategy and infrastructure management/development You have good analytical skills You are proficient with content management systems and supply chain processes with high volumes of media You have excellent written and verbal communication skills You are able to prepare and deliver executive level presentations You are fluent in Tagalog and English  We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better workplace for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. What you’ll do  You will provide the best possible service to rights holders with regard to artist marketing, business intelligence and maximizing revenue You will identify, develop and execute unique marketing initiatives by leveraging artist and label relationships You will provide strategic and financial insights and develop best practice in order to help label partners achieve and build on revenue targets You will assure timely and correct delivery and publishing of new content. Resolve any operational matters that may affect your label partners You will offer guidance and insight into service functionality towards the music industry You will analyze streaming data to identify emerging artists and music trends You will act as liaison between Spotify and artist / label partners You will connect other Spotify teams with the music industry to help drive and execute opportunities driven by Spotify and our partners RequirementsWho you are    You have at a strong combined music and technology background You have developed relationships with labels in Indonwsia and are confident with your ability to collaborate with the community You have account management experience with an established digital music service, established record label or media company, some of it in Indonesia You have a proven track record of key results in marketing, strategy and infrastructure management/development You have good analytical skills You are proficient with content management systems and supply chain processes with high volumes of media You have excellent written and verbal communication skills You are able to prepare and deliver executive level presentations  We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better workplace for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world listens to music.

Roles & Responsibilities  Supporting the Management in their analytical needs across all departments (Operations, Commercial, Marketing, Finance)   Monitoring KPIs of the business, identifying causes/trends and drive data-based decision-making through insightful reports   Modelizing cost and profit direction of the business   Creating procedures regarding collecting, critically evaluating and screening data   Extending knowledge of Business Intelligence to provide ongoing refinement of processes to improve operations  Requirements  Outstanding degree in business, economics or a quantitative field. Ideally, first hand experience in Business Intelligence, Controlling or other relevant fields   True number-cruncher and understanding of statistics and mathematics   Fundamental understanding of e-commerce/e-marketplaces   Highly organized and able to work on multiple projects in a self-structured and well-prioritized way   Driven, proactive, and self-motivated to be able to work with minimal supervision   Strong interpersonal skills to communicate well with people from all backgrounds and departments   Willing to learn about new concepts and methodologies in this constantly evolving industry   Excellent at Excel and data visualization as well as writing SQL   Knowledge of data science and statistical modeling skills is a plus   Experienced in project management is a plus   At least 2 years of related work experience in a dynamic environment

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description: Solving critical transportation challenges and making transport freedom a reality, Grab is Southeast Asia's leading ride-hailing platform that is impacting over 630 million people in Southeast Asia. Started in 2012 as as a taxi-hailing app, Grab has since extended its product platform to include private car services (GrabCar), motorcycle taxis (GrabBike), social carpooling (GrabHitch) and last mile delivery (GrabExpress). Emerging from this dominance in transport is the opportunity to build Southeast Asia’s largest payments platform, GrabPay. Today, GrabPay is the highest frequency transaction platform in Southeast Asia. In what is largely a cash-based society, Grab is at the forefront pushing cashless technology development and adoption across the region. We look towards making seamless mobile payments a reality in Southeast Asia.   About the GrabPay team The Business Intelligence and Insights team performs a critical function within the GrabPay team. You will work on one of the largest and most fascinating fin-tech datasets in Southeast Asia to solve challenging problems as we build the first regional mobile payments platform.  The Business Intelligence and Insights team are vital analytical partners to our teams on-the-ground, providing them with much-needed market and user insights to plan and execute better. You will have access to an entire suite of business intelligence tools, using them to analyse performance, pin-point challenges, and craft solutions to drive user adoption and growth. You will also help design and execute user and market research to influence product strategy. If you're looking to use data and research to help analyse business strategy and execution, this is your opportunity.  You'll get to:   Assist and lead end-to-end data analysis projects for the GrabPay team; identifying issues, segmenting and profiling users, gathering market information, analysing data, and interpreting patterns and trends with the purpose of generating insights to inform both critical strategic direction and daily operational decisions alike. Build strong relationships with management; translate data speak to human speak in order to effectively conceptualise analysis and propose solutions to business stakeholders with the purpose of enhancing operational performance. Design and execute user and market research to influence product strategy. Collaborate with product, engineers and partnerships to manage business intelligence tools and identify new opportunities to expand Grab’s universe of data by identifying and collecting adjacent data to enrich insights RequirementsWhat we need:   A Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or business-related fields. Minimum 2-3 years of business analytics experience including experience in designing and leading analysis and research. Experience in fin-tech / TMT is a plus. Proficiency with MySQL and familiarity working with BI tools such as Tableau. Experience with R, Python or any programming language is a plus. Ability to use data visualisation to interpret user segmentation and insights analysis. Experience designing user and market research to gather data and feedback to influence product strategy. Ability to communicate effectively and present results succinctly to senior management.  Passionate about solving problems – possesses a relentless need for investigation and data exploration. Results and detail-oriented, with strong intuitions on how to solve problems creatively and quickly.

company: INTEGRATED HEALTH INFORMATION SYSTEMS PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & Responsibilities Drive the use of analytics in healthcare to derive insights for population health and patient care. Leverage analytics in support of policy and programme planning work for key priorities of MOH. Draw talents across healthcare landscape to support and participate in data analytics work. Health Analytics for Clinical Excellence, Operation Efficiency and Cost Effectiveness across the clusters Responsible to lead the Business Intelligence (BI) team or manage vendor in the development and implementation of proposed Business Intelligence applications system. Establish and promote a consistent set of BI skills, standards, and best practice. Responsible to setup the governance structure for BI and analytical programs, projects, practices, software, and architecture. Responsible for building the plans, priorities, infrastructure and competencies that the organization needs to take forward-looking strategic decisions by using the BI and analytical software capabilities. Work with Technical Project Manager to understand and analyze project requirements and implement desired solutions in the area of integration interfaces and protocols. Develop project plans and track project deliverables to ensure that the projects are completed within budget, schedule and quality standards. Define project tasks and resource requirements to achieve optimal utilization of resources. Manage multiple projects and is responsible for the execution from initiation to completion. Manage the risks that affect the delivery of the project outcome. Present reports and project updates to stakeholders on a regular basis. Implement process improvements to reduce development time and assist in the integration of complex business factors to implement long-term strategic planning objectives. Be familiar with industry best practices and integrate them into the application solutions. Manage and support a team of integration engineers on daily operation issues. Provide coaching and guidance to the team in the area of application integration. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent. Minimum 10 years and above of experience in developing, implementing and maintaining BI systems and experience in running large scale application integration projects. Experience in all phases of the BI project lifecycle. Experience in the setup or managing of BI competency centre is an added advantage. Experience in managing a team is a must. Possess prior hands-on experience with technologies such as BI tools (Informatica, SAP BODS, SAP BO, and OBIEE), .NET & MS-SQL/Oracle databases & messaging technologies such as Cloverleaf QDX, MQSeries or JMS, ESB, BPE. Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work with different groups of stakeholders.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a SharePoint Developer, your focus will be to develop, test and lead the implementation of mission critical enterprise SharePoint solutions that may also require the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#, Business Intelligence, SharePoint, Office 2016 and other advanced components of Microsoft technology. You will also have been trained or preferably experienced in implementing solutions using the organization specific platform, capable of creating Widgets, customising Workspaces and creating deployment packages. Good understanding of visual design to ensure that the visual quality of the solution aligns to the wireframes/high fidelity designs produced.  Key Responsibilities: • Take responsibility for creation of the SharePoint solutions/components. • Under general direction, designs, constructs, tests, implements and optimizes portions of basic systems that enable and support business and engineering functions. • Researches technical environment and system needs. • Defines scope, plans, and deliverables for assigned basic projects. • Collects detailed user and technical requirements. Works with others to analyze collected requirements, translate into programming solutions, and ensure that identified solutions meet customer needs and expectations. • Under supervision, designs, constructs, tests, and implements basic integrated solutions and distributed computing solutions for the customer and the organization. • Monitors performance to identify and help resolve system problems. • Investigates and resolves problems on selected software products and standard systems. Learning to apply appropriate tools to analyze, identify, and resolve technical problems. • Participates in standard solution implementations, upgrades, enhancements and conversions. • Maintains security, integrity, and business continuity controls and documents. • Builds knowledge on emerging tools, techniques and technologies.Requirements- MCP: 70-480 or equivalent: Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3 - MCP: 70-486 or equivalent: Developing ASP.NET MVC Web Applications - MCP: 70-489 or equivalent: Developing Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Advanced Solutions - MCP: 70-532 or equivalent: Developing Microsoft Azure Solutions   Interested candidates can click apply for more information. ** We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. ** We respect your privacy and all communication will be treated with confidentiality.  If you wish to know more about this position or explore other roles, please prepare your updated profile and get in touch with our consultants. Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by Manpower for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Artist & Label Marketing team manages hundreds of creator and label relationships across the globe with a network of Managers in different Spotify territories. This position will serve as primary point of contact for our partners, specifically in Korea, but also working with international teams. The Artist & Label Marketing Manager will focus on developing and maintaining excellent relationships with Spotify’s content providers by enabling them to maximize the service as both, a sales and promotional platform. This person will be based in Spotify’s Singapore office as part of the regional team. What you’ll do ● You will provide the best possible service to rights holders with regard to artist marketing, business intelligence and maximizing revenue ● You will identify, develop and execute unique marketing initiatives by leveraging artist and label relationships. This shall include opportunities to collaborate with Spotify’s KPOP Daebak hub. ● You will provide strategic and financial insights and develop best practice in order to help label partners achieve and build on revenue targets ● You will assure timely and correct delivery and publishing of new content. Resolve any operational matters that may affect your label partners ● You will offer guidance and insight into service functionality towards the music industry ● You will analyze streaming data to identify emerging artists and music trends ● You will act as liaison between Spotify and artist / label partners ● You will be the ambassador for Spotify to the Korean creator community. ● You will connect other Spotify teams with the Korean music industry to help drive and execute opportunities driven by Spotify and our partnersRequirementsWho you are ● You have a strong music and technology background ● You have developed relationships with labels and are confident with your ability to collaborate within the Korean music community ● You have account / partner management experience with an established digital music service, established record label or media company ● You have a proven track record of key results in marketing, strategy and infrastructure management/development ● You have good analytical skills ● You are proficient with content management systems and supply chain processes with high volumes of media ● You have excellent written and verbal communication skills ● You are able to prepare and deliver executive level presentations ● You have prior experience in global organisations in matrix set ups We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better workplace for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world listens to music

and Programs   Prepare the roll out of new LH Group products in the market in collaboration with the global and regional product and program management team Support the global sales product and program management team in the conception, development, creation and roll out of new sales products with local insights, ideas and feedback Review & steer corporate programs and other incentive
