company: CARGILL ASIA PACIFIC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Purpose The Application Architect ensures the Trading applications (CTS, Gaoda, TIC, SAP ACM/CM, EKA etc.) functional/technical areas are well understood and managed from an end-to-end perspective and in alignment with the center-led portfolio roadmap(s), and region and global business priorities.  This position will develop and maintain a deep understanding of the Trading application (or suite of applications) and will partner with Portfolio Solution Architects to facilitate alignment with global portfolio architecture and enterprise-wide architecture standards.  The Trading Portfolio encompasses the following areas: •Market Data Processes and Solutions •Trade Analytics Processes and Solutions •Commodity Trading and Risk Management(CTRM) Processes and Solutions •Trade Compliance/Technologies Processes & Solutions This position is entrusted to proactively identify data requirements, application requirements, security/privacy requirements as well as infrastructure requirements and/or impacts and work with Technical Architects to address. Utilizing a strong expertise in Trading/Commercial business processes and the Trading applications that support these processes, this position ensures solutions developed/procured are aligned to enterprise architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and services, and meet the financial targets (cost and benefits).  This position is accountable for solution evaluation and early-phase project estimates which contribute to the business case. The Application Architect is also responsible for staying current with emerging business and technology trends, promoting the ‘art of the possible’, and driving innovation investments throughout the assigned regional portfolio(s).  This role is able to facilitate the difficult conversations involving balancing corporate strategies and local business requirements.  This requires an ability to see multiple perspectives, steer discussions towards fact-based comparisons, and drive significant net value for the enterprise.   Principal Accountabilities 50%       Architecture Planning and Development • Owns the conceptual, logical and Physical Architecture for an application (i.e. CTS, Gaoda, TIC etc. ) • Responsible for ensuring the security architecture meets the requirements provided via TGRC • Responsible for the technical architecture for solutions within their scope • Primary contact for the vendor(s) of your application(s) (including open source distribution vendors) • Responsible for ensuring Cargill roadmap items are included in vendor of your application(s) roadmap (including open source distribution vendors) • Support end-to-end application architecture integrity and the functional relationship across multiple projects and/or applications • Develops solution conceptual designs and solution blueprints • Provides support and consultation for detailed design, deployment and production support. • Responsible for maintaining solution integrity through the course of the project including controlling scope, managing solutions for change requests and clarifying solution capabilities during all delivery phases • Acts as part of the broader Cargill Architecture community to define and  execute architecture processes. • Partners with the Center-Led Portfolio Solution Architect(s) to understand the application architecture for all capabilities within the Trading portfolio (meaning the application portfolio, key APIs, transactions, etc.) and the associated roadmap • Ensures region application architecture aligns with portfolio architecture and Enterprise Architecture standards/principles 30%      Business Partnership • Work with regional Business Relationship Managers (BRMs) and businesses to establish clear connections between business goals and strategies and the process, data, and technology investments required to achieve them. • Provide consultation and recommendations for business capabilities, business process design, business intelligence design, software development design/architecture, application frameworks, and/or interfaces during the design and ongoing care of solutions. • Regularly interface with other architects, business analysts, process designers, application portfolio managers, business relationship managers, and enterprise subject matter experts to understand and evaluate application(s) capability needs. • Responsible for the definition of the architecture and technology opportunities of the application based on new and emerging technologies. Independently establish priorities and strategies, ensuring they are consistent with business goals and economic viability. 10%      Architecture Assurance • Manage adherence to defined standards throughout the design, development and implementation processes for the assigned application(s) including managing exceptions against the portfolio. • Review new projects and architecture solutions, ensuring they are aligned with the enterprise architecture and meet financial targets. • Champion data as a corporate asset, ensuring the value realization of the investments Cargill is making in the data and information areas are captured. 10%      IT Innovation & Delivery • Drives improvement of architecture methodologies and services. Supports implementation, improvements, and proper utilization of architecture tools. Ensures the quality of architecture assets, and keeps them up-to-date. Develops and maintains architecture metrics. • Maintain knowledge of industry trends and utilize this knowledge to educate both IT and the business on opportunities to build better target architectures that support and drive business decisions. • Drive the definition of the architecture and technology opportunities of the application(s) based on new and emerging technologies. • Demonstrate knowledge of a wide variety of technology disciplines. • Participates in routine and non-routine construction, automation, and implementation activities, ensuring successful implementation with architectural and operational requirements met • Assist in the design of new testing methods and resolves routine and non-routine technical issues with minimal assistance. With minimal guidance, monitors systems capacity and performance. • Participates in disaster recovery activities and contributes to disaster recovery planning.RequirementsMinimum Required Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or Management Information Systems; OR equivalent experience • 8 years business experience with diverse operational, development and business roles • 3 years experience with business process design and improvement; knowledge of Commodity Trading solutions • Experience collaborating with regional teams to define business requirements and deliver solutions that meet business goals • Experience in developing integrated solutions involving process, data, and technology • Experience with business case development • Strong conceptual, strategic thinking, problem solving, technical and analytical skills • Leadership and interpersonal skills including teamwork, facilitation and negotiation • Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders • Strong written and verbal communication skills • Strong project management, planning and organizational skills • Proven ability to work effectively within a large organization that operates using matrix management structures • Ability to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies • Ability to travel, including internationally, up to 20% • Business fluency in English   Preferred Qualifications • Knowledge of Technologies and Frameworks in Trading Systems. • Understanding of Trading platform and other providers technologies. • Business strategy development • Knowledge of all components of enterprise architecture • Industry certification

Roles & ResponsibilitiesOverview Kroll’s Business Intelligence & Investigations practice is world-renowned for our trusted experts, global resources, local insight, and actionable results. As the originator of the modern, independent internal investigation, over our 45-year history Kroll has conducted thousands of investigations worldwide. Clients have entrusted us with assisting them to resolve some of their most difficult and business critical challenges. The Human Capital team is currently looking for a Business Partner to join their International team and assist them in providing proactive support to operations across Asia (offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, Japan and India). This role would suit someone who is a team player with plenty of initiative, and is professional, capable and motivated. This is truly a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing organization and offers extraordinary learning opportunities and exposure for the right candidate. At Kroll, a division of Duff & Phelps, your work will help protect, restore and maximize value for our clients. Join us and together we’ll maximize the value of your career. Roles & Responsibilities: Human Capital Operations  Work with Human Capital Director to implement Human Capital strategies throughout all operations in Asia. Take a proactive role with the development of local Human Capital Policies and priorities in Asia. Supporting the implementation of these and other major changes as required within Asia. Support the Workforce Planning team to ensure resource plans are achieved on time and efficiently. Work with the business and the Human Capital team to identify Training & Development Needs within Asia. Ensure that key Human Capital operational processes are delivered successfully to the business (Transactional Human Capital processes/ leading performance development processes/leading annual remuneration exercises). Support the review and maintenance of policies and procedures ensuring that employment law requirements in Asia are complied with and to communicate these effectively to employees and managers. Work with the global Human Capital team on Intra-Company transfers and associated documentation Support the annual compensation process. Work with the Human Capital COE on matters relating to Benefits, Recruiting, Compensation, International Mobility. Participation in projects to improve processes/practices e.g. diversity training. Facilitation and co-ordination of the appraisal and performance management, induction, coaching, mentoring and learning and development processes within Asia. Conduct company/local induction to all new joiners within their first week of employment   Work with the Global Benefits Director on enrolling and updating employee benefit plans. Highlighting issues and recommendations based on market trends and industry knowledge as and when appropriate. Work with external vendors to ensure employees are enrolled on the company benefit schemes and accuracy of data. Highlighting any issues to the Global Benefits Director. Manage the Human Resources Information System (HRIS) for all employees within Asia.  Management Advice  Provide support and local market practice insight to the Human Capital Director, in partnership with business leadership teams, on HR issues such as reward, employee relations, talent, performance, organisational development/change, culture, leadership and learning and development. Provide management with guidance on: Company policy: interpretation and application of employment law (existing and new legislation affecting the business areas), including update briefings Counsel management on employee related issues e.g. performance management, succession planning, flexible working, maternity, absence management, disciplinaries, grievances, compensation and any other matters affecting the employment relationship.  Employee Guidance  Employee counselling and guidance on employment issues as appropriate. Provide employees with Company policy advice and information as required. RequirementsRequirements:  At least 6 years’ experience working as Human Capital generalist. Sound knowledge of Employment law within Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, Japan and India. Sound knowledge and experience in managing employment relation issues from start to finish with minimal oversight. Sound knowledge of a broad range of Human Capital areas including resourcing, reward, learning & education. Excellent communicator at all levels. Ability to build strong, positive relationships and networks across the organisation. Capable of challenging in a constructive and positive manner. Strong delivery skills. Experience of working with US/Pan European companies and start-ups. PC literate, working knowledge of MS Office, Oracle, Fusion, Taleo and an understanding of IT architecture; Prior experience of HR systems an advantage    In order to be considered for a position at Kroll, a division of Duff & Phelps, you must formally apply via careers.duffandphelps.jobs  Kroll, a division of Duff & Phelps is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

Roles & Responsibilities- Participate in all aspects of sales and customer engagement activities such as solution presentation, conducting workshops, demonstration and Proof of Concepts - Involve in gathering, understanding and scoping the requirements, sizing the efforts and providing the estimations - Provide documentations for the proposed solution with Scope of Work, Assumptions and Technical write-ups - Oversee the ongoing development and operations of a business intelligence & analytics architecture that enables fact-based decision making and ad hoc analysis and insight generation - Lead the team in delivering the Business Intelligence & Analytics solution by performing the complete SDLC, requirement gathering, analysis, design, development, installation, test and implementation of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence & Analytics solutions - Provide technical support to all team members during project execution - Collaborating with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery - Improving and streamlining processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value - Mentoring the Business Intelligence & Analytics team but also other service lines for cross selling optimization  Requirements- The Business Intelligence & Analytics Solution Architect should have minimum 6 years of consulting and end-to-end implementation experience in delivering business intelligence & analytics solutions for enterprise, ideally have a Degree in Computer Science or equivalent - Strong experience with Enterprise Business Intelligence & Analytics tools like SAS, MicroStrategy - Strong experience with Enterprise integration tools like Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, SAS DI - Strong hands-on experience in Visualization tools like Tableau, QlikSense, Power BI - Good knowledge of Big Data will be an advantage - Strong understanding of the architecture of solutions involving the above mentioned tools - Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into solution designs - Provide documentations for Architecture Design, Technical Specifications Documents, Data Modeling and Advanced Visualization Techniques - Advanced knowledge of performance optimization at all levels - Excellent communication skills with the ability to confidently communicate (verbally and written) to all levels of the business from operational to executives - Extensive pre-sales experience in solution envisioning, building demonstration, estimates, proposal development and customer presentations - Good problem solving and analytical skills - Ability to manage and work with a culturally diverse population - Ability to make decisions and deliver even within ambiguous situations   License Number: 12C6060

Roles & ResponsibilitiesNinja Van is on a mission to dominate e-commerce logistics in Southeast Asia. We are one of the fastest growing startups in the region - founded in mid-2014, we have already won over 6,000 merchants and deliver more than 2 million parcels a month across six countries. In Jan 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth. As the bridge between stakeholders and the Business Intelligence team, you’ll be responsible for making a direct impact on the business by leveraging our data capabilities. Your work will involve a mix of project management, stakeholder management and hands-on data analysis.  Spearhead the end-to-end delivery of BI projects. Gather requirements from stakeholders in Operations, Sales and Marketing and keenly understand end-user needs in every country. Work closely with data analysts and data engineering team to ensure timely delivery of projects. Clearly communicate results and actionables to stakeholders. Collaborate with them to drive adoption. Think strategically around how we address and support business needs. Develop and automate dashboards, analyses and reports to support business functions. Identify opportunities for improving operational efficiency and sales growth. Provide assistance to local teams for new project launches and major strategic initiatives. Requirements Strong communications skills Ability to empathize with people Proficiency with SQL Experience with Python, R (or other tools for statistical analysis) and data visualization tools a plus BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics More than 3 years of experience in analytics and process improvement-related initiatives Naturally curious and have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Continuous improvement mindset Passion for data Willingness to travel (~ 30% of the time)

Roles & ResponsibilitiesGlobal Information Services (GIS) has a worldwide responsibility for all IT processes, solutions and services. The aim is to further enhance HEINEKEN Global Functions by delivering common business driven solutions and services. Global Infrastructure & Data Services (IDS) has the overall responsibility of assuring that HEINEKEN’s Global infrastructure is robust, fit for purpose and cost effective. The IDS department drives the vision for all data and information related activities, which includes Master Data Management and Business Intelligence operations. The scope of IDS includes both the standards definition for Infrastructure & Data Services to enable the business, and the day-to-day support and maintenance activities for services (such as Workplace Solutions, Network, Data Centres, Security, Master Data Management). The Regional Data Quality Lead is active throughout the end-to-end data life-cycle:  Pre-projects with data cleansing, During projects with data migration and After the projects (business as usual) with continuous data improvements.   Responsible for adherence to data standards and data quality metrics by supervising OpCos and providing expert knowledge and support on Global Data Management, guiding and supporting the OpCo on their Transition Journey and usage of the Master Data and Migration part of the Transition Toolkit. Contribute to the definition of company-wide data definitions, terminology, data quality and business rules aligned to standards as set in the Enterprise Architecture Explain master data standards to the OpCo to ensure master data is cleansed correctly. Implementing data standards and buidling awareness for data quality without having managerial influence Achieving buy-in for topcis that might not be the counterpart’s priority Dynamic working environment (balancing speed and quality) Data Literacy level of the organization   Monitor Data Migration and data cleansing and enable the local data managers to ‘make it happen’ Responsible for enabling the deployment of all MDM processes, roles, governance and resources (enabling the OpCo and using the existing GDS toolset) Gain relevant stakeholder involvement and participation on data management projects Responsible for making agreements with Master Data Owners on required data quality Review metrics and initiating actions to improve performance Strive to continuously improve data to deliver the greatest business value – challenge the status quo demonstrating a continuous improvement mind-set Understand and actively communicate business benefits of making data a corporate asset Actively champion data management within projects (adhere to policies/procedures in the Region Requirements Background in FMCG Industry/large corporations is preferred Experience with governing, enforcing driving and communicating Data standards Exposure to enterprise business processes and possesses good enough business  knowledge Passion for Data Quality and Management Project management experience is a plus Experience with MDM cross functional master data like materials data, vendor data, customer data in similar business environment. Experience with the Data Quality and Data Profiling tools Able to establish credibility across business and IT Able to work in a cross functional environment Able to translate Business into Data Solution Able to gain involvement and participation on data management projects Influencing and negotiation skills Display professionalism, customer service attitude, attention to detail and quality

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Marriott Development Planning and Feasibility function in Asia Pacific is responsible for hotel underwriting, brand strategy, and business intelligence to support hotel development, conversion, and renovation/repositioning opportunities for all Marriott lodging products in Asia Pacific. These market and economic evaluations are instrumental to achieving Marriott’s expansion goals in new markets and important to the overall, long-range growth strategy of the Company. EXPECTED CONTRIBUTIONS: Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following: Hotel Underwriting:  Conduct market research and competitive assessment through conducting field work, site inspection and interviews Formulate brand & facilities program recommendations Prepare financial projections Author feasibility reports Conduct renovation and repositioning analyses for existing hotels  Brand Strategy:  Customize responses to RFPs Support new brand launch in APAC, conduct competitive landscape research and provide brand positioning recommendations  Business Intelligence:  Set Development strategy for new brands/new markets Analyze post-opening hotel performance Track competition by market and company Gather owner and real estate intelligence RequirementsDESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  5+ years of work experience in hotel consulting and/or development planning and feasibility. In-depth knowledge of the hotel industry, specifically of hotel brands and their market positioning. General understanding of the real estate industry, including hotel valuation and investment analysis. Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with the ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Strong Excel and financial modeling, written and verbal presentation skills. Ability to effectively persuade and support a position in a professional manner. Executive presence with the ability to work with and present to all levels of the organization. Exceptional critical thinking, sound judgment, and strong business acumen. Keen attention-to-detail, high degree of initiative and resourcefulness, as well as a service-oriented attitude. Strong interpersonal and organizational skills; ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities. Strong command of English language a must; fluency in Asian languages is preferred. Ability to travel extensively.

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAssistant of Sales & Marketing is responsible for leading the entire Sales & Marketing operations in the region and successfully leading sales/marketing initiatives to become a key driver for the company growth and its reputation in the region mainly by: Sales & Marketing team & functions development including Sales Management, Product Marketing, Retail Marketing and Brand Marketing, focusing on building operational excellence to place the company in a position capable of achieving the growth and profitability targets.  Leading Sales & Marketing strategy and go-to-market initiatives – driving and managing the best projects to build a fast-growing sustainable business in the region through enhancing customer relations & satisfaction, brand awareness & consideration, channel expansion & transparency, sales-force effectiveness & capabilities, and portfolio leadership & productivity. Cross-functionally managing Sales & Marketing performance & compliance, detecting key gaps and deviations across categories and countries to proactively design and take the best action plans to assure the achievement of desired results and milestones. Bridging across functions, countries and product divisions to assure functional excellence, execution consistency and that regional synergies are explored.  The responsibilities and activities from the Assistant of Sales & Marketing Manager are: Sales/Marketing Planning  Lead development/revision of annual Business Plans (BP) from countries, and support local Sales & Marketing planning. Assure the correct development of Regional Annual Product Marketing Plan & Roadmaps, including targets and investment per country and category. Overseeing the development of Regional Annual Retail Marketing Plan, including targets and investment per country and channel. Assure the development of Regional Annual Brand Marketing Plan, including targets and investment per country and category and channel. Develop the Sales & Marketing resources planning, assigning required resources to initiatives according to their contribution to the business from a cross-function perspective.  Sales/Marketing Management  Supervise correct implementation of Sales & Marketing operation frameworks, rules & standards at regional and country level. To oversee marketing communication plans and assets to ensure the assets developed in the way of “ON BRAND”. Follow-up, guide and design entire Sales & Marketing projects and initiatives to assure among others, the correct product pricing and portfolio competitiveness, field-force and in-store productivity, retail and channel transparency, as well as brand awareness and consideration. Review performance to proactively design and take the best action plans to assure the achievement of desired results. Bridging across functions, countries and product divisions to assure functional excellence, execution consistency and that regional synergies are explored. Manage the Sales & Marketing team to assure their fair evaluation, as well as their motivation, engagement and overall performance with the company. Control the department optimized resources utilization from a cross-functional perspective, as well as partner selection based on their capabilities.  Sales/Marketing Development  Develop effective regional brand activation strategies with the compliance of brand positioning and brand guideline. Brand activation strategies including but not limited to sponsoring strategy, brand ambassador strategy, social media strategy, Digital eco-system strategy and PR strategy Assure the development of regional Product Portfolio excellence according to consumer needs and business objectives in the region and enabling their timely launching in the markets. Overseeing the roll-out of an effective retail strategy, including regional customer relationships, activations/displays, training programs & campaigns/events to maximize channel penetration and company sales.  Sales/Marketing Intelligence  Enable the research and understanding of home appliances categories / product lines in the region, negotiating with partner when required. Make sure to collect critical market information, including the necessary information to track pricing and monitoring competitor launches. Lead internal teams to structure the information gathering and business intelligence system that will enable the decision-making process in the company. RequirementsExperience & Background  7+ years of experience in Sales and Marketing is required. Prior experience in Home Appliance companies is required, and background on key regional markets is preferred. Understanding of sales & marketing operational frameworks and dynamics for a successful go-to-market. Proficient in MS Office products including Excel, PowerPoint and Word is required.  Frequently business trips

Roles & ResponsibilitiesDemand Management:   Responsible for all forecasting activities associated with customers and products. Creates and Maintains forecast models for Commercial partners, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from Sales, Marketing, Finance. Acts as the integration point of Sales and Commercial Organization, interfaces with fulfillment operations teams with the expected sales outlook. (0-36 months) Leads and/or facilitates the regular dialogue in Sales and Operation Planning, driving consensus of action plans to address risk and opportunities for the market.  Fulfillment:   Ensure 0 – 12 weeks Order fulfillment to last internal customer (Supply of Finished Goods to market or regional DC or direct to customer / BtB) Primary point of contact for Demand Planners to ensure supply of finished goods Primary point of contact for Site Planners (to manage demand or supply exception)  MAIN RESPONSBILITIES – Demand Management   Carry out and agree on Market Segmentation (Business Value Segmentation)   Create an unconstrained consensus forecast for the market / cluster in monthly buckets (statistical modelling and adjustments)   Maintain demand parameters for the portfolio, manage baseline, upside and downside scenarios   Assess trends, risks and opportunities together with the Commercial teams   Review Gap to Financial Plan   Monitor Forecast consumption vs demand and work with fulfilment managers to respond to forecast evolution during the cycle   Escalate short term demand issues (unavoidable demand) to fulfilment planners / managers   Perform Forecast Performance Analysis   Provide input to Supply Planning organization in developing inventory strategies on existing, new and phase out products   Product Lifecycle Management (New Launch to Deletion)   Demand Review Process   Create Statistical Forecasts (where applicable): 	o Gather, analyse and validate data 	o Review resulting statistical forecast model 	o Apply error analysis techniques to improve forecasting 	o Summarize / Aggregate   Review sales plans , customer finance Budget Updates or Latest Estimates and demand drivers: 	o Present, solicit, and assess feedback on the various forecasts from sales, and finance 	o Recommend adjustments for operational forecasts 	o Review promotional plans with sales   Achieve consensus for operational demand forecasts by facilitating a collaborative demand review process with sales, marketing and finance teams: 	o Prepare relevant material to facilitate review and discussion   Maintain demand planning system and software 	o Enter and modify data and ensure the correctness of product hierarchy 	o Monitor trends in forecast error 	o Identify relevant market-related data and competitive intelligence)   Prepare and maintain relevant reports pertaining to demand planning process   Key Results   A customer demand forecast which incorporates current and accurate market information that allows the company to correctly predict customer demand and provide its supply chain with the appropriate information to plan how to meet that customer demand.   Improved relationships among planners, sales, marketing and finance, which will lead to effective knowledge sharing and an optimal consensus forecast to better guide the company.   Refined systems and methods to continually improve forecasts so that the company can better anticipate customer needs.   Execute with excellence in the area of customer replenishment and feedback to the Fulfillment group the opportunities and risks regarding customer replenishment performance metrics.   Forecast Accuracy - Lead improvement plans across markets utilizing various Root Cause Analysis methods   MAIN RESPONSBILITIES – Fulfillment Management   Supply Operational Excellence:   Review RR exceptions escalated by the site in the firm zone (0-12wks)   Escalate and communicate demand changes to relevant stakeholders (ie Forecast fluctuations, tenders, tenders, promotion, regulatory driven changes etc…), and partner with GHH stakeholders, Demand Planner, E2E Planner and/or Sites to balance supply vs demand   Ensuring Supply timelines for new product launch, network transfer, divestiture, source change, RBO projects.   Escalate supply issues arising from market inventory management   Tier Process: Communicate supply constraints and issues to relevant GHH, SCM stakeholders   Execute allocations or priorities for the Market or Region in case of supply constraints   Manage FG post-release activities and communicate urgency (expedite requirements) to Site Logistics and/or Shipping Documentation team   Systems Operational Excellence:   Maintain clean demand signal to the site (eg: old sales order; Item code status, abnormal change of demand consumption…). This includes partnering with AP Order Management team to ensure finished goods Sales Order and Purchase Order timeliness and accuracy   Responsible for APO & ECC data setup like item master, ECC and APO replenishment planning parameters.   Support system enhancements roll outs for Supply Planning System (eg APO/ECC, RR, Tier Workflows)   Process Excellence:   Review performance metrics for the Market or Region (for example OTIF, LIFR, IRL, Sales projection (EEMEA), Forecast consumption)   Support from a Supply perspective, sessions of Market Demand Review and/or Sales and Operations Planning process   Execute Replenishment Planning align to global planning calendar (in accordance to GOM’s principles of Month in a life, Week in a Life of a Planner)   Key connections: 	o Demand Planner 	o Site Planners 	o E2E Planner (multi-market allocations or escalations) 	o Regional Supply Planner / Regional Market Fulfillment Manager 	o In-Market Distribution team 	o Order Management and Shipping documentation team 	o Data Coordinator 	o Regional Transportation teams  Requirements   Bachelor's degree (preferred) APICS CPIM or CSCP certification highly desirable 3 – 5 years Related experience in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing environment or related production industry experience preferred. 3 – 5 years Related experience in managing with multiple planning (ERP) systems and interfaces Related experience in metric reporting environment Green Belt certified Sigma/LEAN operational excellence experience is highly preferred.  	Leadership, Professional and Functional Competencies A strong team player with excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills and ability to operate in a matrix environment Strong problem solving and resolution skills Strong analytical and presentation skills Keen driver for process improvement Deep understanding of Business dynamics and Supply Chain Excellent attention to detail. Working knowledge of inventory, planning systems and order/purchasing systems Working knowledge of planning software and system interfaces Working knowledge of Microsoft based systems (Strong Excel and Access) with regard to development of reports, measurements and analyses tools. Working knowledge of SAP ECC and APO is a must. APICS certified

In dimensional modeling, architect the design of slowly changing dimensions, and implementation of the CDC processes Primary responsibility of performance and reliability of Data Models including performance tuning, monitoring and error reporting Primary responsibility of converting Analytics Demand Request(ADR) to Analytics Technical Specification(ATS) for Data Architecture workstream Primary responsibility of mapping Source System business process to field definitions including any transformation and business rules   Primary responsibility of establishment of Data Policies, Standards and Architecture encompassing     Data modeling/Data classification/Data Integration and Exchange/Metadata management/Business Intelligence     Establish Data Architecture standards and set development methods like shared staging area, common methods of key generation, look-up of shared referenced data, retention of processed data or files and naming conventions Establish Data Security controls and authorization and embed at every level of the architecture Monitor, enforce and audit Data Regulatory Compliance Identify, design, and implement data process improvements including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability Automation of data architecture including data scrubbing activities   Working with day to day Repository Management activities like Model Merging, User Role Creation, User Access Grants, Model Freezing and Model Version Management Primary responsibility for reverse engineering and synchronizing existing legacy data models     RequirementsCompetencies & Personal Traits  Ability to communicate clearly and concisely; both verbally and in writing Demonstrates ability to effectively create presentations and communicate concepts to stakeholders using various software applications Ability to work effectively on projects within a collaborative team environment Ability to complete tasks with accuracy, strong attention to detail and in a timely manner  Working Experience  Prior experience with LIFE/Asia and GROUP/Asia AS/400 technology data models mandatory Subject matter expertise in data architecture including conceptual modeling to logical and physical modeling. Highly experienced in meta data management, data transformation, and data integration Subject matter expertise in OLAP and relational modeling (3NF/OLTP) with a wide repertoire of insurance domain experiences  Expertise in processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Millions to Billions of rows) of data Subject Matter Expertise in Hadoop tools – Spark, Hive, Impala, Pig, Sqoop, Hue, Kafka, etc Subject Matter Expertise in SQL database technologies, data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI) as well as using ERwin or other data modeling software   Education  Masters/Degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) with 10 years of professional experience

Roles & ResponsibilitiesStrategic and Operational Planning:  Serves as an integral partner of the MA-AO FM professionals (e.g., Medical Science Liaison (MSLs) and/or Medical Advisors) with a focus on strategic and tactical operational planning and execution, and process documentation and improvement. Responsible for coordinating processes/ procedures across TAs for FM professionals with oversight from the regional Associate Director of Medical Standards & Excellence. In conjunction with regional Associate Director of Medical Standards & Excellence, represents MA-AO in the weekly global MSL Task Force meetings to achieve global harmonization in FM organization management.  FM On-Boarding Program and Training:  Enhances the MA-AO FM on-boarding curricula to ensure consistent implementation of FM capabilities and lower turnover rate within MA-AO FM organization. This includes development of new FM training content based on identified training gaps. Maintains the MA-AO FM on-boarding program by delivering live FM capability trainings and tracking on-boarding completion status for all new FM professionals.   In conjunction with MA-AO leadership, drives implementation of organizational management FM tools including organization profile updates, organization classification refresh, organization playbook/tools updates/revision.   FM Performance Management:  Responsible for development, implementation, execution, analytics and reporting of FM performance data that measure progress to business goals.   Generates regular MA-AO FM interaction summary reports for MA-AO leadership by pulling data from the medical CRM system into a Business Intelligence (BI) tool (i.e. Tableau). Collaborates with global Data Repositories and Metrics and Analytics team on the global harmonization of FM Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).  Medical CRM and other MA Systems:  Provides strategic oversight to FM IT tools/systems and is involved in identification of system acquisitions or upgrades to support the changing business needs of FM professionals and MA-AO overall. Partners with regional Business Resolution & Systems team to achieve integration of medical CRM with other MA systems (i.e. Medical Information, Non-Promotional Medical Material Review, etc.). Manages the medical CRM managed service vendor to address system related inquiries. Serves as department super user for medical CRM and conduct regular system training to end-users. Maintains the MA-AO medical Key External Expert (KEE) database and other internal data sets that feed into the medical CRM system.  Medical Insights:  Consolidates/analyzes medical insights gathered from FM interactions and other MA-led activities (e.g. advisory boards, medical congresses, medical information enquiries, published literature) on a monthly basis through close collaboration with the regional TA leads. Develops and implements transparent processes to gather competitive intelligence (CI) and external insights through alignment with Global Insights and Training lead. Establishes a consistent communication channel for medical insights to be effectively shared with MA- and cross functional team members. Requirements Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, or equivalent, in science or health-related field required. Minimum 2 years of SKI (MSL and/or Medical Advisor) experience required. Strong problem solving and analytical skills with an ability to resolve project issues independently. Excellent project management and organization skills.    Established understanding of medical affairs function and practices. Excellent organizational and writing skills, highly detail-oriented, committed to meeting deadlines, and effective communicator at all levels. Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated experience of effectively working across multiple countries. Fluent in English language - written & verbal. Excellent understanding of personnel/responsibilities within Group/Affiliates  Ensures content is submitted per requested timelines. Understands and is able to effectively communicate methodology used in analyzing and reporting data contained in the routine reports to affiliate MA and functional SMEs in their MA Region/Group

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers.   Manages a team that provides extensive, highly structured consulting engagements across a range of disciplines. Establishes and employs standard sales techniques and operational best practices in delivering consulting engagements, including (as needed) problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training and deployment. Ensures close coordination of efforts with sales and account teams, including renewal and conversion processes, acquisitions, global expansion and RFP responses.   Manages team to provide project management guidance and oversight of key engagements to ensure successful implementations. Effectively balances resources across multiple projects to ensure customer needs are met. Determines the viability of customer-driven requests for computer-related systems, third party tools and connectivity solutions including front, mid and back office. Ensures team provides status to the field on product updates, enhancements/service changes as well as technical/business presentations to customers. Works with customer technology personnel to ensure a smooth migration from other GDS systems to Sabre, including any integration of third-party technologies.   Manages a team of customer facing technical account managers across the Asia-Pacific region.  This teams manages the technical relationships with Global Accounts, focused on these customers’ APAC business,”  product development, product management, implementation, APIs, application, deployment.RequirementsMinimum 8 years related experience; minimum 5 years prior management/supervisory experience preferred. Advanced computer software skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to lead and direct multiple projects simultaneously; ability to delegate work to subordinate employees; proven leadership ability. At Sabre, we are fortunate to have the resources of a large company paired with the culture of a startup. Our company culture includes casual work environments, employee amenities, flexible work arrangements, and exceptional learning opportunities. And, you will be surrounded by intelligent team members who you will be proud to call your peers. To learn more about the people and culture at Sabre, follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Sabre is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Middleware Engineering team is part of the Distributed Systems Operations & Engineering and is responsible for common middleware and integration infrastructure that supports communication between multiple enterprise applications and multiple business lines.  A systems Architect will have exposure to a broad set of Middleware technologies and be constantly challenged to optimize Middleware Infrastructure. The ideal candidate should have a successful record of accomplishment of dealing with various aspects of Middleware infrastructure management. A successful candidate must possess excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, be able to translate business and technical requirements into workable technical solutions, and strive to automate manual processes wherever possible. This role will be responsible for overseeing Middleware technologies, provide technical expertise to Middleware Engineers, evaluate and sunset legacy technology, onboard new/open source technology in order to align with organizational long-term plan. Work with higher management to understand Long term Strategy and align the Middleware products to meet the requirement. Work with Middleware Engineer to improve the process and documentation in order to provide best class service to our partners. The responsibility includes working with Global systems, Global Operations, Cybersecurity and external Integration partners in implementing  solutions via current or proposed middleware technologies, including but not limited to Application Servers(WebLogic, WebSphere, tomcat, JBOSS, etc.), Web Servers, Oracle SOA, Oracle BPM, Oracle Business Intelligence, Oracle Identity Management and Java/J2EE applications. He or she must be able to collaborate with others to manage and rationalize incoming requirements in order to implement appropriate solutions.   Key Responsibilities  Excellent understanding of most of the Middleware technologies including Web server, Application Server, Messaging, Caching, Reporting, Integration technologies etc. Understanding of Cloud and Container technologies Responsible in assessing current technology stack and designing solutions moving to Cloud based technologies, shared APIs, micro services on established standards and in following DevOps/Agile methodologies. In-depth knowledge on various Security vulnerabilities on Middleware Products and possible fixes. Develop road-map for various Middleware Products used across visa. Drive proof-of-concept projects to validate new feature sets and 3rd party technologies to onboard new Middleware technologies in order to align with Long term strategy. Define and document standards across all Middleware products and work with Middleware Engineers to make sure everyone align to the defined standards. Ensure standard artifacts are updated on time and they are relevant. Collaborate with Automation team to define scope for Middleware product Automation including regular BAU tasks. Able to communicate Middleware standards to Product Development teams, executive management and drive teams to use the standard. Collaborate with internal customer groups across all disciplines (i.e., System engineers, networking, database administration, performance management, application development and production support teams, IT governance team) and provide SME level input to design new applications using on Middleware products. Provide implementation and support design for DevOps/Continuous Integration and Delivery pipeline (CI/CD) for application and software update. Must be able to analyze historical data and plan for future Middleware Product strategy. Collaborate with IT Asset Management team during ELA discussion Monitor the processes, policies, procedures and standards applicability, effectiveness and efficiency. Ability to review complex processes, manage standards and provide regular technical reports both verbal and statistical showing status of Middleware Strategy. Manage vendor relationship and understand upcoming changes to Middleware technologies. Responsible for defining/maintaining and updating Technical Security Requirement (TSR) checklist for middleware technologies to comply and support Visa policies and procedures.   Requirements BS or MS in Computer Science or related degree from an accredited university. 10+ years’ experience working on various Middleware Products which includes at least 5+ years in Middleware Architect Role. Excellent record of accomplishment on Architecting Middleware Environments. In-depth knowledge on core Middleware Products including Application servers, Web servers, Messaging, Caching, Reporting, Integration technologies etc. Excellent understanding of Java, .Net, SSL, TLS and troubleshooting infrastructure issues. Should be able to adapt to fast moving technologies. Experience with Automation and scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash). Exceptional oral and written communication skills. Excellent understanding of both UNIX and windows platform.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesCPM Consulting, a BackOffice Associates, LLC Company, provides professional consulting services on SAP technology in aligning, designing and implementing SAP solutions for business planning, budgeting and financial consolidation, business intelligence and analytics, technology innovation and creative solution delivery with exclusive focus on Enterprise Performance Management and SAP BPC for an organization. CPM Consulting has delivered SAP EPM (Enterprise Performance Management) solutions for more than a decade for 100+ blue chip companies. We deliver best practice solutions tailored to your business and your industry. Our strength is to provide best-in-class performance management solutions using the latest SAP Enterprise Performance Management tools available in the market.   We work with CFO’s across the globe to achieve their risk adjusted strategic goals. CPM Consulting provides a unique, integrated approach to performance management that can support better decisions by helping organizations improve their ability to analyze a wide range of financial, operational, competitive and marketplace information. In this position the SAP Technical Consultant will be responsible for working with the latest SAP technologies on a global scale. You will assist business transformation teams in developing and delivering solutions that collect, transform, analyze and report data. You will define game-changing strategies for client providing critical knowledge and value at strategic, tactical and operational levels.  Base Location:  Singapore Responsibilities:  Should have strong Knowledge on General Accounting Principles and financial reporting. Should have knowledge in financial reports / Budgeting / Planning. Should be well versed with Excel  (for better Account’s reconciliation and validation’s) Should be able to perform root cause analysis and provide solutions Development and testing of client deliverables as per design provided. Issue and error resolution for client deliverables. Quality and error free documentation of project deliverables. Ensure quality and timeliness in deliverables. Compliance to all project and organization related processes and policies. Participation in trainings and workshops as nominated by manager. Testing deliverables and supporting applications. Complying with all company security policies and procedures. Ensuring company and client confidentiality. RequirementsQualifications:  Educational background preferably: M.Com / MBA Finance / CA / ICWA / Financial Diplomas. Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science or other related analytical or technical disciplines. SAP Finance / Controlling / SAP BPC certificate is an additional plus. Should have Strong Communication and Interpersonal Skills Good to have deep understanding of Database concepts ( SAP BW / BI ) Exposure to Financial Business process is a plus (FI / AP / AR) Flexibility in Travelling    Number of vacancies: 3 Years of experience: Fresh graduates are welcome to apply Salary range: $3,000 to $5,000

Informatica:  At least 5 years’ experience in data architecture & modeling, data integration & warehousing (ETL), data visualization & analytics (BI) Having thorough knowledge on Enterprise Data architecture principles and standards, best practices, industry standards Coordinate software releases, service pack upgrades with product managers, development, QA and infrastructure teams. job_title: Transportation and Freight Solution consultant – Asia Pacific
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis position requires operational and technical expertise and knowledge of Transport/Freight Management Systems (TMS/FMS) supporting the service/sector/solution. This individual is accountable for functionally supporting comprehensive and complex IT work streams in regional and global projects of Transport/Freight Management Systems from inception to delivery including planning and design. This resource interacts with internal and external customers, IT department managers, and various technical teams. The resource uses consultative skills to drive project momentum, manage expectations/risks, communicate effectively, and represents the business in technical meetings. The resource will also ideally be able to derive business intelligence solutions to assist the business and operations in better decision making. The resource will be trained in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and will be required to take on the development of some automation solutions as well. Pre-existing knowledge of RPA is a plus. Key Accountabilities Main areas of focus and accountability of the role – detail in order of importance the main areas of accountability of the role: 1.Subject Matter Expert in the TMS/FMS application(s) and related processes. Provide system demonstrations as needed to Sr. Management or customer executives. 2.Manage TMS projects from inception through delivery ensuring completion of the project objectives on schedule and within budget constraints. 3.Manage a pipeline of Change requests and solutioning work for the FMS Space 4.Develop detailed project charter and plan (goals, objectives, strategy, scope, budget, scheduling, risk mitigation strategies, contingency plans, approach, requirements, deliverables, timelines, work breakdown structures, use case, test case, and training needs) utilizing project management disciplines and methodologies including process analysis, mapping and flow charting to ensure synchronization of processes and systems. 5.Perform the role of a TMS/FMS Functional Consultant, capture business requirements in detail and then translate in to a Functional Design Document. Able to configure TMS system to suit the business rules, able to on-board customers onto the FMS platform 6.Engage key stakeholders, define and coordinate activities, communicate changes and progress, build commitment, overcome resistance, implement change management and lead the project team. Conduct regularly scheduled project briefings regarding status, issues, and challenges with all levels of business unit, business sponsors and management for all projects and implementations. 7.Define and derive business intelligence solutions, creating dashboards on Tableau as needed to help the business in decision making 8.Provide mentoring and guidance to develop other team members, including training and knowledge transfer. Responsible for all administrative activities for the team. 9.Create automation solutions (post training), using Automation anywhere. This position requires operational and technical expertise and knowledge of Transport/Freight Management Systems (TMS/FMS) supporting the service/sector/solution. This individual is accountable for functionally supporting comprehensive and complex IT work streams in regional and global projects of Transport/Freight Management Systems from inception to delivery including planning and design. This resource interacts with internal and external customers,  IT department managers, and various technical teams. The resource uses consultative skills to drive project momentum, manage expectations/risks, communicate effectively, and represents the business in technical meetings. The resource will also ideally be able to derive business intelligence solutions to assist the business and operations in better decision making. The resource will be trained in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and will be required to take on the development of some automation solutions as well. Pre-existing knowledge of RPA is a plusRequirementsEducation & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Computer Science or Business Administration or equivalent experience in logistics operations, such as distribution, transportation, warehousing. Knowledge of MS Project, Powerpoint, Word, Excel, Visio, etc. Logistics certifications or training Project Management certifications or training Experience 5+ years hands on implementation and project management experience with Transport Management Systems Functional knowledge of Transportation Management Systems (TMS) Functional knowledge of Freight Management Systems (FMS) 5+ years in transport/freight management domain 3+ years project management of a team of IT professionals Complex IT Project Management experience Regional, multi-country implementation experience Knowledge of transport operations and supply chain management activities Sales support and commercial Creation of dashboards/reporting Specialist Knowledge & Skills Business acumen and solid knowledge of applications and implementing logistics technologies. Knowledge in project management methodologies is required. Able to manage self and team effectively in a dynamic, matrix environment. Able to guide customers towards the solution that best fits their needs and aligns with CEVA’s technical capabilities. Able to manage the pressures of cost-effectively selling the right solution. Able to translate technical terms to operational teams and vice versa. Able to perform technical analysis and produce effective business requirements documentation. Possess analytical skills enabling trouble-shooting on software and hardware. Capable of delivering written and graphical work products and presentation materials. Skilled in presenting technology solution to internal / external customers in formal or informal situations Tableau RPA (Robotic process automation) Interpersonal & Communication Skills Fluent and articulate in Business English Ideally, one other language prevalent in AP region Positive & professional attitude in stressful environments Self-motivated, self-managed Interface effectively with customers or others associated with the project or assignment. Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to successfully multi-task and establish appropriate priorities. Ability to effectively participate as a team player or leader. Possess excellent follow-up skills. Responsible and Commited.

address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: YouTube and Video YouTube has grown into a community used by over 1 billion people across the globe to access information, share video, and shape culture. The YouTube team helps budding creators build careers, creates products like YouTube Kids, YouTube Music, and YouTube Gaming, and engages communities around shared passions and global conversations. Together, we empower the world to create, broadcast, and share. The role: Associate, Strategy, YouTube - Singapore The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. YouTube’s partner ecosystem is constantly growing and evolving, and it is critical to deploy resources efficiently to serve YouTube’s advertisers, publishers and users globally. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, analysts on the team focus on one or more of 5 key areas: Developing and analyzing new strategic initiatives, roll-out/implementation support in APAC, annual country planning, quarterly/monthly reporting for YouTube's APAC leadership, and market intelligence.   You will frame and structure solutions to key business problems, analyzing data and applying critical thinking to make recommendations to business teams and support operations.  You will work cross-functionally with YouTube's Sales, Product, Engineering, Marketing, Finance, and HR teams. You will also work closely with the Regional and country leadership teams and globally to help them grow YouTube.  You will become an expert on YouTube’s business model and operations, as well as data or business intelligence systems, and will apply your analytical experience to help inform content strategy and optimize business operations. From scoping to analysis to implementation, you will own projects end-to-end and act as a resource for other global teams in completing their projects. Responsibilities:  Research and analyze key business drivers, competitive environment, opportunities, trends and operating metrics; communicate effectively with various stakeholders. Execute sophisticated quantitative data that translates into actionable insights; develop business models that evaluate the ROI of key partnerships, and implement complex financial structures. Analyze research data and synthesize raw information into insights, recommendations, dashboards and reports; prepare presentations and clearly communicate findings from initiatives to management and to the broader organization. Own part of larger initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis in order to provide proactive support in execution of global business development strategic priorities. Support the regional YouTube Management Team in driving their business by providing insights, reports and help with annual planning. RequirementsMinimum qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of relevant experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, media, online video, corporate finance, sales finance, or investment banking. Experience with financial modeling with spreadsheet and presentation software. Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.  Preferred qualifications:  Experience in the consumer Internet and media industries. Familiarity with database query, statistical analysis, and/or SQL coding. Project management experience and proven track-record of process excellence and producing high quality outputs (models, data insights, presentations to senior audiences). Fluency in one Asian language (ie. Japanese or Mandarin).

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou are excited by the prospect of operating on the cutting edge of technology and the financial markets. You build relationships quickly and effortlessly, and you're the organiser amongst your friends- the person who knows what it really takes just to get things done. You enjoy solving problems- you're a solution provider who has a natural eye for detail. You love dealing with people, you thrive in a team environment, and you're that person who knows what customer service really means. Our Team We are the Project Management & Support arm of the Content Acquisition and Business Management group (or CABM for short). We form an integral part of the Global Data department, and we're responsible for acquiring and publishing all OTC pricing data which makes Bloomberg products so powerful. Specifically we're the ones who manage the design, building and troubleshooting of the site-to-site technology that links data providers up to Bloomberg. In order to do this we need to build strong and lasting relationships with these organisations, have a thorough understanding of the technology they use, and ultimately offer outstanding support to them. We'll trust you to - Manage and support a client base of existing data contributors- helping them to maintain and expand their contributed content on Bloomberg - Find best practices for monitoring thousands of data points for accuracy & timeliness -Troubleshoot a variety of issues via the iconic Bloomberg helpdesk, on the phone and in person, while providing platinum support to data contributors and consumers - Leverage our business intelligence tools to spot trends and pro-actively address recurring customer issues - Work closely with our Content Specialists , Project Management and Terminal Sales teams to really understand the data contributors and data consumers’ needs and assist them with any queries they have - Find technical solutions to help automate our clients’ workflows and make our internal processes more efficient What's in it for you? - Opportunities to work closely with key players in the financial industry, including traders and market data managers - Work with a global team of motivated technical specialists and data analysts - Partner with business managers and our Engineering teams to enhance our products and exceed our customers' expectations - Autonomy to develop your own ideas and strategies for the markets which you cover - Real potential for exciting and varied career-progressionRequirementsYou'll need to have - Excellent communication skills and a desire to work directly with customers - Interest in technical troubleshooting and project implementation - Keen interest in the financial markets (although past experience is not required) - Meticulous attention to detail - Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience - Business-level fluency in Japanese and English We'd love you to have - Prior experience in a client-facing support role - Some experience with business intelligence tools - Experience of working with technical infrastructure within a financial organization If this sounds like you Apply! If we think you're a good match we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_title: Principal Manager, Digital Product / Project Manager [Partners and Operations Division]
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities We are looking for a Principal Manager to undertake the role of the product owner for WSG’s job portal (MyCareersfuture.sg) using Agile development.   You will also be expected to supervise both an internal team of product owners as well as handle our appointed technical and developer partners.    Managing product strategy, roadmap and lifecycle from internal resources, teams, capabilities and vendors from ideation to rapid concept prototyping Ability to break down propositions into requirements from different cross functional delivery teams Developing ways to quickly test our product quantitatively (e.g., A/B testing) and qualitatively (e.g., user testing). Optimizing the product using data analytics and user feedback Refining customer experience for new capabilities in partnership with 3rd-party solution provider, marketing, and other key stakeholders.  Completive assessments, research new technologies & services, assess competitors, and new entrants    You will also be required to have the following skills: Project Management  Define and manage project scope and implementation Manage project timelines and resources effectively Monitor project outcomes    People Management  Able to work in effectively in a team Able to work with vendors and communicate requirements effectively    Data Analysis  Analyse data and trends and make recommendations on improvements  Understand product management metrics    Decision Making   Able to effectively assess and make recommendations    Requirements  Tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience in a relevant field Excellent communication skills with the ability to work closely with both product owners and engineers Good knowledge of data platforms, including assessment of technical requirements At least 3 years of experience in data analytics, or business intelligence 5-7 years of experience as a product owner in agile teams

description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities
The Associate Lecturers will contribute and deliver module(s) in the following area(s):• Modules under the Full-Time Diploma in Business Applications, example: Healthcare Applications.• Modules under the Full-Time Diploma in Business Information Systems, example: Object Oriented Programming, Web Applications in .NET, Business Intelligence.Associate Lecturers are to be able to commit to at least two days per week to class facilitation, and able to perform invigilation duties when required.
