Roles & ResponsibilitiesDATAVLT is looking for a business development rockstar to join our team in Singapore.  About DATAVLT   At DATAVLT, we’re on a mission to make life easier for our users by providing an innovative, on-demand data analytics platform integrated with blockchain to help business owners understand their data, gain insights and make sharper decisions while continuing to focus on developing their business and scaling efficiently.  RequirementsDATAVLT is looking for a business development rockstar to join our team in Singapore.  About DATAVLT   At DATAVLT, we’re on a mission to make life easier for our users by providing an innovative, on-demand data analytics platform integrated with blockchain to help business owners understand their data, gain insights and make sharper decisions while continuing to focus on developing their business and scaling efficiently.  Responsibilities    Business development: Creating / managing a pipeline of potential partners; must be articulate when reaching out via phone, in person or email; must be able to support in complex negotiations and drive deal closure Account management: Ensuring a smooth on-boarding experience for partners with a focus on addressing and predicting their concerns. Taking ownership for timely resolution of partners' queries and needs is a critical Reporting and following up: Presenting analysis and ideas in a clear, concise manner and executing follow ups like a hawk Help grow the business to become a billion dollar empire with aspirations of global domination  Requirements  The ideal candidate should have   ·         Excellent communication skills ·         Strong sense of pride and ownership towards the job ·         An outgoing personality, convincing and can communicate with partners easily ·         A good ability to understand and appreciate new technologies & its application (AI / Blockchain) ·         Great analytical skills ·         Fluency in English and Mandarin ·         Previous track record of success with sales and business development    What's in it for you   Here at DATAVLT, we provide an awesome culture for growth and development:  A unique opportunity for exponential growth & experience. (How much you develop is only limited by your appetite) Autonomy in the role to be creative in spotting opportunities & to develop partnerships Attain an in-depth understanding of the Data Analytics & Blockchain Open work culture Attractive remuneration Be yourself, be engaged and have fun while you’re at it

job_title: SVP / VP, Regional Collection Transformation Deputy Head , Risk Management Group (1800042L）
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Function  Risk Management Group (RMG) is responsible for the development and maintenance of risk management and internal control frameworks. We provide independent review and challenge to business to ensure that appropriate balance is considered in risk/return decisions. In addition, RMG is responsible for the monitoring and reporting on key risk issues of the Bank. To manage risk effectively and deliver strong financial performance, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. Responsibilities  Objective:  After ANZ integration, there are more collection activities in terms of reviewing collection strategies to drive portfolio performance for both Indonesia & Taiwan with the increased consumer portfolios. Also, India continues to grow their unsecured products i.e. Credit Cards to be launched in 2019, regional collection support may need to increase for these 3 countries. Hence, we would need to hire a Regional Collection Transformation Head role to focus and lead the countries into transforming to the digital Collection model.   The Regional Collection Transformation Head will also be identified as the successor for the Regional Collection Head. This is to ensure continuity for the Regional Collection Head role for succession planning purposes.  Regional Collection Head Back-up   Able to strategize the digital Collection roadmap in the region Be a back-up to the Regional Collection Head role in her absence Lead the Country Collection Heads in the region to drive collection efficiency  Work with L&D to plan Collection Trainings to upskill or reskill collection staff for the digital Collection model    Digital Transformation Journey  Lead countries on digital initiatives for the collection transformation journey   Be a part of the Regional Collection team that drive the digital transformation journey across the region (6 markets)  Support strategic vision for an Instant Contextual Ever-Ready (I.C.E.) operating model in CBG/WM Credit, focusing on innovation, quality & control, productivity and future-skilling Work closely with Country Collection Heads & their one-down to identify opportunities to enable digitalization and innovation in our collection management processes & data analytics.  Co-create the target operating model for the digital future, including preparing roadmap/ initiatives to upskill our people for new digital roles   Performance Monitoring and Improvement  Assist in setting the regional strategic direction and phase of each country based on the current infrastructure, operation management standard and gap analysis. Assist in review of respective country collection initiatives and process improvement  Track and monitor key collection strategy implementations in all locations Track the progress of strategic changes made in accordance to plan and manage issues escalated with relevant stakeholders Assist to track closure of audit issues with the countries, where applicable To participate in continuous improvement in risk tools implementation and relevant industry best practices Requirements Have ever assumed a Collection Head role preferably for the SVP position  Good grasp of Collection best practices and processes; Good knowledge of Collection system and Collection MIS & performance analysis. Preferably at least 8 years of Collection experience in consumer lending business Entrepreneurial mindset, has courage to challenge status quo, take initiatives to design, adapt, experiment and deliver value Has appetite to build functional breadth in credit & collection skills and business knowledge through parallel learning, observation and participation Able to assimilate new information quickly Possess critical thinking skills, able to ask questions and connect the dots Able to manage ambiguity and complexities Digital savvy with good understanding of using data analytics and new technology tools to drive change Good communicator and strong interpersonal skills, able to manage a diverse group of cross-border and cross-functional stakeholders Strong problem solving skills Self-driven, able to work independently and as a team player Display high Relationship-Led, Innovative and Decisive traits

categories: Admin / Secretarial, Consulting , Banking and Finance, General Management
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBrink's Singapore is a wholly owned subsidiary of Brink's, Incorporated. Established in 1989, we service banks and retailers and we are currently looking for a dynamic individual to join the Singapore Team as Business Process Manager focusing on business processes from conception to implementation; reviewing continuous improvement; and introducing innovation that leads to impactful results. The Role:  Manage business process assessments using data analytics and lean management principles; Design cost effective solutions that enhance processes; Undertake implementation activities as a project manager; Ensure that business process outcomes are aligned with Brink’s strategic goals; Work collaboratively across all departments of the organization to garner support from the team to improve business processes; Manage process change  - workflow, implementation and compliance; Provide timely feedback on process performance to Management; To enhance the overall employee engagement towards process improvement - both qualitative & quantitative. RequirementsJob Requirements  Candidate should have a recognised degree in Business Administration or equivalent or higher qualification; At least 3 years of relevant experience in conducting organisational efficiency assessments and process design work; Proficient in analysing business processes using data analytics; Project management experience using Lean methodologies and tools; Results oriented; tenacious, resilient, determined and a self-starter; Effective communication skills and good interpersonal skills; Innovative, creative and versatile.    Interested candidates, please forward your resume, stating reasons for leaving present position, current salary, expected salary and availability to: Kim.Riar@BrinksGlobal.com

Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Purpose The person selected for this role will be responsible for executing the improvements of services offered by the APAC Data & Computing team. He/she will ensure that the team’s services are aligned to agreed SLAs and processes, and fit for customers’ changing needs and requirements. This person will help ensure day-to-day operational performance remains consistently high, that operating policies are developed or are in practice, and gather customer feedback for quality assurance and improvement. The candidate must possess strong organization skills, an eye for detail, have good time management, have excellent written and communication skills, be able to prioritize multiple tasks, have a background in IT, and understand IT procedures. The successful candidate will be a member of a dynamic IT team and will work with other local, regional and global IT teams.    Key Responsibilities  Be client facing to the bank’s Business Lines, Application Support Teams, and Local IT teams to take feedback and use it to make service improvements. Produce reports and perform data analytics on data related to service quality Measure, track and report key performance and risk metrics on Data & Computing services to various internal and external audiences. Support and communicate with team members across Data & Computing, and the larger APAC IT Production teams Work closely with Data & Computing teams on service and process improvements Monitor, analyze and recommend what processes can be streamlined, made more efficient and where cost savings can be made. Ensure services adhere to local regulations, DR/BCP/ICP requirements, meet Security standards and match all Global Corporate standards. Diligently follow the BNPP operational permanent control framework and all of its rules and procedures.   RequirementsCompetencies (Technical / Behavioral)  Data analysis skillset to drive insights, make informed recommendations and develop concise and effective presentations Powerpoint, Excel skills, Power BI – including formulas, graphs and data manipulation Self-motivated, independent, well organized, responsible, and assertive (able to complete tasks with little supervision). Willing to take ownership, be hands-on and comfortable interfacing with people at all levels of the organisation. Possess strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Possess a positive, committed and enthusiastic 'can do' attitude. Have a good understanding of IT processes and procedures. Understands ITIL concepts and can apply them effectively.    Specific Qualifications Required  Minimum tertiary education level – Must be a degree holder in IT or equivalent subject. At least 5 years’ experience preferably within a Banking / Financial Institution environment. Have an ITIL V3 Foundation Qualification

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesResearch Scientist - Data Analytics for Energy Systems We are hiring for our client a Research Scientist – Data Analytics for Energy systems as part of their business expansion plans in Singapore. Our client is a world leading multinational engineering and electronics group.  This role will be based in our client's Singapore office, a regional representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia.   RequirementsYour role:   Design and development of energy systems for small and medium sized industries Development of artificial intelligence based learning algorithms for energy management Control/sequential decision problems in power system planning and management, energy optimization, battery management, building energy management etc. with special emphasis on deep reinforcement learning Establish internal/external collaborations in the area of energy systems Scouting of latest trends and products for energy efficiency measures    What you need to excel in this role:   Outstanding PhD degree in Electrical/ Computer Science Engineering/Physics Expertise in Markov Decision Processes, deep learning (neural networks) and reinforcement learning Expertise in related Artificial Intelligence concepts like: Monte Carlo Tree Search, policy gradients, actor-critic methods, model-based acceleration Experience with classical control theory, model predictive control, dynamic programming Strong communication and presentation skills and ability to develop network with internal/external partners Team player and ability to work in multi-cultural environment and global simultaneous engineering teams    Think you are the one? Send your resume to abigail.chang@globesoft.com.sg NOW! We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you.    AG 12C6296 Reg R1441803

Roles & ResponsibilitiesMHA S&T Associate Programme The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Secure Best Home, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. The MHA Science &Technology (S&T) Associate Programme is a programme designed for STEM graduates with less than 3 years of work experience who are keen to improve Singapore’s Safety & Security.   What we offer: As an S&T Associate, you will specialise in domains critical to safeguarding national security such as : (a)Forensics, (b) Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosives (CBRNE), (c)Biometrics & Profiling, (d)Sense-making & Surveillance, (e)Cybersecurity, (f)Data Analytics & Artificial Intelligence and (f) Robotics and Automation. Associates will take on challenging projects in these domains under the guidance of Senior Domain Practitioners and lead one greenfield project to build up your portfolio.  As you work with our Home Team Departments (e.g. SPF, SCDF, SPS, CNB, ICA, HTA), you will apply Science & Technology expertise to address safety and security challenges for Singapore.  You will also benefit from professional development opportunities including training and overseas learning trips. In addition, each S&T Associate will be personally mentored by a Senior Management Mentor. To better understand the types of Science & Technology work undertaken by the Home Team, please click here.   We are looking for:  Applicants with STEM disciplines/background preferred Applicants who have completed internships, projects or personal achievements which reflect a passion for Science & Technology Work Applicants who possess skills relevant to the S&T Domains Applicants who are technologically savvy and collaborative    Join us:The application for the MHA S&T Associate Programme is open all year round. When submitting your CV and other relevant documents for the application, please also upload a separate MS word file indicating:  Your top 3 preferences for specialisation out of these 11 domains in rank order: (a)Forensics, (b)Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosives (CBRNE), (c)Biometrics & Profiling, (d)Sense-making & Surveillance, (e)Cybersecurity, (f)Data Analytics & Artificial Intelligence, (g) Robotics & Automation, (h) Command, Control, Communications, Computers & Intelligence (C4i), (i)Platforms, vehicles and weapons, (j) Protective Security and (k)Human Factors. A short write-up of your passion for Science and/or Technology with specific examples of internships, projects, hackathons, other personal hobbies and tech skill-sets you possess.

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Human Resource Executive (Performance and Rewards) supports execution of performance management programmes, and compensation and benefits plans. He/She compares the organisation's compensation and benefits programmes with other organisations. He/She oversees the preparation of the payroll reports and works with benefits partners for claim disbursements.He/She ensures the accuracy of performance and compensation records in the systems, as well as ensuring regulations are followed. He/She performs data analytics and shares insights reports with senior members of the team.He/She works well in a team environment, and is able to communicate well with various stakeholders. He/She possesses an analytical mind and displays keen insight into data, using them to address issues and find solutions to work challenges.Requirements ~ Analyse employee demographics and associated risk exposure ~ Analyse employee feedback on benefits schemes ~ Analyse historical and current HR data to recognise trends and patterns in performance and rewards ~ Analyse utilisation rate of employee benefits and programmes ~ Benchmark organisation's compensation and benefits programmes against industry practices in relation to sector wage information of the Skills Framework ~ Check that regulatory and ethical guidelines are followed when handling employee data ~ Conduct diagnostic analytics on HR data to identify causes of behaviours and performance ~ Conduct job analysis and evaluations to propose employees' job size ~ Develop employee communications to inform employees about performance reviews and timelines ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on benefits ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on compensation matters ~ Develop standard reporting templates for performance and rewards management ~ Document action plans and assessment results for poor performers ~ Formulate communications to share organisation's compensation and benefits policies with employees ~ Gather feedback from employees to evaluate effectiveness of performance management programmes ~ Identify data required for analysis of business and/or human resource issues ~ Implement data checks and cleansing techniques to address data availability and quality challenges ~ Implement employee compensation reimbursement plans ~ Liaise with organisation's vendors and partners on benefits and claims processing ~ Organise performance, rewards and other employee data in HR system ~ Prepare contract terms with external vendors for benefits offered ~ Prepare technical and business reports with the analytical findings ~ Review annual salaries report and income tax declaration forms ~ Review benefits claims against entitlements to ensure accurate disbursements ~ Review employer contributions reports ~ Review generated payroll reports ~ Suggest peer companies and competitors of the organization ~ Verify that submitted claims are covered under organisation's benefit schemes

Roles & ResponsibilitiesValuation Analyst ZEN Rooms is Southeast Asia's fastest growing and best rated budget hospitality franchise. Started in 2015, ZEN Rooms works with more than 1000 hotels across 5 core countries offering high quality rooms at prices starting as low as USD 10. ZEN Rooms' mission is to improve the value-for-money of the Southeast Asian hotel market, helping hotel franchisees be more profitable through better efficiency and higher quality. ZEN Rooms has raised a total of USD 24M in funding from investors such as Rocket Internet, Ooredoo, and Korea's leading travel & hospitality company Yanolja.  We are on our way to be the most preferred stay option for travelers globally and are looking for exceptional individuals who are hungry to be part of this. Responsibilities: - Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer on the acceptable range of guarantee and/ or rental amounts to facilitate new partnerships (with client hotels)  - Optimising existing valuation processes and financial models for speedy collaboration between internal teams and for maximising partner (client hotels) convenience  - Ensuring profitability targets are met for all flagship properties  - Performing data analytics (working closely with BI team) to track and improve KPI performance  - Monitoring key performance metrics and taking necessary action (involving both internal and external stakeholders) promptly - Reporting to internal and external stakeholders - Liaising with other functional teams to ensure deliverables are on track Apply if this is you - You are analytical & hard working - You are proficient in at least one of the following: MS Excel, Python, R - You like to take responsibility and work under pressure & you are not looking for an easy 9 -5 job - You are ready to experience the pace and fast growth of an eCommerce startupRequirements- Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer on the acceptable range of guarantee and/ or rental amounts to facilitate new partnerships (with client hotels)  - Optimising existing valuation processes and financial models for speedy collaboration between internal teams and for maximising partner (client hotels) convenience  - Ensuring profitability targets are met for all flagship properties  - Performing data analytics (working closely with BI team) to track and improve KPI performance  - Monitoring key performance metrics and taking necessary action (involving both internal and external stakeholders) promptly - Reporting to internal and external stakeholders - Liaising with other functional teams to ensure deliverables are on track

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSenior Revenue Management Analyst ZEN Rooms is Southeast Asia's fastest growing and best rated budget hospitality franchise. Started in 2015, ZEN Rooms works with more than 1000 hotels across 5 core countries offering high quality rooms at prices starting as low as USD 10. ZEN Rooms' mission is to improve the value-for-money of the Southeast Asian hotel market, helping hotel franchisees be more profitable through better efficiency and higher quality. ZEN Rooms has raised a total of USD 24M in funding from investors such as Rocket Internet, Ooredoo, and Korea's leading travel & hospitality company Yanolja.  We are on our way to be the most preferred stay option for travelers globally and are looking for exceptional individuals who are hungry to be part of this. The Revenue Manager oversees revenue management and distribution strategy of the hotel and manage day-to-day yield operations. He/She ensures that all target market segments are developed for the long-term benefit of the property’s business, performs competitive benchmark studies and follows market trends. He/She also creates and develops pricing strategies and manages all third party distribution.  He/She also provides weekly dynamic forecast of expected results, variances and budget comparisons; analyses overall monthly sales performance and provide summary report with recommendations to improve long term strategies.  The Revenue Manager has to work closely with other departments to ensure that the pricing strategies are implemented on daily basis. He/She is responsible for assessing, analysing and pricing group business strategies. He/She needs to ensure the revenue team adopt best practice standards to include competitor analysis, environmental scanning, market modelling, distribution yield management, business mix yield management, pricing control and new pricing concepts in reports to the management.  He/She also needs to evaluate performance of distribution partners and contracted rates (OTA, FIT, tour operators, etc.). Core Responsibilities: - Leading a team of 10 or more revenue management analysts across SEA and reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer on strategies regarding pricing, promotions, online distribution, customer demographics and seasonality  - Optimising existing revenue management processes for speedy collaboration between internal teams and for maximising partner (client hotels) convenience  - Ensuring occupancy and profitability targets are met for all flagship properties  - Valuation of key properties and performing data analytics (working closely with BI team) to track and improve KPI performance - Monitoring key performance metrics and taking necessary action (involving both internal and external stakeholders) promptly - Reporting to internal and external stakeholders - Liaising with other functional teams to ensure deliverables are on track Apply if this is you - You are analytical & hard working - You are proficient in at least one of the following: MS Excel, Python, R - You like to take responsibility and work under pressure & you are not looking for an easy 9 -5 job - You are ready to experience the pace and fast growth of an eCommerce startup      Requirements ~ Analyse and recommend best practices & technology in hospitality ~ Apply systems thinking in problem solving and decision making ~ Conduct presentation to senior management ~ Contribute to the design and development of a productivity framework ~ Develop self to maintain professional competence at senior management level ~ Innovate the customer experience ~ Lead team leaders to develop business strategies and government management ~ Manage and direct negotiations ~ Manage customer acquisition and retention programmes ~ Manage dispute mediation ~ Manage hotel sales and marketing initiatives ~ Manage resource planning ~ Manage strategic revenue management ~ Manage total revenue management ~ Prepare budgets for the business unit ~ Provide information for management to make decisions

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description  As a Senior Programmer Analyst within the Equity Derivatives Data & Analytics Group you will be involved in one of the most significant platform changes within the Equities business. As a group, the entire division is going through an enormous growth, and within the Data area, we have a huge re-architecture to undertake to move from our existing C# services to Java.  The team is critical to the success of this program and has responsibility for the reference and trade data entering the Risk platform as well as having joint responsibilities for the market data for Equity Derivatives. The successful candidate will be key member of the team building out the new platform and migrating existing functionality, data validation and data between the existing and new platforms. The candidate will be required to work with the front office, quants as well as counterparts in the middle office, managing requirements and work-loads across the relevant clients.  Key Responsibilities:  Hands on developer who can turn requirements into a detailed design and delivering to committed timescales with suitable testing Build and deploy applications on Linux platforms. Ensure Citi Markets and Security Services Technology Development Standards are being met.    To apply online via the careers section of Citi E career website, please click via the link below: https://citi.taleo.net/careersection/2/jobdetail.ftl?lang-en&job=18042598RequirementsEssential Skills  Excellent OOD development skills in Java Good SQL experience Sound understanding of design patterns and system architecture. Experience of TDD and/or BDD methodologies Experience of C# or C++ Agile development experience Ability to enforce standards for software development: continuous integration, testing and deployment, information security, software quality and controls. Excellent academic record, degree level minimum - preferably Science, Technology, Mathematics or Engineering (flexible based on experience) Pro-active and dynamic individual who is able to work under pressure in a front-office technology environment  Desirable Skills  Experience of Apache STORM Experience in TeamCity automated build tools Experience with Confluence, JIRA, GIT and/or Bitbucket Experience with SonarCube. Experience of Python Multi-threading Experience of Equity Derivative products Experience of working in a Front Office environment Distributed Application Development Experience of NoSQL data stores.

job_title: Digital Tech Services Manager CH Tech APAC
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs the Digital Technical Services Manager, you will lead the support and services of the various digital portfolio under the scope of the Digital, Data Analytics and Innovation (DDAI) team. You will coordinate the architecture activities for the region under the guidance of the global architecture teams. You are the point of contact for all service related matters impacting DDAI operations. On top of that, you are responsible for retained operations and outsourced (3rd Party) services in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region.   Key deliverables and responsibilities are as follow:  • Co-ordinates / where appropriate manages direct and indirect subordinates as well as 3rd party service partners supporting the applications and infrastructure • Leads definition and continuous improvement of application and infrastructure processes and sub-processes effectiveness and efficiency • Provides overall guidance for changes to the applicable Service Area and/or Service Levels that require new initiatives, projects and/or contract changes • Oversees the capacity planning process for applicable Service Area working with demand forecasts from the business units and actual consumption data • Ensures compliance with infrastructure standards for applicable Service Area • Provides input and guidance for changes and continuous improvement for applicable Service Area • Facilitates definition and continuous refinement of outsourced services effectiveness and efficiency measurements • Facilitate service support trend analyses and significant problem and root-cause analyses with Service Provider, Services and cross-Services, as required • Ensures service availability standards meet KPI targets • Produce SLA reports on monthly or when required for management review • Reviews the SLA performance with vendor and management on stipulated time-frame • Produce Service Improvement Plans (SIP) for SLA failures or process improvements • Performs yearly review and adjust the SLM baseline based with vendors and partners • Ensure/overview audit readiness services delivery • Lead and manage DDAI services to ensure timely resolution of front-line queries. • Drive incident investigation and analyze trends to develop actions for clear reduction in operations related concerns • Define & implement standard process roll out model for operations to ensure end to end impact is thoroughly managed. • ITSM practitioner with strict ITSM mindset on change, incident, problem methodologies • Role is required take a holistic view of service integration and management while primarily focusing through the lenses of operations and support.  • Capture voice of customer and prioritize service improvement proposals  • Negotiate with relevant parties in respect of Event Management (disruptions, adverse events, etc.) and major amendments to the provision of services.   • Ensure that GSK Standard Processes are applied and adhered to including embedding and adopting standard ways of working in accordance with Quality Risk and Compliance policies.  GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents, performance related bonus, long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program, a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more, feel better and live longer.  At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.  If you would like to join us in innovating and inspiring changes in the industry, we urge you to apply. Requirements• Bachelor’s Degree in Digital, Computer Sciences or equivalent degrees combined with an MBA or Business experience • Significant experience preferably working in large regional enterprises and managed large projects in capacity of a Service Delivery Manager/Lead - Pharmaceutical/Commercial/CPG or highly regulated industry. • Experience in managing IT services and Application Service Management • Stakeholder management with excellent verbal and written communication skills for all levels of management and staffs • Ability to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a team • Experience with digital services delivery model • Agile methodology • ITIL certified or strong ITSM background with ability to understand and follow through all ITSM best practices • Experience in leading different resource teams in different geographies • Background in people management, financial responsibility and business decision-making • Has responsibility for implementing a robust set of ways or working and governance that is embedded with the team and practiced rigorously.  • Needs to have managed and conducted escalations to other teams and to senior stakeholders • Experience in people management and demonstrated experience managing teams across functions and geographies • Excellent leadership and teamwork skills

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe role You will have a front row seat in impacting women across the globe through data and insights. You will be responsible for building a data-driven culture and approach throughout the entire organization. You will lead a team of Data Engineers and Analysts to empower and challenge cross-functional teams with the right and relevant numbers. You will serve as an analytics expert for all your partners. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. Most importantly, you will have an unparalleled opportunity to design, build, and execute a Data Strategy that will disrupt the consumer and retail industry. Main responsibilities   Develop a deep understanding of the Love, Bonito customer and the overall business   Develop a vision and roadmap for data at Love, Bonito   Implement improvements to the existing data architecture and data flows   Drive experimental data modeling designs within the business   Develop and maintain A/B testing framework to evaluate changes in the business’s product/marketing/designs   Develop insights and actionables across Product, Customer and Inventory     Recruit, lead, and mentor data team (analysts, business analysts, data engineers)   Work with Data and Cross-functional teams to define the data collection needs of the business   Set standards and best practices for all data analytics work at Love, Bonito to develop a deep understanding of Love, Bonito’s internal and external customers via SQL, R, Python     Track the business’s performance against data analysis model and monitor trends in key business KPIs     Drive overall company trust in the data by ensuring high data quality and reliability   Establish a better understanding across the organization of how to effectively use data and data tools to make business decisions   Design and oversee the building of self-serve solutions for stakeholder groups that are scalable and automated to handle a dynamic product environment via reporting tools  RequirementsYou should have / be   A Love, Bonito Culture Fit   Good grasp of the Love, Bonito brand and unique proposition   A knack for problem solving with an ability to think ‘out of the box’   A genuine curiosity to know how things work and how to make them better   An entrepreneurial, self starter, get-your-hands dirty attitude   Enjoy learning new things and pick them up quickly     A demonstrated past and present data obsession   Ability to understand and solve loosely defined problems and come up with relevant answers and actionable insights to guide product development decisions   A deep understanding of numbers, as well as a strong business sense     Strong leadership skills   Ability to manage and influence a diverse and talented team of data engineers and analysts   Exceptional communication skills with an ability to communicate complex data analysis to broader functional teams & investors   Exceptional relationship management and influencing abilities; ability to build strong relationships and trust with internal and external stakeholders       Qualification and Experience   6+ years of relevant experience, BA/BS or Master's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature (e.g., data from multiple sources and transforming them into structured formats     Ability to handle multiple priorities and solve ambiguous problems in a fast paced environment

job_title: Manager /  Senior Manager, Compliance Strategy & Analytics, Work Pass Division (1 year contract)
description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe job holder is responsible for using analytics to detect abuses and fraud within the work pass framework and to formulate strategies to deter abuses and prevent fraudulent applications.
 
Responsibilities

Extract and manipulate large data sets using scripting languages like R, Python or standard tools.
Apply statistical and machine learning techniques on large datasets to develop a model to detect risks and vulnerabilities in the work pass framework.
Conceptualise and implement measures and processes to strengthen detection of fraudulent work pass applications and employers, and propose interventions to close loopholes and gaps. 
Collaborate with work pass processing/enforcement teams to gather insights on emerging trends and validate the insights from the model, to ensure that the model is precise and robust.
Make use of visualisation software (e.g. Tableau) to present the data and insights gathered.
Collaborate with other data science units in MOM, GovTech to improve the robustness and precision of the model.
Actively conduct technology scans to look out for evolving statistical and machine learning techniques to improve the effectiveness of the model.
Provide technical inputs to integrate data analytics into enterprise systems.

 
Requirements

Possess tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Econometric, Operations Research, or related disciplines
Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Have good communication (written and spoken) and interpersonal skills
Be a good team player with a customer-focused mindset
Be able to work independently and adapt to complex changes

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

job_title: IT Director, Data & Analytics PLO ASPAC
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesMedical Devices & Diagnostics Global Services, LLC, a division of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Director, Data & Analytics. This position is in Singapore and reports to the Senior Director, Medical Devices Global Data & Analytics Product Line.  Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. The company is seeking a leader responsible for the vision of data and analytics strategy and own implementation of roadmap across Commercial Medical Devices ASPAC. He / She will create impactful and intuitive data and analytics products, finding solutions to challenging and complex business problems. PRODUCT LINE OWNER - IT DIRECTOR will be responsible for   Successfully deliver to ASPAC customers managing their expectations, making quick decisions and delivering solutions at the forefront of technology within the ever-changing data landscape. Align stakeholders and development teams around common measurable product goals, and continue to entice and engage business into the product development process. Think creatively about increasing effectiveness of the data & analytics product line, embedding agile practices into the organization. Maintain a strong view of external capabilities in the market and their ability to drive business value. Closely partner with enterprise architects in continually scans technology landscape and keeps abreast of latest product offerings and potential impact to J&J. Form and maintain strong internal partnerships across all IT functions, ensuring strong alignment to our IT model. Develop and articulate product line vision, goals and business value. Prioritize and aligns with business and IT stakeholders. Deliver product demonstrations and presentations to internal customers. Manage project plans, timescales and budgets. Work with external third parties to assess partnerships and licensing Incorporate Agile experience in navigating the SDLC. Craft a product backlog that articulates all aspects of the user requirements and define well-formed acceptance criteria. Requirements A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required; A degree in the field of computer science or business administration is preferred.  A Master’s degree in computer science or business administration and/or Master of Business administration with technology as a core component is also preferred. A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience managing and  directing large IT projects is required Experience in the Healthcare industry with strong commercial business acumen required.  Experience with Commercial Operations business processes required.  Knowledge of Strategic Customer group, Global Business Intelligence, Marketing, CRM, Global Education Services preferred.  Experience with Medical Devices datasets (ERP, SFE, Sales Compensation, Product life cycle management, 3rd party data etc) is required. Deep Knowledge of Data Governance, Data Integration, Data Quality, Master Data and Metadata management capabilities required.  Experience as both a team member and coach in the agile product owner/scrum master roles is required. An understanding of business and ability to relate priorities to associated technology investments, experience effectively collaborating and managing global stakeholders is required. Knowledge of trends (e.g., big data, cloud computing) and expertise driving adoption to improve IT, knowledge of technical engineering best practices, experience with running and teaching agile, and domain expertise are all required. Deep knowledge of AWS big data eco system (S3, Redshift, EMR etc) is required.  The ability to synthesize leadership and stakeholder inputs into product decisions for team and the ability to pick up technical and business concepts quickly and proactively create and communicate deep industry and business insights are required. Deep knowledge of technologies, their application, sustainability, scalability relative to data & analytics is required.  Excellent understanding of product planning and execution, knowledge of healthcare, business theory, processes, management, and budgeting and business office operations is required. Lean requirements gathering and story mapping experience is preferred. People management experience is required. Up to 10% travel is required

Outlook; Word; Powerpoint) Strong planning & analytical skills Strong communication & influencing skills Strong project management skills Strong business sense and ability to identify the business needs and opportunities Analytical, logical and process thinking Fluent in English (written and oral); excellent communication skills  Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems or Finance with equivalent experience Minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience Proficient in dashboard reporting, standard reporting, report optimization Understanding of data modeling concepts (Relational, dimensional) Highly developed verbal and written communication skills Understanding of the business domain and the interaction of business processes with data entities/elements

job_title: Analyst / Senior Analyst (Digital Workplace Programme Office)
company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
description: Roles & Responsibilities  You will work closely with the Smart Nation & Digital Government Office and GovTech to build the vision articulated in the Digital Government Blueprint of a digitally-confident Public Service workforce that is supported by a digitally-enabled workplace and digital tools. Your primary work scope will be driving the efforts to build digital capabilities. The top priority currently is digital literacy, the effort to equip all 145,000 public officers with the basic skills to function effectively in a digitally-enabled workplace. You will work closely with the Civil Service College and GovTech to drive strategy and implementation for digital literacy training across the Public Service. Other major initiatives are digital skills for leaders and the redesign of public officers’ job requirements to include new digital skills such as data analytics. You may also work on projects related to improving the employee digital experience for public officers together with our partners in GovTech and the Smart Nation & Digital Government Office. The team undertakes user research and drives adoption for new digital tools used within the Public Service. Examples of these tools include a knowledge management system, work flow system, and a mobile app for employee transactions such as leave and claims. Requirements  Competencies in HR Strategy and Learning & Development Data Analytics skills (e.g. Excel PivotTable, R, SPSS, or Tableau) Keen interest in digital technologies Excellent interpersonal skills; strong team player Ability to work in close partnership with multiple stakeholders Critical thinking skills, intellectual curiosity, and sense of imagination Comfortable working in a fast-paced start-up environment Training in Organisational Psychology or Human Resources preferred        Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within two weeks of the closing date.Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Technology power’s Standard Chartered Bank's vision and strategic agenda through the provision of    innovative and efficient technology solutions; we deliver greater value to our business stakeholders; we improve the skills and flexibility of our people and work more effectively with our internal and vendor service partners.   The Cloud Infrastructure Services function is responsible for the delivery of all Cloud solutions across the Standard Chartered Bank Group. Cloud Infrastructure Platforms is responsible for the design, engineering and support of Private Cloud and Public Cloud Platforms. Within Cloud Infrastructure Platforms there are five teams namely Public Cloud, Private Cloud, Cloud Operations, Platform On-boarding, and Risk. The global team consists of approximately 40 highly skilled team members located in the Singapore, Malaysia, India, and the UK. There is a requirement for a senior level Database Cloud Engineer who will be responsible for evaluating, designing, and implementing complete infrastructure solutions from the ground up. You'll be working within a global team on innovative hardware, operating systems, hypervisors, containers, databases, software defined networks and software defined storage to build out our next generation cloud computing solutions. This is a hands-on role with an emphasis on Cloud database offerings ensuring fully automated integration into the banks ecosystem whilst at the same time ensuring that the Database offering meets customer requirements and is fully engineered and available for both Private and Public cloud. We are looking for a result oriented, self-starter who will be able to dive deep into problems and think outside of the box to create production ready solutions. Key Roles & Responsibilities 1.         Run platform across Global Regions and ensure consistency in our use of Cloud Services. 2.         Evaluate and propose new technologies for business solutions. 3.         Interact with customers to understand business requirements and expectations. 4.         Establish best engineering practices through solid design decisions, processes, and tools. 5.         Technical product qualification (benchmarking, suitability, performance characteristics) of relevant    hardware and software for use case requirements. 6.         Write server side code to create robust production offerings that are highly available, scalable and can cope with burst demand. 7.         Champion Agile best-practices, processes, and tools in support of DevOps processes. 8.         Ensure proactive capacity planning and expansions. Special Responsibilities- 1.         Ensuring that Standard Chartered own images in the cloud environments are fully consistent with Bank audit and compliance requirements and fully consistent with the design ethos and technical requirements of external and internal cloud providers. 2.         Ensuring that all relevant platforms are being efficiently and appropriately supported in SCB CI/CD toolchains, including identifying opportunities for toolchain and operational practise improvements. 3.         Cloud platform estate management including license / support subscription oversight, control and best utilization, automation of estate reporting and management, including close collaboration with other Platforms. 4.         Supporting adoption of containers and container control frameworks for external and internal Cloud Services, including container platform selection and design, cost and license planning and ensuring that self-service design/deployment/control web containers is appropriate for requirements. 5.         Incident Management for issues related to Private Cloud Services, acting as senior escalation point for Cloud Support, driving service restoration and stability during significant incidents. Governance ·         Take personal responsibility for understanding the risk and compliance requirements of the role. ·         Understand and comply with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws and regulations, including those governing anti-money laundering, terrorist financing and sanctions; the Group’s policies and procedures; and the Group Code of Conduct. ·         Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk and compliance matters. Technology Competencies  1.         Required - expertise with Oracle, MS-SQL, MySQL, MariaDB, AWS RDS/Aurora 2.         Required - expertise with MongoDB, Cassandra DB, Redis or other noSQL/in memory databases 3.         Required – experience of building database offerings on OpenStack IaaS platforms. 4.         Required - deep expertise Software Defined compute, storage, networks (SDDC). 5.         Strongly advantageous - experience of deploying and controlling virtual machines in a cloud services environment, preferably with Amazon Web Services or other cloud providers such as Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform. 6.         Required - experience and expertise in Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment practise, tooling and techniques (Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, git; Jenkins, Artifactory, Terraform, Packer, Rundeck, Ansible, AppDynamics) 7.         Required – experience with at least one of data analytics tools such as Splunk and/or ELK. 8.         Required - Ability to write code. Ideally in Python or Java. 9.         Strongly advantageous - experience and demonstrable accomplishments as a DevOps or automation engineer. 10.       Strongly advantageous – experience of successful and demonstrable achievements in collaborative working with compliance, technology risk and regulatory requirement specialists. 11.       Advantageous - extensive experience and demonstrable accomplishments in selecting, designing and implementing automation and compliance frameworks that are applied to virtual compute resource deployments in the cloud. 12.       Advantageous - deep experience in multi-tier application architecture, development, deployment and support. 13.       Advantageous - knowledge of writing code to produce and consume RESTful API’s. SERVICE AND FINANCE 1.         Demonstrates delivering services as a business (understanding and analysing the cost base of a service, controlling a recharge and recovery model) 2.         Vendor interaction, understand the product/technology lifecycle (end-of-life) and provide recommendation for changes/upgrades. 3.         Demonstrates tactical ownership for the management and support of assigned infrastructure areas. 4.         Participating in initiatives to maintain a secure, consistent, and effective global technical infrastructure service. PERSONAL AND INTER-PERSONAL SKILLS 1.         Delivers by possessing productivity, professionalism, customer service attitude, attention to detail and quality; ability to multitask; strong interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills and adherence to standard operating procedures. 2.         Demonstrates ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and ability to take direction from multiple areas. 3.         Comfortable in an agile and fast-moving environment. 4.         Developing Self & Others through Coaching, Contributing to Team, continuously learning and sharing knowledge.RequirementsQUALIFICATIONS ·         Academic or Professional Education/Qualifications: IT related tertiary qualification or equivalent experience. ·         Licences and Certifications / accreditations - Associate or Professional level of AWS Certification (SA, SysOps), ITIL v3 How to Apply Please visit - https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobdetail.ftl?job=1800032982&lang=en  to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential. You can search and view current opportunities across our global organisation and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe’re looking for an experienced Talent Management Consultant/Psychologist, with demonstrated project management experience and a passion in Talent Management Solutions to join our successful and growing Singapore team. Given our recent strategic wins on a number of large-scale projects, the position offers an opportunity for an experienced Consultant/ Psychologist to lead and deliver major projects in the areas of assessment and leadership development, whilst guiding the development and growth of the team. THE COMPANY Hudson Talent Management offers leading practice solutions that are underpinned by psychology and data analytics. We deliver innovative, competitive and industry-leading solutions for our clients, supporting them to:  Hire with Confidence: by developing profiles for specific roles, and assessing fit against key capabilities Grow Great Leaders: by identifying leadership potential, and developing leadership capability Engage Through Change: by providing expertise on the people impact of organisational change, and transitioning people to new career pathways  THE ROLE As a member of our team, you’ll be joining a group of highly ambitious consultants/ psychologists that take their work seriously, but not themselves. We strive toward team based targets which fosters a collaborative, transparent and growth oriented culture. You will thrive in environment that is:  One of the most highly regarded brands in the talent management sector Agile and adaptable systems and solutions, supported by a global research & development team A collaborative, high performance culture and a defined career pathway A great balance of respect, autonomy and guidance from our leaders  Our APAC business is growing with big plans for the future which means there are exciting career opportunities for you. You'll join a winning management team with 50+ years of collective experience across regions, practices and industries. BENEFITS Team bonuses and our Star Awards program that recognises and rewards great work.Over the last year our employees received nearly 300 hours of training delivered by our APAC Learning & Development team. You may apply directly to this job advertisement, else you may reach out to Stephen Tan at stephen.tan@hudson.com with your updated resume. RequirementsYou are passionate about delivering high quality solutions for our clients through your consulting and relationship management skills; you are full of initiative and get excited about learning new things everyday; you are committed to showcasing value to our clients and want to build long-lasting partnerships. Skills & competence  Taking a lead role in building, nurturing and sustaining strong business partnerships with existing and new clients Initiating contact with clients and developing client relationships, with a view to create business opportunities Providing innovative, effective solutions to clients Applying strong commercial acumen, conveying knowledge and providing rigorous consultation to clients Conducting Assessment Centres/ Development Centres, and completing participant reports Delivering developmental feedback to senior executives after completion of a psychometric profiling tool, 360-feedback survey, or Assessment Centres/ Development Centres Managing change and career transition programmes Managing executive coaching programmes Project management, including preparation of client proposals, costing and ongoing account management Exposure to the talent management lifecycle of selection, development, leadership, change and career transition. Masters qualification in Psychology/ Organisational Behaviour/ Organisational Development/ Human Resources would be preferred.

The individual will be working closely with the stakeholders in J&J Application Development & Support functions, Resource management, Sourcing, Business unit IT and Vendor teams to ensure that the TS build organization delivers the services per the agreed & aligned to expectations. Evaluate on-going costs for operational resources & processes and determine new efficiency opportunities Ensure the services are consistently improving overall quality, speed of delivery of services and business value to the J&J Operating Companies. Prior experience in managing BI application development or support leveraging one or more of enterprise data lake, enterprise data warehouses, data transformation or reporting  Knowledge of planning and forecasting techniques for specific competency area Global and diverse mindset – ability to work across multiple countries and cultures.
