job_title: IT Manager, Logistics Transportation and Data Analytics Services, Product Line Owner, ASPAC
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSupply Chain BT Product Line Organizations (PLOs) are responsible for the product line technological direction across segments and serve as a critical point of contact for business and technology. Individuals in a Product Line will work with BTLs, Senior Technology and Business Leaders to identify and prioritize solutions for their Product Line and oversee the consistent implementation of these services/solutions across the business.  They will exhibit strong influence and passion for driving the organization towards consistent technology solutions aligned to an overall technology strategy.  PLO will need to continuously maximize throughput of the various product lines and products and ensure that value is realized by the business through the technology capabilities implemented. PLOs/POs are responsible to continuously drive efficiencies and effectiveness in their product areas.  PL members should have a strong view of external technology capabilities in the marketplace and how they can be applied to drive business value for J&J. This role is accountable for regional Transportation Management Systems (TMS) and Data Analytics supporting Customer Logistics Services (CLS) in the region.  This role has accountability for the alignment with the global technology strategy, and for the reliability, and performance of TMS solutions. This role is responsible as the PO for TMS in ASPAC. This role will manage J&J’s Transportation Services requirements within the region. The responsibility includes transporting from J&J to J&J locations (Inbound transportation) as well as the delivery of J&J products to our end customers (Outbound Transportation) across ~110 DCs Regionally.   This role also makes sure that TMS are continuously optimized to drive operational efficiencies across CLS.  This role works closely with other Logistics PL areas, BTLs, and SC Integrated Solutions & Services (IS&S).  The PO will ensure proper technology lifecycle management, tech burden reduction, risk remediation, and cybersecurity readiness for the TMS.   Technology strategist: who spans multiple internal and external (3PL) Transportation technologies/services strategy to enable/enhance/drive J&J products distribution strategy. Technical depth: Technical scope of knowledge includes TMS/etc., applications supporting transportation management processes globally. Product Leader: Partnering with the business to define the product strategy and roadmap; balances innovation and delivery; anticipates future needs and proactively improves product features; ensures products meet service level expectations (i.e., reliability and performance) Investment manager: Partners with business to define new functionality investment priorities and technology lifecycle management investments, Accountable for all financials the product area (including: CAPEX, OPEX, Business value realization, and manages portfolio of investments) Business Transformation leader: Partners with the business to drive business process optimization/leaning and mapping; drives business partners towards standard solutions.  Program and Service Manager: Tracks progress of product development and deployment. Reports back to the business and BTLs on status on the delivery of features, functionality, and applications; has global accountability. Ensures high reliability and up-time of the products in operation. Works with Technology Services to continually improve the service levels and reliability. Talent Leader: A leader and developer of talent; coach and mentor individuals to excel in product management; passionately owns and is a role model for diversity & inclusion This position is responsible for coordinating and executing the IT delivery of Transportation Services in ASPAC for the SCT Global Transportation Services Product Line. This leader will partner with the ASPAC Business Transportation Services Product Owner to drive end-state strategy, level set expectations, features and manage business process requirements. The incumbent will also partner and collaborate with the global team members in SCT Transportation Services as well as enterprise JJT groups and related business functions to identify and manage interdependencies between the teams, to ensure workstream delivery per plan within the region, and to manage updates to senior leadership. The role requires active engagement and strong partnering skills with the ASPAC and WW Transportation team, as in particular with our JJ Technology Services teams to ensure the successful delivery of the ASPAC Transportation programs. The incumbent will have responsibilities for both inbound and outbound technologies supporting the Transportation Services and associated integrations with related applications.  The candidate will require deep understanding of the SDLC / Agile development methodologies and JJ TS engagement processes, along with a good track record demonstrating strong execution and delivery skills.    Approximate Percentage of Time - Tasks/Duties/Responsibilities   30% - Partner with Business Process Owners, BTLs, Other SC-BT PLOs, Enterprise Architecture, TS Infrastructure Services, TS Application Services and enterprise programs leadership teams to drive alignment on goals, objectives and delivery of innovative and creative commitment.   20% - Develops and articulates the vision, strategy, roadmap and business value. Prioritizes and aligns backlog of features with business and technology stakeholders towards a regular release schedule. Manages the overall product roadmap – including introduction and decommissioning of the products 20% - Develop and deliver TMS capability offerings and new technologies to drive business value 20% - Accountable for product life cycle management including total cost of ownership optimization of the product line; Program/project financial targets and the implementation, measurement and continuous improvement of technology programs and operations to improve throughput and quality at lower cost 5% - Support the organizational and people development activities of internal and external associates through coaching and mentoring activities and continuous updating organization skills/knowledge profile. 5% - Continuously learn via research, technology vendors, IT Architecture and tech. events to get ahead of the curve and proactively being new relevant capabilities to the product line RequirementsRequired Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or supply chain, or equivalent relevant experience. Required Years of Related Experience:  4-6 years managing large IT programs with high level of complexity.  Demonstrated track record in the delivery of complex projects and programs utilizing Agile delivery techniques. Experience in multiple sectors in ASPAC Supply Chain technologies, (transportation, distribution, or logistics) is preferred   Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:   Knowledgeable on the technical concepts, prominent and emerging industry solutions, services and methodologies regarding one or more of:  	 SC Logistics Technology landscape that supports the Logistics functions Transportation Distribution Process modeling Industry 4.0  Mobility (Wearables, AR/VR, Voice Enablement) Emerging Technologies   Strong Business Acumen & Communication skills.    Demonstrated ability to work with business partners to understand business requirements and define a data and analytics strategy and the associated capabilities.    Experience in effectively collaborating and managing stakeholders. Deployment of major technology capabilities across multiple sites with strong preference for adoption of Agile Methodologies.    Experience working in a Shared Services IT Operating model where development and support services are provided by shared services organizations that support multiple functional and organizational units Experience in working within teams with the above capabilities  Percentage of Travel required: 20%

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesCloud adoption isn’t just about the migration. From business strategy to process design, from infrastructure management to training and support; Cloud Comrade has all it takes to make the move to cloud swift, smooth and secure. To help our customers getting the most out of the Cloud we are looking for new members to our team which are willing to learn, able to help and have the mindset of an entrepreneur. Please read on if you can tick at least 5 of these topics:  AWS, GCP, MS Azure, Alibaba Cloud (Compute, Storage, Networking) Virtualization (VMWare, Hyper-V, …) Linux (Suse, Redhat, ...) Windows Server Docker / Packer, Kubernetes, ... MS-SQL, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, … NoSQL, MongoDB, ... Data Engineering / Data Analytics (Hadoop, Data Migration (ETL, Messaging, API Integration, Synchronization, Clustering, …) Terraform / Cloudformation, Salt, ... Basic knowledge of IT Project Management (ITIL, IT4IT, ITSM Tools) Coding/Scripting (Bash, PowerShell, Java, Python, …)  The preferred candidate has experience in a wide variety of technologies and tools. That does not necessarily mean he/she is proficient in cloud yet. But you need the will to learn fast and constantly. You should not be afraid, just because a tool is new to you. The role requires to understand the cloud technology but also the needs of the business.   Naturally we need experience with different systems and IT operations, like configuring Linux, administrating Windows, changing firewall rules. It will be a big plus, if you already have a Cloud certification. Even better if you are a go-to resource in networking, security, and/or databases.    Your job will be to setup, manage, and maintain servers and infrastructure on the Cloud; incl. storage and network, as well as OS, web servers and databases. You will evaluate and recommend the best solution for our customers, while observing all aspects of security, functionality, risk and cost.   Customers need you to actively support their migration to the cloud, moving data and workloads without affecting their daily operations, sometimes after-hours. You need to keep your contacts update along the way and provide comprehensive documentation of work progress and results.   We like you to collaborate efficiently and communicate openly with everyone. In other words, we want you to be our comrade! Inside and outside of regular office hours.   The role will bring you in contact with a diverse set of customers of all sizes and industries; mainly in Singapore but also in the region.   If you think this job is for you, you are allowed to work either in Singapore, Malaysia, or Indonesia and you are available, please apply. Follow us on our company LinkedIn page by going to: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cloud-comrade Requirements Candidates with existing AWS or GCP certificates is preferred Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline is desired. Minimum 3 years of working experience in a IT Services environment Experience with AWS/GCP or other cloud-based infrastructure platforms Experience in SAP B1 HANA, AWS services like EC2, S3, RDS, CloudFront, CloudFormation, etc. desired Proficient in the use and administration of all versions of MS Windows Server Experience with Linux and Windows system administration and web server configuration and monitoring Experience in backup software, shell scripting, and a programming language Experience in network configuration and administration Experience in Big Data, Docker and Continuous Deployment desired Willing to work after-office hours

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Human Resource Executive (Performance and Rewards) supports execution of performance management programmes, and compensation and benefits plans. He/She compares the organisation's compensation and benefits programmes with other organisations. He/She oversees the preparation of the payroll reports and works with benefits partners for claim disbursements.He/She ensures the accuracy of performance and compensation records in the systems, as well as ensuring regulations are followed. He/She performs data analytics and shares insights reports with senior members of the team.He/She works well in a team environment, and is able to communicate well with various stakeholders. He/She possesses an analytical mind and displays keen insight into data, using them to address issues and find solutions to work challenges.Requirements To handle full HR spectrum  Responsible for payroll processing of up to 200 pax including CPF submission, NS claims, or other government related submission or claims.  Administer staff welfare and benefits programmes Support the implementation of HR initiatives and activities Any other ad hoc duties assigned.   OTHERS:  Minimum Degree in Human Resource or relevant field. At least 3 years of experience in processing payroll Knowledge in Times Software preferred Proficient in MS Office  Excellent interpernal and communication skills A team player, detail oriented and proactive Able to work independently and under pressure to meet deadlines Must be able to converse in English and Mandarin, to liaise with differerent group of employees

Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Invigor At Invigor we’re a leading data analytics, insights and loyalty company and our mission is to provide a world-class platform to the retail sector, giving them access to the latest marketing technologies so they can effectively engage with their customers while increasing loyalty. Our difference is that we focus on business outcomes. We take a strategic view to deliver our clients profitable growth. Our interconnected data sets allow better understanding of markets, competitors and consumers through affordable cloud-based solutions. Invigor’s solutions offers insights into market activity such as competitor pricing and consumer behaviour as well as allowing engagement with consumers through relevant content and digital real estate. Our technology and innovation can be seen in one of Sydney’s historic ferry terminals, Manly Wharf, where a high traffic transport hub has been transformed into a Digital Precinct and a number of clients in Singapore and across South East Asia.    Overview We are looking for a talented and experienced DevOps Engineer to help us to support our growing business and join our technology team, focused on delivering a high quality family of products. We pay special attention to those that are looking to create new and innovative ideas, not just reinvent the old.   Essential duties and responsibilities  Collaborate with software engineers to analyze and enhance current workflow by instituting DevOps practices Build infrastructure that requires minimum operational maintenance   Streamline traditional sysadmin tasks via automation (e.g. server provisioning, code deployments, etc.) Introduce and maintain development toolchains that can improve productivity of the technology team (e.g. tools for continuous integration/deployment, monitoring tools, etc.) Make sure that the infrastructure is highly scalable, secured and fault-tolerant RequirementsWho we are looking for  Minimum of two years working experience as DevOps engineer Expertise in automation/configuration management using any of ansible, puppet chef, terraform and/or kubernetes Expertise in AWS Cloud Solutions Experience with designing and building an entire infrastructure from scratch Experience with container-based technologies (e.g. docker, coreOs, etc) Strong background in Linux/Unix administration Experience with managing data storage/caching solutions (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB, redis, memcache)

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Human Resource Executive (Performance and Rewards) supports execution of performance management programmes, and compensation and benefits plans. He/She compares the organisation's compensation and benefits programmes with other organisations. He/She oversees the preparation of the payroll reports and works with benefits partners for claim disbursements.  He/She ensures the accuracy of performance and compensation records in the systems, as well as ensuring regulations are followed. He/She performs data analytics and shares insights reports with senior members of the team.  He/She works well in a team environment, and is able to communicate well with various stakeholders. He/She possesses an analytical mind and displays keen insight into data, using them to address issues and find solutions to work challenges.Requirements ~ Analyse employee demographics and associated risk exposure ~ Analyse employee feedback on benefits schemes ~ Analyse historical and current HR data to recognise trends and patterns in performance and rewards ~ Analyse utilisation rate of employee benefits and programmes ~ Benchmark organisation's compensation and benefits programmes against industry practices in relation to sector wage information of the Skills Framework ~ Check that regulatory and ethical guidelines are followed when handling employee data ~ Conduct diagnostic analytics on HR data to identify causes of behaviours and performance ~ Conduct job analysis and evaluations to propose employees' job size ~ Develop employee communications to inform employees about performance reviews and timelines ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on benefits ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on compensation matters ~ Develop standard reporting templates for performance and rewards management ~ Document action plans and assessment results for poor performers ~ Formulate communications to share organisation's compensation and benefits policies with employees ~ Gather feedback from employees to evaluate effectiveness of performance management programmes ~ Identify data required for analysis of business and/or human resource issues ~ Implement data checks and cleansing techniques to address data availability and quality challenges ~ Implement employee compensation reimbursement plans ~ Liaise with organisation's vendors and partners on benefits and claims processing ~ Organise performance, rewards and other employee data in HR system ~ Prepare contract terms with external vendors for benefits offered ~ Prepare technical and business reports with the analytical findings ~ Review annual salaries report and income tax declaration forms ~ Review benefits claims against entitlements to ensure accurate disbursements ~ Review employer contributions reports ~ Review generated payroll reports ~ Suggest peer companies and competitors of the organization ~ Verify that submitted claims are covered under organisation's benefit schemes

Roles & ResponsibilitiesInvigor is a leading data analytics, insights and loyalty engagement company. We provide a technological platform to the retail sector, giving them access to the latest marketing technologies so they can effectively engage with their customers while increasing loyalty.   Job Description  Develop designs across multiple digital mediums Develop user interface templates and style guides Assist with creative designs for logos and reporting templates Knowledge of, and ability to create relevant content for different devices Conceptualizing and designing unique and fresh collaterals for online/offline contents  Ability to work in a team or independently, and meet tight deadlines RequirementsRequirements:  Proficiency and extensive experience in Adobe Photoshop, illustrator and related programs Profficiency in Microsoft Office Suite programs (Word, Excel and related) Ability to work in a team or independently, and meet tight deadlines Proven expertise in creating varied design projects and outstanding portfolio in relevant work samples Knowledge in UX design  Knowledge in HTML / CSS / JSON and Word Press would be an added advantage but not required

Roles & ResponsibilitiesProduct Development Intern: Part-time Invigor is a leading data analytics, insights and loyalty engagement company. We provide a technological platform to the retail sector, giving them access to the latest marketing technologies so they can effectively engage with their customers while increasing loyalty. Start date: Immediate  Note: candidates must be already based in Singapore. Are you interested in technology and entrepreneurship? Do you have a passion for innovation and product development? Are you a self-starter with a “can do” attitude keen to get some hands-on experience? Are you currently studying or recently graduated with a bachelor’s degree? Then you are eligible to apply for an Internship at Invigor Group, which may lead to a full-time position for the right candidate! Key Responsibilities:   -          Work collaboratively with engineering and product teams to write test case scenarios and ensure the quality of products released. -          Product testing: o   Record and document test results versus expected behaviour. o   Detect software failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected. o   Provide recommendations, where applicable, on product improvements.  Requirementsbout you: You are passionate about all things mobile and product development-related. You love diving under the hood of consumer data to work out what makes us all do what we do. You thrive in start-ups and small team environments where the only thing holding you back is…well… you. We’re looking for an individual who has demonstrated initiative, analytical skills and who is not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get on with it. Flexibility and follow-through is key in our fast-paced environment. This position requires you to work collaboratively with Invigor's Product Management and Engineering Teams to complete product testing and ensure the quality of our solutions before they are launched to market. Your analysis and recommendations will serve as important insights for clients, internal management and product decisions within the team. Candidate requirements: -          Currently studying or recent graduate at Bachelor level or higher (Technology, Engineering or Business majors preferred but other majors are welcome). -          Attention to detail. -          Strong analytical thinking skills. -          Self-starter with the ability to work relatively autonomously. -          Enthusiastic team player. -          An interest/affinity with mobile applications and online shopping.

job_title: Enterprise Sales Account Executive (New Business) - Singapore and Hong Kong Territory
description: Roles & Responsibilities Do you thrive on challenge and have a tenacious appetite for success? Are you currently surrounded by colleagues and a company that can't keep up with you? Are you looking to be paid a healthy compensation for winning business?  We are looking for sharp, high energy and coachable individuals with a strong business acumen.  Successful candidates will have the ability to quickly assess and understand a prospects business environment and needs then apply the business value of Alteryx.  Ideal candidates possess the aptitude to easily engage and establish rapport with executives and line of business professionals. Alteryx will transform your customers business and save them tens if not hundreds of thousands of dollars.  It is your job to demonstrate the ROI in an expeditious manner and is essential to success in this role.    This is an excellent opportunity for a true action-oriented hunter aspiring to become a field sales executive for a market leading data analytics company.   Please note that this position is an office-based quota carrying role.RequirementsRequired Skills and Experience  Minimum of 2 years' sales experience selling SaaS, enterprise software solutions, Business Intelligence, or Analytics software Experience in transactional sales; high velocity History of effectively building self-generating pipeline and exceeding quota is required Ability to effectively communicate in English verbally and in writing. Additional languages preferred but not required. Must be able and willing to travel up to 30% of the time   Desired Skills and Experience  Bachelor's degree preferred  Salesforce.com CRM experience a plus Problem solver: Know how to apply use cases to drive value Fearless: Have a relentless drive to find and qualify new prospects A knack for crafting and delivering a complex value proposition in easily consumed language Process driven: Can prioritize and manage multiple work streams Action oriented: Doesn’t wait to be told what to do

Roles & ResponsibilitiesKey Responsibilities  Objective assurance and review of all Company processes, including operational, financial, and compliance activities, as well as evaluate and assess the adequacy and effectiveness of Company’s risk management, internal controls, and governance processes. Perform continuous risk assessments during the review of processes to identify potential risk exposures, and work with Management to identify sustainable actions that would mitigate these risks. Advise and consult on improvements to process efficiency, effectiveness, and safeguarding of company assets, resources, and information. Conduct all detailed activities required of an internal auditor, including audit memo finalization, data analytics, and workpaper documentation. Requirements Degree qualification or professional certification with good knowledge of internal controls, risk management, governance, and auditing standards.  Minimum 6 years of relevant experience.  Familiarity with the oil & gas or manufacturing industry, and/or an engineering background will be an added advantage. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to perform data analytics using software applications. Demonstrate good leadership skills, creativity, and ability to make independent and objective professional judgments. Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, with ability to work collaboratively with all levels of management. Eager to learn all business processes, standards, regulations, and to develop various skills.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesNUS Business School (Asia Accounting Research Centre) is looking for a suitable candidate to work as a full-time Research Associate under the supervision of Professor KE Bin, Director of Asia Accounting Research Centre. This research is funded by an Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics Grant (AIDA) launched by Singapore’s Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) as part of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) scheme under the Financial Sector Development Fund (FSDF). Responsibilities:  Web crawl structured and unstructured (e.g., text) data from public sources; Clean and construct structured databases from unstructured data sources; Maintain integration scripts for existing data sources; Develop generic methods for extracting and standardizing content from unstructured sources.   RequirementsRequirements:  Have a bachelor or master degree in computer science (or related discipline); High proficiency in natural language processing and web mining using Python and other relevant programming skills; Ability to apply and modify existing machine learning and text mining methods is highly valued; Evidence of creativity and innovation is high valued; Knowledge of statistical softwares such as R, SPSS, STATA, or SAS is a plus; Basic knowledge in asset management/commercial banking/corporate finance/securities/research is a plus. Responsible, hardworking, detail oriented, and perfection-seeking; Ability to work as a team is a must; Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Willingness to learn new things and accept challenges.  The duration of the initial contract is one year but the contract can be renewable for up to three years including the initial one year provided that the job candidate performs satisfactorily in the initial contract. Salary will be competitive and commensurate with the candidate’s qualification and relevant experience. The position starts from January 1, 2019. Interested applicants should send his/her curriculum vitae with complete contact information and any supporting documents to bizfubo@nus.edu.sg. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.

Roles & Responsibilitiesabout the company Our client is a software house which develops digital products and bespoke solutions for their clients. They have presence in more than 10 countries and are known for their innovative mobile and web applications which include emerging technology projects such as IoT, Data analytics and AI solutions for clients ranging from startups to MNCs. They are currently looking to hire a couple of experienced Senior Software Engineers or Tech Leads to build on their current capabilities as they expand their clientele.   about the job You will:  Work with business stakeholders, end users and team members Build reliable, scalable and well-tested systems in accordance to the high engineering best practices within the company Build consumer-facing applications with features such as AI chatbots, data monitoring, data visualisation, etc Continuously research and develop, and keep up to date on newest trends and technologies Act as a scrum master or team lead in a small project group, drive technical developments and create the product roadmap together with the relevant stakeholders Requirementsskills and experience required  Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent More than 5 year experience in Full Stack Development which includes Backend development in various languages such as Go/Node.js/Python/PHP, Frontend such as React.js/Ember.js/Vue.js, and Mobile (React Native/iOS/Android) Experience of writing automated unit & functional tests Strong understanding of data structure, algorithm complexity, etc Experience and advocate in good engineering practices in web development (HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript) Hands-on experience in Docker, Kubernetes, TDD, Linux, API designing, Real-time application streaming Experience in auto-scaling setup, distributed computing, enterprise-level product development, experience of entire software development cycle of a product from scratch and deployment, releasing for production (CI/CD) Passionate about technologies and trends, have strong foundation in Computer Science and understands internally how programming languages are designed, how they work and how they are implemented  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may send your CV to sarah.yang@randstad.com.sg or contact Sarah Yang at +65 6510 3633. Referrals are greatly appreciated! (EA: 94C3609/ R1657816)

job_title: INTERNAL AUDITOR - IT AUDIT [MNC  /  Training Provided]
categories: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Consulting , Risk Management, Information Technology, Professional Services
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesVantage HR Solutions (EA LICENSE NO 10C4871) is a professional executive search consultancy company registered under the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), Singapore. The keen eye we developed over the years enabled us to make accurate assessments about jobs and candidates. We distinguish ourselves through our direct working experience as industry-specific professionals from the industries that we serve. Hence, we have the trade know-how, professional network and track record to recruit the right talents for different business needs. Whether you are seeking the best talents for your organization or looking for a dream career - Vantage HR Solutions has the edge to meet your expectations.  Visit http://vantage.com.sg/ to find out more about our services and other available positions.  Our client is a leading public listed Multi-National Corporation employing more than 10,000 people worldwide across a wide and diverse range of industries in Europe, Asia & Americas. It has established itself as an Employer of Choice due to its' global presence, reputation, drive for innovation as well as its' emphasis on human capital development.   JOB FUNCTIONS:  Part of the Corporate Internal Audit team Specialize in IT Audit Work with global / local business units and subsidiaries across different sectors on audit procedures Responsible for planning and executing IT audit programs, IT audit fieldwork and Operational Audits. Assess the controls effectiveness of ITGC and ERP systems, review and testing for compliance with best practices, policies and procedures. Propose recommendations to improve any weaknesses in the control environment and system vulnerabilities identified. Assist in special reviews, data analytics, CSA programs   THE REWARDS:  You shall have the opportunity to work for a world class and leading global brand name that is both innovation-driven and widely regarded as an Employer of Choice due to its strong emphasis and premium on Human Capital and developing its People. Excellent opportunity for vertical and horizontal career progression due to the diversity and global presence of the Corporation’s operations.    OTHER INFORMATION:  Permanent Position   2 Vacancies required - new headcount due to expansion Good Career Prospects / Staff Benefits Overseas travel required (up to 30%)     RequirementsREQUIREMENTS:  Must have a recognised degree in Accountancy/ Business/ Finance/Computer Science or IT related equivalent. CISA and CIA/CPA/CFE/CCSA/CISSP qualifications and technical knowledge of data analytics (e.g. ACL, IDEAS) including scripting preferred. Knowledge of large ERP systems, cyber security threats and IT General Controls (e.g. change controls, access controls, IT operations and network security) preferred. Willingness to travel on overseas audit assignment when required Knowledge of IT assurance/ compliance audit/ data analytics advantageous Possess good attitude and inter-personal skills to work well with people across a diverse background Preferably with IT Audit / IT Security experience.    APPLICATION:  Apply via Jobsbank or email CV to: careers@vantage.com.sg Please include a recent photo, expected salary, last drawn salary, availability/notice period and reason for leaving past employment(s) in your CV.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a MCT CPEE Max Out Program Engineer, you are to support the Max Out Program Manager in Project Management, liasion with Sites on program prioritites and support needed, drive Network BKM fan out and alignment. You are expected to be strong in communication to connect with the Network, key stakeholders and business partners.    Responsibilities :   MAX OUT PROGRAM MANAGEMENT •Understand Max Out program strategy, priorities, and how they relate to company goals •Lead global, cross-functional task force teams (TFTs) or enabling projects that support Max Out program priorities across the Network and drive accountability through clear communication, informal feedback, effective project management and appropriate use of metrics •Drive continuous improvement of Network Constraint Workstations to BIC performance through, •Benchmarking and analyze Network performance •WPD •Utilization •MA •Lost Time •Standby Time •RPT •Utilize Data Analytics tools to identify tool bottlenecks, hidden factories and productivity loss •Partner with POs and TOs in the identification of opportunities for improvement in workstation performance                     PROJECT MANAGEMENT •Drive technical activity on assigned project on daily basis •Ensure assigned project has appropriate Stakeholders, and deliverables and schedule •Ensure assigned project is progressing on schedule •Identify and mitigate risks and issue which may impact the project •Escalate to project Sponsor when necessary •Provide or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Sponsor and key Stakeholders on current status, risks and issues as needed   SITE AND REGIONAL LIASION •Collaborate within the Site/Region to achieve Site’s objective and goals •Conduct regular 1 on 1s with Site/Region stakeholders to understand site priorities, challenges and support needed •Communicate to Site/Region stakeholders on program priorities, roadmap and any program related changes •Provide or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Site/Region leadership team and stakeholders on Network activities, programs, issues, projects, wins or other items that are necessary •Promote Network communication   NETWORK BKM FAN OUT AND ALIGNMENT •Identify Site BKMs and communicate to Peer Group •Identify Site BKM implementation gap and provide information to Site’s stakeholders •Collaborate with Site’s stakeholders to develop implementation roadmap for applicable BKMs •Support in updating Network BKM heatmap and implementation matrix •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular update to SLT on BKM implementation status COMMUNICATION •Work closely with Program Manager to understand program charter, roadmap and priorities •Facilitate 2 way communication between Site and Program Manager •Provide regular updates to Sponsor and key Stakeholders on current status, risks and issues •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular 1 on 1s with Site’s stakeholders to understand site priorities, challenges, support needed. •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular communication to Site’s stakeholders on program priorities, roadmap and any program related changes •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Site leadership team and stakeholders on Network activities, programs, issues, projects, wins or other items that are necessary •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular update to SLT on BKM implementation statusRequirementsRequirements : •Bachelor Degree in Technical/Engineering/Industrial Engineering Field •Experience in tool productivity issues discovery processes, benchmarking against best-in class performance and data analytical tools •Experience in developing improvement strategies and ability to lead teams to execute productivity enhancement projects •Proactive working attitude and good communication skill •Min 3 years’ experience in Process, Equipment or Manufacturing •Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and present to small and large groups. •Decision making skills using data analysis techniques. •Demonstrated ability to communicate well with peers and managers.   Travel Frequency As needed (up to 35%)   Shift 8+ hour shift, 5 days a week

job_title: Associates - Valuation, Modeling & Economics (Data Analytics), TAS
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) team works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimising, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within TAS include Mergers and Acquisition Services, Project Finance, Restructuring Services, Operational Transaction Services, Transaction Support, Transaction Tax, and Valuation, Modeling & Economics. Join Valuation, Modelling & Economics and you join a team of experienced professionals who bring to clients excellence in accounting, taxation and financial due diligence. You will help guide clients through the model review, model support and model-build activities necessary to make key decisions and improve strategic outcomes. With over 1,600 valuation professionals worldwide, no similarly positioned global professional organisation can match our breadth of capabilities or our depth of resources.   The opportunity We currently have career opportunity for Associates specializing in Data Analytics to join our talented Business Modelling group within Transaction Advisory Services in Singapore. We work across all industries and operate in a broad range of disciplines including:  Decision support Data analytics and visualisation Simulation and optimization (Operational Research) Transaction evaluation Strategic planning and capital allocation Business case development Budgeting, forecasting and planning Other bespoke model development    RequirementsYour key responsibilities  Have a primary focus on data analytics in our decision support and business modelling services Serve as a member of a cross functional team contributing at each phase of the engagement lifecycle Demonstrate high levels of technical and professional knowledge and quickly assimilate new knowledge Proactively contribute as part of the engagement team that partners with client finance and operational professionals Identify issues, propose both strategies and technical approaches and deliver value-adding insights Have the ability to balance technical skills with project management and strong business acumen Maintain and develop positive, productive and professional relationships with clients Commit to developing knowledge, continue to learn and share knowledge with clients and other EY team members Stay abreast of current technology, business and economic developments relevant to our services and client's business    Skills and attributes for success    Ability to bring data analytics capabilities to a traditionally financially focused role, combine their proven experience in data analytics with an understanding of corporate transaction and/or general business acumen.   Appreciation of the key questions that clients may need answered to ensure a transparent, information rich decision making process.     Effectively communicate ideas and findings to a wide variety of stakeholders.   Be intellectually curious and committed to constantly improving their own skills.   Leaders with the ability to quickly anticipate and respond to the issues of constantly changing global economy.     To qualify for the role you must have   A bachelor's degree/master's degree and up to least 1 years of experience in developing descriptive and predictive analytics solutions    Degree in mathematics/statistics or data science  Strong data analysis skills including the ability to identify, extract, manipulate and use statistical methods to analyze large data sets Experience in use of statistical software packages (SAS, SPSS, R) and/or experience in visualization applications (Spotfire, Tableau, PowerView). Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required and some level of VBA knowledge is also preferred but not essential to the role Experience with packages and development environments is highly advantageous but not essential; including simulation products (e.g. Witness, Simul8), optimisation products (CPlex, Xpress-MP) or programming environments (VB.net) Excellent analytical, communication, teamwork and interpersonal skills Capabilities in MS Word and PowerPoint are required Further studies in business or data science fields may also be beneficial to the role This role may also suit candidates with professional experiences in consulting, investment or commercial banking, strategy, venture capital or financial research who are looking to focus on transaction analytics    Ideally, you also have   Experience (work and/or study) in a data science related field with an interest in business or financial transactions.

categories: Consulting , Risk Management, Banking and Finance, Information Technology, Professional Services
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe're looking for analytical and passionate people to join our proven team as Head, Data Analytics based in Singapore. Some things to know before you apply  We have big plans to disrupt the traditional fundraising process for private businesses You will work with a diverse team of former investment bankers, strategy consultants and business owners in developing, monitoring and improving products to facilitate the activity of private investing Everything we do is focused on helping businesses do business, better We work really hard but play really hard as well  Roles & Responsibilities  Oversee and lead the development of the Deal Management System (our proprietary data-driven platform for screening and management of investments); structure and link databases, formalise and implement data collection systems, data analytics pertaining to platform metrics and financial data that we collect in the process of taking on investments, and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality     Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques, identify trends and patterns in complex data sets, and provide ongoing deal analytics reports to support investment decisions Contribute to data mining architectures, modelling standards, reporting, and data analysis methodologies Collaborate with unit managers, end users, development staff, and other stakeholders to integrate Deal Management System and Analytics within existing systems Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis Identify and define new process optimisation opportunities   Provide timely information and insights regarding customers, markets, and campaign effectiveness, to measure performance and support business decisions for product development and marketing enhancement     Implementation and maintenance of web analytics tracking tools (i.e. Adobe Analytics/DTM and Google Analytics/GTM) to aid in collection of web analytics data Able to gather insights from offline and online traffic sources to aid in marketing efforts Retrieval, monitoring, and analysis of all web analytics metrics to gain insights to support the marketing team with testing, decision making and further optimisation Improving the understanding of the customer's web behaviour and optimising the web experience through opportunity identification in tandem with the UX / UI team   Leading the CRM system used to collect and track customers on the Fundnel platform     Maintenance of CRM tool – internally with the team and externally with vendors Oversee tech implementations for collection of customer data Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis in CRM tool Extraction of data for KPI reporting and analysis Targeting customers using relevant customer activity/data sources through CRM tool   Managerial role over the data management team (including hiring and monitoring the team) 3rd party vendor management and integration for various analytics tools used across platforms RequirementsSkills & Experience Required  4+ years of experience Strong experience with implementation of marketing analytics, tracking code and tag integration Experience using Adobe Analytics, DTM, Google Analytics , GTM Familiar with A-B / MVT testing Data Visualisation experience Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation Proficiency in Microsoft Office Preference for Candidates with an understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc. A Diploma or Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics    The ideal candidate should be  Interested in dealing with data, including finding and exploring more efficient ways/programs (e.g. machine learning) to collect, store, and analyse data Able to provide thought leadership in web/product analytics Preferably have some understanding of terms in financial statements and financial ratios Part of a product team working across various product domains with a focus on optimization of product through KPI's and metrics

company: INTEGRATED HEALTH INFORMATION SYSTEMS PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & Responsibilities Drive the use of analytics in healthcare to derive insights for population health and patient care. Leverage analytics in support of policy and programme planning work for key priorities of MOH. Draw talents across healthcare landscape to support and participate in data analytics work. Health Analytics for Clinical Excellence, Operation Efficiency and Cost Effectiveness across the clusters Provide technical advice on ETL design & programming for new projects or change requests. Provide support on existing EDW ETL jobs developed. Provide development work on OBIEE based on report and metadata definition. Liaise closely with vendors or in-house developers to design, configure and test the enhancements made in accordance with IHiS project methodologies and policies. Support the team in analyzing and documenting project requirements through reviewing ETL source codes of other similar projects. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or IT equivalent. Min. 5-7 years of experience working in the IT industry including: Project delivery adopting SDLC, Technical Project Documentation such as ETL Mapping Specs. SAP BODS, Informatica and MS-SQL SSIS ETL programming / testing and OBIEE or equivalent BI reporting tool Oracle Database and PL/SQL scripting Able to work independently as well as an effective team player with strong desire to deliver results. Adaptable and meticulous with strong analytical skills.

Roles & Responsibilities Work with Finance and Planning to develop wafer loading and revenue  	plans Work with Industrial Engineers to determine any capex requirements Data analytics to maximize revenue and margin Review marketing reports to analyze business trends - new markets, CAGR,  	ASP, trends etc Requirements Minimum 5-6 years working experience, preferably related to data analytics and chart analysis and plotting. company: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & Responsibilities  Research the best online channels for digital campaigns and set media plans that align with strategic and business goals   Collaborate with all required departments to build results-focused marketing campaigns   Work closely with vendor contacts for all media plans, including rate negotiation   Measure and optimize campaigns on regular basis to improve performance and be proactive to improve results to ensure KPI goals are met   Work with Data Analytics, Sales Planning and Business Units to report on campaign performance   Create useful reports that helps to identify opportunities while spotting areas of improvement   Manage and evaluate budget levels on a frequent basis and execute tactics to improve efficiencies   Review campaign performance and goals set for future cycles   Be the digital campaign subject matter expert both internally and across business units   Evaluate new media platforms by meeting with vendors, setting up tests and demoing tools  Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising or related field   At least 5 years proven experience with placing and negotiating online paid and programmatic media   At least 3 years of proven experience in planning and executing integrated marketing campaigns   Knowledge of targeted advertising including video, display and geofencing   Knowledge of Google AdWords, SEO, Programmatic buys and Social Media   Experience with Google Analytics   Proficient use of Excel

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Scope  Lead digital analytics within AIA to provide data-driven insights for enterprise-wide digital platforms. Understand business requirements and partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define KPIs aligned with overall corporate strategic direction. Collaborate with working teams to measure effectiveness of various digital platforms including corporate website as well as other digital tools. Apply best practices in tagging and (manage vendors to) ensure accurate, organized and efficient implementation. Create self-service dashboards at the appropriate granularity to monitor and report: 	 KPI metrics and emergent trends Marketing and growth analytics Investigative and behavioural analytics   Help stakeholders understand user behavior from the digital data reported; analyze and translate data into actionable insights. Work alongside data analytics team to analyze customer data and uncover customer insights. Craft compelling fact-based presentations and recommendations to C-suite. Proactively monitor trends to alert business and engineering teams in a timely manner. Drive continuous improvement in digital analytics to optimize data collection and analysis. RequirementsJob Requirements  Excellent analytical capabilities with strong presentation and communication skills Hands-on technical experience in tagging and configuring analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics, Dynatrace, Google Analytics, Tableau, Experience in setting up A/B and multivariate testing Meticulous attention to detail Passion for insights-driven development and logical problem-solving challenges Ability to meet deadlines and work on multiple projects simultaneously Can-do attitude and willingness to dig-in and get things done  Good to Have  Bachelor degree and above in Analytics or related fields 5+ years experience in digital analytics; 3+ years experience in insurance industry strongly preferred Good knowledge with database management and SQL Hands-on scripting / coding skills Experience working with Tableau Excellent command of written and spoken English.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities
Working closely with a team of experienced Researchers from multi-disciplinary backgrounds, you will play an integral part in the conceptualisation and execution of research projects related to public housing. 
You will be part of a team to provide pertinent input and conduct analysis to complement/enhance the value of research projects.  Your responsibilities include compiling and analysing the demographic and socio-economic profile of residents, perform data analytics, statistical modelling on a wide array of data related to various aspects of public housing.  You should have knowledge of suitable tools for data analytics, be able to derive insights from data and propose recommendations/solutions.
 
RequirementsYou should possess a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research or equivalent technical field.  You should also have the versatility and ability to conduct independent research and be able to contribute effectively as a team player.  You should have strong writing skills and can effectively communicate complex data analysis in technical and non-technical ways.  You should also have good interpersonal skills and the ability to establish rapport with people at all levels. 
It would be an advantage if you possess relevant working experience or a strong knowledge in statistical modelling, data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, ArcGis) and predictive analytic tools like R, SAS, etc.  Familiarity with data management, relational databases and SQL would also be considered.
 
 
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Manager (Category Management), you are responsible for FairPrice’s category development management reporting and data analytics functions. You are expected to create value to the team through data analytics applications and market insights gathering for both internal and external clients. You will be working closely with the buying team and suppliers to develop management reporting tools and sales reports to external clients.  Requirements Diploma in any discipline   Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience in management reporting, data analytics, report sales and/or market research, preferably supermarket retail Strong qualitative skills in analysing numbers   Good team player with strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills Thrives in a fast paced FMCG retail environment  Passion for details

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description  As a Senior Programmer Analyst within the Equity Derivatives Data & Analytics Group you will be involved in one of the most significant platform changes within the Equities business. As a group, the entire division is going through an enormous growth, and within the Data area, we have a huge re-architecture to undertake to move from our existing C# services to Java.  The team is critical to the success of this program and has responsibility for the reference and trade data entering the Risk platform as well as having joint responsibilities for the market data for Equity Derivatives. The successful candidate will be key member of the team building out the new platform and migrating existing functionality, data validation and data between the existing and new platforms. The candidate will be required to work with the front office, quants as well as counterparts in the middle office, managing requirements and work-loads across the relevant clients.  Key Responsibilities:  Hands on developer who can turn requirements into a detailed design and delivering to committed timescales with suitable testing Build and deploy applications on Linux platforms. Ensure Citi Markets and Security Services Technology Development Standards are being met.    To apply online via the careers section of Citi E career website, please click via the link below: https://citi.taleo.net/careersection/2/jobdetail.ftl?lang-en&job=18042598RequirementsEssential Skills  Excellent OOD development skills in Java Good SQL experience Sound understanding of design patterns and system architecture. Experience of TDD and/or BDD methodologies Experience of C# or C++ Agile development experience Ability to enforce standards for software development: continuous integration, testing and deployment, information security, software quality and controls. Excellent academic record, degree level minimum - preferably Science, Technology, Mathematics or Engineering (flexible based on experience) Pro-active and dynamic individual who is able to work under pressure in a front-office technology environment  Desirable Skills  Experience of Apache STORM Experience in TeamCity automated build tools Experience with Confluence, JIRA, GIT and/or Bitbucket Experience with SonarCube. Experience of Python Multi-threading Experience of Equity Derivative products Experience of working in a Front Office environment Distributed Application Development Experience of NoSQL data stores.

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYOUR IMPACT Do you want to join a team of highly motivated staff who are aspiring to deliver the world’s best workplace to the people of Goldman Sachs? We are looking for a candidate with an interest in client experience, who enjoys taking an innovative approach to supporting the firm’s core businesses while mitigating risk and driving commercial and operational efficiencies. OUR IMPACT Consisting of Corporate Services and Real Estate (CSRE) and the Office of Global Security (OGS), our teams drive productivity and enable the firm’s flow of business while ensuring its safety and security. CSRE acquires, develops and manages the firm’s global real estate portfolio and delivers innovative market development, document management and hospitality related services to internal partners in the firm.  CSRE’s vision is to provide the world’s best workplace to the people of Goldman Sachs.  We look for achievement-oriented, creative individuals who perform at their best in a diverse team environment and are motivated by tangible results. CSRE’s areas of responsibility include:  Business Services: Delivers high-quality, commercially managed travel, document management and hospitality services to internal partners throughout the firm. Real Estate: Plans, builds and operates the firm's facilities in over 95 cities worldwide, and is critical to ensuring that our core businesses operate efficiently 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Finance: Provides financial analysis, decision support, procurement, contract administration and reporting for all initiatives within the Services Division and for business partners across the firm. Vendor Management Office: Ensures that the firm has established and is consistently applying a structured global framework to effectively manage vendor risk. Administration, Communications and Social Governance: Oversee organizational development, internal communications, environmental stewardship, supplier diversity and community engagement. Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis is an exciting opportunity to join one of the leading and growing university of Singapore. We are seeking for a candidate with prior internal & external auditing experience, preferably with good working knowledge of data analytics, to be part of our newly created audit team.  As a Senior Assistant Director, you will be reporting to the Deputy Director and will be responsible for planning and conducting various internal audits, which may cover financial, operational, compliance and IT systems of controls. You will also have ad-hoc responsibilities such as special/specific investigations and reviews or supporting Senior Internal Audit leadership with planning and administrative assistance. Key Responsibilities:   Your roles and responsibilities would include the following:  Develop and review audit universe (auditable units: by business units and/or processes) Develop and review audit risk assessment methodology Develop and review risk-based audit plans (by business units/processes) Develop and review audit budget required to complete risk-based audit plans Develop and review internal audit programmes Complete relevant audits as required in the approved audit plans Perform special investigations as and when required Review audit working-papers to ensure its quality meets IIA standards Review and evaluate policy/procedures/system designs for any gaps in its adequacy & effectiveness Develop/utilise Data Analytic tools/scripts, where applicable Provide practical and value-added opinions and recommendations Issue timely audit reports Provide on-the-job training to supporting team members Provide advisory services to business unites and auditees as and when required Actively engage the various business units to build good partnership Coordinate with internal colleagues and external audit firms on the audit schedule; meetings and resources required Assist in all administrative work required for running of the Department. Requirements Bachelor degree in Accountancy or any related discipline Hold professional qualifications (e.g. CIA/CRMA/CISA/CFE/CA) At least 10 years of audit experience (internal & external) Working knowledge of data analysis software such as ACL/Tableau would be a plus Familiarity with SAP/Workday systems would be an added advantage Relevant audit experience in the educational/research industry is preferred   Able to work independently Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Meticulous with a keen eye for details Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to deal with all levels of management as well as external professionals Strong report-writing and presentation skills  If you are looking for a career that is rewarding, fulfilling and one that makes a difference to enhancing accountability over the use and management of public funds and resources, join our Internal Audit Office now.    We regret that only shortlisted candidate will be notified.

company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
description: Roles & Responsibilities Develop hardware and software control architectures to support R&D in the areas of offshore hydrodynamics and fluid-structure interactions. This includes developing, documenting, and direct software system testing, troubleshooting, and verification procedures. Develop engineering requirements, specification and validation criteria for high-quality research using combinations of physical experiments, sensing, numerical simulations as well as data analytics to develop integrated physical-numerical modelling & simulations. Survey literature and implement state-of-the-art techniques to solve challenging problems Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to assist in securing further research grants. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor. Requirements Masters/Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics or other related disciplines. Preferably 3 years of relevant postdoctoral/research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas: Strong working knowledge of control systems and formal control theory Experience in control system applications using Advanced/PID controllers for position, speed control of AC/DC servo motors and stepper motors Knowledgeable in embedded system design, microprocessor architecture and real-time programming algorithms, embedded board level C/C++ programming experience in motion control Linux development experience will be an advantage Experience with embedded systems and real time applications will be an advantage Knowledge of common PLC/PAC/SCADA systems Exposure to field bus communications and networking systems Knowledge of 3D CAD tools (Dassault, PTC, and/or AutoDesk) and software like LabView, MATLAB, and Simulink etc. Experience with common engineering simulation and prototyping tools Good interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team. Good command of written and spoken English language. Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities. Job Description  Perform research in the areas of offshore hydrodynamics and fluid-structure interactions pertaining to ocean hydrodynamic environment and behaviour of marine & offshore vessels and floating systems in challenging environments. Conduct extensive and high-quality research using combinations of physical experiments, sensing, numerical simulations using CFD and/or potential flow-based models or other relevant techniques, as well as data analytics to develop integrated physical-numerical modelling & simulations. Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to assist in securing further research grants. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor. Requirements A Masters/Ph.D. from reputable universities in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Ocean Engineering, Marine Engineering, Offshore Engineering, Physical Oceanography, Applied Mathematics or other related disciplines. Preferably 3 years of relevant postdoctoral/research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas.   Deep knowledge in using CFD and/or potential flow-based models to model and simulate ocean wave hydrodynamics, such as nonlinear wave-wave interactions, wave breaking, and wave growth evolution. Physical modelling in wave flume, wave tank or ocean basin. Sensing, data analytics and machine learning. Knowledge of following numerical methods/software is an advantage:    Higher Order Spectral Method (HOSM), Boundary Element Method (BEM) or equivalent potential flow method; and OpenFOAM, StarCCM+ or equivalent CFD software     Good interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team. Good command of written and spoken English language. Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesIntroducing our firm BioQuest Advisory is a Singapore based consulting business led by experienced industry veterans from global technology and consulting firms. We partner our industry clients to transform their business and build sustainable growth. Our key expertise: Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Business Systems Implementation, Business Strategy & Transformation, Process Improvement, Supply Chain Management, Financial Management, Governance & Risk Management. ​ ​Our clients consist of global MNCs and Singapore businesses spanning across multiple industries and Asia Pacific countries.  ​The opportunity BioQuest Advisory is at the exciting phase of our growth in Singapore and across APAC region and is looking for experienced Robotic Process Automation practitioners with strong hands-on technical skills to be part of our journey. The role You would be leading our Robotic Process Automation (RPA) project team to partner our clients on their RPA journey. You would be leveraging on your deep knowledge and experience in a variety of RPA solutions to provide leadership in robotic process design, RPA process identification workshops, RPA development, testing and deployment methodologies. Quality and sustainability of the automated process is of high importance. Your work-scope is not static but dynamic according to each project’s requirements. You would have the opportunity to work with our functional subject matter experts and clients across industries around the Asia region.RequirementsYour profile  Degree in Information Technology or any other related discipline At least 3 years of experience in RPA solution implementation and certified in at least 1 of the top RPA solutions (UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere) More than 5 years of experience in application development, programming in .Net and Object-Oriented Design Good knowledge and experience in robotic process design, RPA configuration, testing, support Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Good communicator, able to think-on-your-feet, have a customer service attitude Enjoy working in a team and is a good team leader and player  Join Us At BioQuest, we value collaboration, teamwork and knowledge transfers. Our culture is friendly and supportive with a strong emphasis on ethics, diversity and inclusiveness. As you grow with our firm, you would be able to leverage on your expertise to help transform our clients’ business and gain experience for your personal professional development. We are committed to providing opportunities and coaching to grow our talents. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Our key expertise: Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Business Systems Implementation, Business Strategy & Transformation, Process Improvement, Supply Chain Management, Financial Management, Governance & Risk Management. ​Our clients consist of global MNCs and Singapore businesses spanning across multiple industries and Asia Pacific countries.   ​The opportunity BioQuest Advisory is at the exciting phase of our growth in Singapore and across APAC region and is looking for experienced consulting practitioners with strong technical skills in a key functional domain like process improvement, finance , HR or operations to be part of our journey. The role You would be part of our management team to steer the growth of the firm. Your role involves:  Building and maintaining a strong sales pipeline Identifying sales opportunities in emerging industry and market trends Working in close collaboration with our technology and business partners Leading engagements and managing senior stakeholders Advice clients on leading and best practice Developing methodologies and tools with subject matter experts Growing and managing our talent pool  Joiners at Manager level would be guided to grow in this role.RequirementsYour profile  Degree in business, management, technology or any other related discipline Strong capabilities in understanding clients’ business challenges and translating to sales opportunities Good understanding of technology disrupters, impact of technology on industries and market trends 4 to 8 years of good track record in delivering business consulting projects, preferably to large MNCs in any of the following areas:   Technology implementation Customer Service Transformation Project management Operational transformation Finance transformation Process improvement Change management Governance, Risk and Controls Shared service   Good communicator, able to think-on-your-feet, have a customer service attitude Demonstrate leadership skills and ability to effectively communicate and manage change   Attributes we are looking for:  Highly motivated with a passion in business consulting and good understanding of technology disrupters Effective communicator and excellent problem solver who can prioritize workloads in a dynamic environment. Strong people skills to manage stakeholders and internal talents Genuine interest in a long-term career with a fast growing firm  Join us At BioQuest, we value collaboration, teamwork and knowledge transfers. Our culture is friendly and supportive with a strong emphasis on ethics, diversity and inclusiveness. As you grow with our firm, you would be able to leverage on your expertise to help transform our clients’ business and gain experience for your personal professional development. We are committed to providing opportunities and coaching to grow our talents. We are an equal opportunity employer.
