Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

company: Ministry of Social and Family Development
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Sector Planning and Development Division works with partners in the social service sector on the overall strategy, plans and capability building for the sector at a macro level. You will drive manpower data collection and analysis, to feed into manpower policy and planning for the social service sector. Responsibilities: You should have a strong interest and passion for data work, and be able to draw insights from data  to inform policy analysis and formulation. Your key responsibilities would include:  Managing the collection and analysis of manpower data through surveys of VWOs/ social service organisations, including driving the set-up of improved systems for data collection and analysis, and cross-linking manpower data with other databases. Assessing the state of manpower in the sector by leveraging on data, including demand and supply analyses, working with other MSF teams to conduct deep-dive analysis of specific sub-sectors, and identifying gaps and weaknesses in our sector’s manpower profile that may require a policy response.  Collaborating with internal counterparts, other government agencies and educational institutes to review and address longer-term manpower pipeline issues, e.g. capacity planning for Pre-Employment Training (PET) and Continuous Education and Training (CET). Tracking utilisation and reviewing implementation of the VWO-Charities Capability Fund (VCF) by NCSS, to better support capability building for the social service sector.    Competencies required:  Functional/Technical Competencies  Tertiary education in a related discipline, preferably in the social sciences, data science, or equivalent, with at least 1 year of relevant work/internship experience. Strong data analytics skills within the context of policy development, and familiarity with or strong interest to learn use of relevant software, e.g. Tableau, R, Python Ability to translate policy considerations into implementation, balancing strategic policy objectives with practical ground realities. A good understanding of Singapore’s social service sector/ landscape would be an advantage.  Generic Competencies  Strong interpersonal skills; comfortable working with people of all levels and able to build good collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Resourceful, ability to multi-task and work independently, including managing operational issues and project timelines.

categories: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Financial Analyst is responsible to provide sound financial analysis to support business decisions. The role will cover both in-depth pricing analysis, implementation efforts as well as working on financial data analytics to help explain business trends, drivers’ movements, corridors changes as well as product mix shift He/she reports to the Senior Director, Revenue and Pricing for Asia Pacific and is based in Singapore. The incumbent is a self-starter with an analytical and inquisitive mind and am driven to communicate business performance to senior leadership in an efficient and effective manner. He/She will collaborate with internal partners from finance, systems, analytics team to produce in-depth analysis of financial results and revenue driver trends and movements.Requirements Produce quality reporting and analysis on pricing changes, business revenue drivers and financial results to key stakeholders and partners Provide support to Business Function on detailed pricing analysis and support billing /system implementation Identify key revenue trends through a combination of analytics, research, discussions with business partners. Perform adhoc revenue analysis for management. Proactively identify and communicate business implications of analysis. Collaborate with cross-teams to enhance quality of management reports. Demonstrates analytical, interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills. Collaborates well with different teams from finance, systems, analytics and able to work through the matrix organization structure. High degree of connectedness and ability to grasp and understand conceptual models Good in data visualization and has superior analytical and problem solving skills and strong attention to detail Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of commitment to meeting timelines Excellent communication skills Expertise in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint required; IBM Cognos TM1 and Hyperion experience would be an advantage Conceptual knowledge of financial database is beneficial Bachelor’s degree in Finance (Accountancy / Business) or equivalent with at least 7 years relevant post qualification experience

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSince 2011, we’ve had a clear mission: money without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, we’re the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders. Today, customers have paid over £1 billion into their borderless accounts and are saving themselves £60 million every month in bank fees. Yet we’re moving less than 1% of the world’s money. There’s still heaps to do and we can’t do it alone. We’re looking for the first Product Analyst to join our rapidly growing growing Singapore office So, what's the job? You will be working with TransferWise Asia-Pacific team to provide the best possible experience for TransferWise customers using our products, driving changes that impact our KPIs, reduce costs and improve convenience.  Your work would be instrumental in successfully launching the Transferwise card in Asia Pacific, reaching millions of customers, bringing a truly revolutionary to the market. Your learnings from data analytics will quantify opportunities that will guide the team to prioritise what to build next, building a strong product roadmap to maximise customer impact Monitor the impact of features we have recently launched and how they have moved our team KPIs You’ll work side-by-side with product, engineering and finance to create a strong understanding of our cost structure ensuring that your analysis and insights translate into action and a better experience or pricing for our customers Develop a strong understanding of the local payments industry and find opportunities that lead to changes in our partnership setup You’ll need to build relationships with teams across the company, from finance and engineering to our customer support and operations. Be the go-to person for TransferWise APAC data and regularly present an update to the team on your new insights, costs and impact of product changes.  How you will create impact  Your work would be instrumental in successfully launching the TransferWise card in Asia Pacific, potentially reaching millions of customers, bringing a truly revolutionary to the market. You would lead our effort in making our Transferwise Card a truly sustainable product, a rarity in the card industry. We only reach 2% of our potential customers in APAC. You would be at the center of the next phase of growth of the company in the region, helping us launch new markets like India, Thailand and Malaysia. RequirementsA bit about you  Experience with product analysis (examples of analysing customer data to inform successful product changes - using SQL, Excel, Python etc to do this) Excellent communication skills - you can summarise the complex, and present data visually in a way that makes people say “got it!” You go beyond the numbers and understand how the customer is using our product, combining data analysis with customer empathy You live up to the TransferWise values and have a deep knowledge of our product You’re a self-starter who’s comfortable working autonomously and with teams located across our offices. You pick where your focus should be based on your knowledge of the product Analysts at TransferWise pick the best tools for the job. Besides solid SQL and Excel, you are familiar with either Python or R, and you are keen to learn the tools needed for a given task Experience of working in card payment industry (schemes, acquirers, etc.) is a plus If you’re interested in Data science, we will have some small projects to start with  Our People At TransferWise, you’ll be joining a movement of people who believe in a better, fairer, more transparent way of moving money around the world. You’ll collaborate to do your best work and take on problems that no one has looked at before. If you’re keen to learn, grow, try new things and aren’t afraid of a bold plan, you’ll fit right in.

He/She oversees the preparation of the payroll reports and works with benefits partners for claim disbursements.He/She ensures the accuracy of performance and compensation records in the systems, as well as ensuring regulations are followed. He/She performs data analytics and shares insights reports with senior members of the team.He/She works well in a team environment, and is able to communicate well with various stakeholders. He/She possesses an analytical mind and displays keen insight into data, using them to address issues and find solutions to work challenges.Requirements ~ Analyse employee demographics and associated risk exposure ~ Analyse employee feedback on benefits schemes ~ Analyse historical and current HR data to recognise trends and patterns in performance and rewards ~ Analyse utilisation rate of employee benefits and programmes ~ Benchmark organisation's compensation and benefits programmes against industry practices in relation to sector wage information of the Skills Framework ~ Check that regulatory and ethical guidelines are followed when handling employee data ~ Conduct diagnostic analytics on HR data to identify causes of behaviours and performance ~ Conduct job analysis and evaluations to propose employees' job size ~ Develop employee communications to inform employees about performance reviews and timelines ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on benefits ~ Develop frequently asked questions and responses on compensation matters ~ Develop standard reporting templates for performance and rewards management ~ Document action plans and assessment results for poor performers ~ Formulate communications to share organisation's compensation and benefits policies with employees ~ Gather feedback from employees to evaluate effectiveness of performance management programmes ~ Identify data required for analysis of business and/or human resource issues ~ Implement data checks and cleansing techniques to address data availability and quality challenges ~ Implement employee compensation reimbursement plans ~ Liaise with organisation's vendors and partners on benefits and claims processing ~ Organise performance, rewards and other employee data in HR system ~ Prepare contract terms with external vendors for benefits offered ~ Prepare technical and business reports with the analytical findings ~ Review annual salaries report and income tax declaration forms ~ Review benefits claims against entitlements to ensure accurate disbursements ~ Review employer contributions reports ~ Review generated payroll reports ~ Suggest peer companies and competitors of the organization ~ Verify that submitted claims are covered under organisation's benefit schemes

address: TECHPLACE II, 5006 ANG MO KIO AVENUE 5 569873
description: Roles & Responsibilities Assist Internal Audit Head to define IT audit universe and draft annual IT risk-based audit plan. Lead IT audit planning and development of audit programs. Evaluate adequacy and effectiveness of IT controls (general and application controls). Determine compliance with Company IT policies, best practices, standards and government regulations. Draft concise audit reports in English for all levels of key stakeholders including senior management. Draft audit work papers to support audit test work and conclusions. Review audit team’s documentation to ensure quality. Enhance IT control processes by identifying improvement opportunities and work together with IT stakeholders to develop appropriate remediation plans. Establish strong working relationships with key stakeholders and business internal auditors. Participate in IT related projects including process automation, data analytics and ad hoc investigations.   Requirements Degree holder in Information Technology/Computer Engineering from a recognized institution. 4 - 8 years of experience in IT auditing with public accounting firm, preferably with prior audit exposure in electronics manufacturing services domain. Experience in performing audits for compliance with COBIT framework and ITIL practices. Subject matter expertise in one or more following is desirable: information security, data privacy, software development, operating system and SAP audits. Data analytics experience is a significant advantage. Experience in data analytics software including Audit Command Language (ACL) and Tableau are desired. Excellent command of written and verbal English communication skills for interaction with all levels of stakeholders including senior management. Ability to speak and read Bahasa Malay or Mandarin is desirable as the incumbent will be involved in audits of subsidiaries in Malaysia and China. Willing to travel internationally to factories and offices in Malaysia, China, United States and Spain. Traveling is equivalent and/or less than 50%. Professional certification in CISM, CISA, CISSP, CIA or CFE is preferred

Roles & Responsibilities• Multi-faceted  • Pioneer role in Asia  • Transformational initiatives   Our client is a leading FMCG company with an illustrious heritage and innovative products. To support their growth initiatives in Asia, they are looking for a high calibre Compliance Manager to join their team in Singapore.  Reporting to the CFO, you will lead the development and refinement of their Internal Controls and Compliance framework in Asia Pacific. This will include active review of current financial risk management and operational controls, and establish best practices to enhance operational efficiency. In addition, you will spearhead the deployment of data analytics to identify fraudulent transactions and formulate mitigation strategies.   Travelling in excess of 30% is anticipated.   RequirementsYou are a qualified CA with at least 8 years of relevant experience, ideally gained with blue chip FMCG multinationals. Prior exposure to data analytics and fraud investigations would be essential for success in this role. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and you are excited about being the pioneer in the function. A seasoned business partner, you have a demonstrated track record in establishing IA function/ processes and educating business stakeholders on risk mitigation.   To apply, please submit your resume (in MS Word format) to Cynthia Ang at ca@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number CA 14590. We regret that only successfully shortlisted applicants will be contacted.  Licence No: 16S8060; Registration No: R1106954    Type of Work: Permanent Region: Singapore Licence No: 16S8060

Roles & ResponsibilitiesKey Responsibilities I.    Planning the audit 1.    Assist the Head of Internal Audit in developing and executing the annual audit plan. 2.    Assist the Head of Internal Audit in risk assessment planning for processes and systems. 3.    Assist in developing the program of internal audits to determine the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls in addressing financial, operational and compliance risks. II.    Conducting the audit 4.    Perform tests in accordance to audit programs and execute the fieldwork within assigned audit man days. 5.    Provide documentation in workpapers as evidence of audit work performed. 6.    Incorporate use of data analytics (e.g. excel) in audit assignments. 7.    Work with various stakeholders to identify and implement best practices and effective controls. III.    Evaluating and reporting results 8.    Identify improvements in processes and develop cost-effective measures to mitigate overall risk  9.    Discuss findings with auditees constructively in order to jointly develop the most appropriate solutions to issues. 10.    Draft written audit reports to management stating the findings and recommendations in regard to systems, internal controls and other appropriate matters. 11.    Present audit findings to auditees during exit meeting. 12.    Review and appraise the adequacy of management’s agreed action plans in addressing the risks and recommendations identified. 13.    Perform follow-up audits ensuring management actions are completed within the agreed time scales and to escalate overdue higher risk items. 14.    Assist the Head of Internal in any reporting to Senior Management and Audit Committee. Others 15.    Assist in special projects, ad-hoc assignments and investigations as required. 16.    Keep abreast of developments in the auditing and pre-school educational industry to assist in update of audit methodology. 17.    Supports the Association and Company’s goals and philosophy. He or she shall actively involved in corporate projects, fund-raising efforts and community service etc.  RequirementsThe Executive, Internal Audit will support the Head of Internal Audit to ensure that the Internal Audit Function provides an independent assessment of the adequacy of the Company’s internal systems and controls and compliance with regulations.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesDDB is the Most-Awarded Effie agency in Singapore, having ranked No.1 in effectiveness for five consecutive years.  We specialise in marketing and brand strategy, consumer planning, advertising, design, interactive, data analytics, direct marketing, promotion and research. DDB in Singapore is part of DDB Worldwide, the fourth largest communications network in the world, with 206 offices in 96 countries.   Scope  The Senior Copywriter is responsible for generating the words, slogans and audio scripts that accompany advertising visuals.  This may include conceptualising ideas, creating slogans, catchphrases, messages and straplines for digital campaigns. It also involves writing text for print advertising, as well as scripts for radio jingles and TV commercials.  Key Responsibilities:  Partner creative directors to ensure the team’s creative output is aligned with client goals and strategies. Build a strong relationship with business and client directors. Motivate, mentor and nurture junior creatives to aim for and achieve creative excellence. RequirementsRequired Skills & Preferred Qualifications:  Minimum 6 years’ experience.  Strong client facing and ability to manage several stakeholders. Copy-based with strong digital thinking.  Extremely detailed and process-focused. Versatile across different media channels, business verticals and brand voices. Strongly prefer a candidate with understanding of and experience in local (Singapore) and regional markets.  Interested applicants, please send your resumes to  career@sg.ddb.com indicating current and expected salaries.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesDDB is the Most-Awarded Effie agency in Singapore, having ranked No.1 in effectiveness for five consecutive years.  We specialise in marketing and brand strategy, consumer planning, advertising, design, interactive, data analytics, direct marketing, promotion and research. DDB in Singapore is part of DDB Worldwide, the fourth largest communications network in the world, with 206 offices in 96 countries.  Scope The Copywriter is responsible for generating the words, slogans and audio scripts that accompany advertising visuals.  This may include conceptualising ideas, creating slogans, catchphrases, messages and straplines for digital campaigns. However, it also involves writing text for print advertising, as well as scripts for radio jingles and TV commercials. Primary Responsibilities  Liaise with clients and interpret their briefs Develop creative ideas and concepts, often in partnership with the art director Present ideas to colleagues and clients Familiarise yourselves with your clients’ products and services, the target audience and their competitors’ activities Write clear, persuasive, original copy Be in-synch with the trends in digital media Proofread copy to check spelling and grammar Amend, revise or redevelop advertisements or campaigns in response to feedback from the creative director, account team or clients Oversee campaigns through the production stage to completion Work on several campaigns at once, sometimes under pressure and often to tight deadlines Cast actors for TV and radio work, and listening to voice tapes Liaise with production companies, photographers, typographers, designers and printers Keep up to date with popular culture and trends Monitor the effectiveness of advertising campaigns RequirementsRequired Skills & Preferred Qualifications  Highly creative and imaginative Understanding of digital platforms Possess good written and interpersonal skills Work well in a team Able to work under pressure An interest in commerce, popular culture, and new advertising trends and techniques  Interested applicants, please send your resumes to career@sg.ddb.com indicating current and expected salaries.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesDDB is the Most-Awarded Effie agency in Singapore, having ranked No.1 in effectiveness for five consecutive years.  We specialise in marketing and brand strategy, consumer planning, advertising, design, interactive, data analytics, direct marketing, promotion and research. DDB in Singapore is part of DDB Worldwide, the fourth largest communications network in the world, with 206 offices in 96 countries.    Scope:  The Senior Art Director is responsible for the visual creation of advertising campaigns, including print, TV and collateral material.  This includes establishing the conceptual and stylistic direction for clients’ projects and orchestrating the work of production artists, photographers, illustrators, pre-press technicians, printers and anyone else who is involved in the development of a project.      You need to have the imagination, drive and enthusiasm for producing industry-leading work.   Key Responsibilities:  Work closely with the Copywriter to generate creative ideas and concepts to fulfil clients’ brief. Produce sketches or 'storyboards' (television) or 'scamps' (print) to communicate ideas to the clients. Gain an understanding of the target audience and business that the advertisement is aimed at. Meet with the Creative Director and Account Manager before presentation of ideas to clients. Pitch ideas to clients. Brief other members of the team. Commission photographers, artists or film-makers to work on projects. Visit and assess locations for potential shoots. Work on location. Attend meetings at production houses and with other directors. Work in editing suites to oversee the finished product. RequirementsRequired Skills & Preferred Qualifications:  Good communication skills and the ability to express abstract ideas visually. Creation and implementation of the visual design elements associated with brand positioning, public relations and strategic marketing for conveying clients’ unique message. Understanding of clients’ vision and ensuring its development by the team. Creation and administration of project schedules and budgets. Ability to maximize the financial resources and earnings of both clients and company.  Interested applicants, please send your resumes to career@sg.ddb.com indicating current and expected salaries.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, App Store Analytics - Business & Marketing
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAt Apple Media Products (AMP) Analytics, we analyze large-scale data across customer and content provider touch points in order to develop metrics and deep insights to measure performance and drive strategy.  Our culture is about getting things done iteratively and rapidly, with open feedback and debate along the away; we believe analytics is a team sport.   We encourage independent decision-making and taking smart risks. AMP Analytics collaborates deeply with stakeholders across product, design, engineering, and business teams: our mission is to drive innovation at Apple through deep quantitive research of the App Store, Apple Music, iTunes Video, iBooks, Podcasts amongst other services.  Dive deep into large-scale data to uncover trends and identify key insights that will propel the App Store business and marketing strategy. Shape how best to monitor, measure and understand business performance with a focus on Asia. Collaborate with business, marketing, finance and executive teams to generate regular presentations for C-level. Partner with other Apple organizations on data gathering, data governance, evangelizing KPIs and democratizing data.   Requirements Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics or relevant field. Ideally, Masters in related field. 4+ years of experience in a Data Scientist or Data Analyst role, preferably for an app or digital subscription business. Strong and curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action. Well-versed SQL languages. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark preferred. Familiarity with Python or R and data visualization tools such as Tableau for full-stack data analysis, insight synthesis and presentation. Experience using relevant statistical packages to build predictive/ML models. Familiarity with A/B test experimentation design. Outstanding communication, interpersonal and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail. Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage work to tight deadlines and handle the pressure of executive requests and product launches.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation. Requirements~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels. Rotation shift is compulsory

company: DOW TECHNOLOGIES AND SYSTEMS PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLooking for Systems Analyst with a good exprience in ETL, BI tools to build data marts to support data analytics.Requirements Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent. At least 3 - 5 years of experience working with data warehouse methodologies, dimensional data modelling, ETL (extraction, transformation, load) scripting to process data from operational source systems into the data warehouse. Strong competency in SQL, linux shell scripting, python programming.  Knowledge of Amazon Redshift, GA360 Big Query, BI tools (e.g. Sisense, Tableau) would be an advantage. Able to work independently with minimal supervision. Good verbal and written communication skills

Roles & Responsibilities Work with Finance and Planning to develop wafer loading and revenue 	plans Work with Industrial Engineers to determine any capex requirements Data analytics to maximize revenue and margin Review marketing reports to analyze business trends - new markets, CAGR, 	ASP, trends etc Requirements Minimum 5-6 years working experience, preferably related to data analytics and chart analysis and plotting. Able to draw conclusion and correlation with data and charts Very proficient in Excel, Powerpoint, or any software analytics for data and chart presentations. Bonus if he or she is in semiconductor industry.  Manufacturing, Banking, Oil/Gas industry no issue at all. Degree in recognised university, shown and displayed eagerness to learn and willing to accept challenges. English proficiency in speaking and writing (since he/she needs to deal with our corporate team and senior management) Willing to dive into semiconductor industry and pick up basic semiconductor fab, process, product and business aspect, if he or she has no semiconductor background. Confident, self-motivated, ambitious, able to withstand pressure and stress.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Head of Digital Marketing, the UX/UI Designer is expected to gather user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you.   Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.   Responsibilities:   Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with Digital Solution Lead and Business Stakeholders Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, wireframes, prototype and sitemaps Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables) Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness) Conduct and assess usability tests and user researches through interviews, surveys, workshops, A/B testing and data analytics tools Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images; propose guidelines and styles updates to Regional Design team Partner with the Regional Design team on the management of digital branding elements Establish comprehensive reporting suite, to identify marketing performance, identify winning user experience and content to help improve and strengthen web and mobile presence and brand share of voice Stay informed with the latest developments of user experience and design methodologies, best practices, trends etc. RequirementsRequirements:  Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role; at least 4-5 years working experience Experience with user interface design patterns and standard User Centered Design methodologies Must be able to document and organize elements of the web/mobile applications into a coherent manner for technical development, work with minimal supervision; flexible to switch rapidly between different projects and manage them in a timely manner. Quantitative and user behavior analysis skills; working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics  Fluency in Sketch, Abstract & it’s various plug-ins; (Wireframe.cc , Craft, Invision and Launchpad) Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign skills Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap or equivalent frame work Ability to think strategically and creatively develop solutions around the current challenges faced by users on the platform While being a creative thinker who can generate and appreciate innovative ideas and solutions, is also commercially-minded with strong business acumen.  Have a passion for understanding customers, and experience in building a customer oriented culture.  Superior verbal and written presentation skills to communicate clear, concise findings and actionable recommendations to both internally with functionally and geographically diverse teams and externally with creative and digital agencies.  Excellent project management skills, good operational and process orientation.

Roles & Responsibilities· Responsible to manage and oversee the entire F&B Store operations and create strategy succession planning for all Stores in the Singapore region · Lead and supervise the Store operation management team to complete the various operational indicators formulated by the company standards alignment, resources and business segment; · Oversee and work with finance department to prepare yearly Store budgets, conduct budget plans and sales data analytics · Develop; review and update SOP to ensure store operation standards and procedures are met within the F&B market standards or adhere to any regulatory compliance · Lead & coach all operation team members to strategized in achieving Store deliverable daily/monthly targets, workplace safety & hygiene standards, product quality & Store staffs quality of services · Responsible in supporting on any new stores opening or setups to meet deadlines and ensure smooth running of the full operations setup · Identify and resolve for any services or product issues , to redevelop action plans and create process improvements method for recovery · Oversee to ensure staffs training under the Store operation are keep up-to-date to service quality standards · Monitor the political, economic, legislative and regulatory environments relevant to the industry · Oversee the management of the risk portfolio across services, programs and projects. · Assist in the formulation for all stores short-term, medium-term and long-term plan in alignment to the management business objectives, and implementation Participate in weekly general or operation meetingsRequirements· Minimum Degree in any discipline relating to business management, F&B management or equivalent · Minimum of 7 years of relevant work experiences in the F&B industry or similar business would be an advantage · Bilingual in both English & Chinese to liaise with both corporate staffs and our Chinese-speaking associates · Able to demonstrate significant past success in autonomous roles or settings. · Ability to work independently without supervision required · Self-starter and result orientated · Good team player and high analytical skills · Strong interpersonal & communication skills

Roles & ResponsibilitiesA local based one-stop quality supplier of instrumentation and control equipment in the Southeast Asian region.  Dynamic working environment Self-starter, independent learner and a game-changer If you’re looking for an easy job, this is NOT for you  Job Responsibilities:   Conceptualize and implement overall brand building campaigns and marketing communications strategy with strong emphasis on digital marketing, online PR, social media content creation and long-term CRM strategies. Develop & execute sales and marketing proposals and marketing plan as directed by the management (leads management, Electronics Direct Mailers (EDM), database management). Develop and implement eCommerce strategy and conduct research market in order to discover new trends and technologies in order to improve website performance. Engage with multi-disciplinary teams internally (Principal Partners, Product Manager, Sales, eCommerce) and external agencies (Press, Media and Event Agencies or other subcontractors) to bring ideas to life. Responsible for the overall creation of digital content, print collateral, demo-kits and media announcements by using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator to design posters, banners, e-news and other various artworks. Plan & organize events and exhibitions and shall be involved in the company’s exhibition as an exhibitor. Develop local or export opportunities by identifying vertical market, new customers and sales channel. Manage customer database and use it for Customer Relationships Management (CRM). Evaluate effectiveness of marketing efforts; benchmark against industrial standards and internal objectives. Leverage on data analytics to propose improvements. Prepare comprehensive and insightful reports by gathering market intelligence and conduct market research on the industry, the competitors, customers and other marketing mixes. Budgeting and expenses tracking. Build on the existing vendor list of printers, design house, freelancers, specialized agencies. Source for new contacts and negotiate for the best deal to optimize spending. Establish data management and tracking systems. Ensure brand assets and marketing collaterals can be easily shared across departments. Requirements Minimum diploma in Marketing or Digital Marketing At least 2 years of industrial marketing experiences is required (preferable in measuring instruments or industrial equipment) Knowledge in Adobe Creative Suite software (Photoshop and Illustrator) is a must Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills in English Resourceful, creative and self-motivated individual Good understanding of digital marketing and eCommerce platform Willing to travel due to marketing events and research Willing to work beyond usual working hours to manage marketing event(s) Candidates with some IT background will be an advantage Able to start within a short notice  With regret, we does not entertain recruitment agency.

job_title: Team Member in COO Investment Management Asia Pacific #120416
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesTeam Member in COO Investment Management Asia Pacific #120416 Credit Suisse Company Overview As one of the world's leading financial services group, Credit Suisse provides its clients with investment banking, private banking and asset management services worldwide.  Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has a long tradition of meeting the complex financial needs of a wide range of clients, offering advisory services, comprehensive solutions and innovative products to companies, institutional clients and high-net-worth private clients globally. The Credit Suisse Group is active in over 50 countries and employs approximately 46,000 people.  Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com. Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com We Offer…      The opportunity to be a member of the regional COO team within the Investment Management department responsible to watch the discretionary mandates business and operations across all Asia Pacific locations, including:  Performance Analytics: You will prepare and validate the investment performance figures of selected mandates, strategies and composites; you will monitor, analyze and report the performance to portfolio managers and senior management; you will maintain and evolve the performance reporting tools. Your challenges will be the accuracy of the figures, the depth of the analysis and the timeliness of the reporting.   Data Analytics: as a savvy data cruncher you will handle daily data about investment strategies, portfolio, financial instruments and more, with the goal to answer partners’ requests, to investigate specific situations and to support the COO team in its product control and risk monitoring activities.   Technical Solutions: as proficient Excel and Bloomberg user you will maintain, optimize and further develop the reporting platform; you will support the portfolio managers and the senior management with ad-hoc solutions addressing changing business needs; you will support the COO team by building and maintaining solutions dedicated to risk monitoring and product control.   Projects & platforms: you will contribute to or, depending on your skill level, assume a leadership role in projects aiming to improve and strengthen the Investment Management platform and processes. These projects are business, technology or regulatory driven, involving a numerous partners throughout the organization. This will give you the chance to develop your project management and leadership skills and to increase your visibility in the organization. RequirementsYou Offer…  You possess a Degree with a major in Business Administration, Economics or Finance (CFA, FRM, CIPM is an advantage). You have at least 5 years work experience in either a performance measurement, investment management or business management function. Your proficiency in Excel (macro is a requirement); Bloomberg is also an advantage. You have conceptual and analytical mindset with a positive ‘can-do’ attitude. You have strong dedication to understand performance figures, to handle skillfully large data volumes, to deliver accurate results timely, to challenge and improve sustainably existing processes. You have constructive and assertive personality, being a team-player who feels comfortable working across various departments, regions and divisions.  Credit Suisse is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation. Requirements~ Analyse data for business insights identification.  ~ Analyse production efficiencies.  ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions.  ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield.  ~ Develop On-the-job training programme.  ~ Develop workplace learning plan.  ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise.  ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans.  ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement.  ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling.  ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance.  ~ Lead change management in the organisation.  ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources.  ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation.  ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks.  ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity.  ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes.  ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

job_title: SVP, Head of Regional Risk & Control, Institutional Banking Group Operations, T&O (180004BT)
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose  Responsible for overall Ops risk compliance and awareness for group IBGO across all locations. Constantly upskill and enhance Ops risk control practices, in particular, to leverage on data analytics to drive and establish future control framework. Key Accountabilities   Closely monitor and proactively manage operational risks and emerging risks for IBGO. Leverage on data analytics to drive new risk management framework Represent IBGO at key forums and explain risk initiatives to stakeholders. Provide leaderships and guidance to Network Management Team members.  Responsibilities   Risk and Control  Monitor risk landscape, MIS and control scorecard to analyse IBGO risk profile and highlight adverse trends for actions Provide risk & control advisory to line managers/location risk managers on errors, risk events, control lapses, and deep dive into root cause analysis Review UDMA used by IBGO units and residual risk acceptance across regions to ensure appropriateness for approval Drive and implement risk & control framework and standards across all IBGO locations to identify, assess, monitor and control operational risk Lead and manage regional risk & control projects for IBGO globally Represent IBGO at key risk & control forums, such as T&O Ops Risk Forum, IBG BCC and FCWG Chair IBGO Risk Meeting to effectively communicate key risk initiatives and control topics to location IBGO Heads and risk managers Provide trainings to raise staff awareness on risk & control    Network Management  Provide leadership and formulate strategic plan to guide Network Management team members  Lead team to embark on the digital transformation journey and automate processes for efficiency Consolidate key challenges and issues for reporting to FIG Heads and make recommendations for resolution Meet key management members from Nostro agents and custodians to discuss strategy for better services, negotiate fees and resolve service quality issues Lead teams to conduct service quality survey for Nostro agents and custodians  Perform quality assurance checks on high risk areas, such as dormant Nostro accounts   Requirements University degree with at least 15-20 years of experience working in financial institutions. Adequate understanding of regulatory environment in banking  Hands on experience and good appreciation of operational risk management, preferably with experience in leading teams Ability to dive into details whilst keep sight of the big picture to connect the dots Good organization and time management skills. Knowledge of banking, policies, processes, controls and systems Excellent presentation skills Excellent working attitude and collaborative working style Team player with good inter-personal and the ability to work with multiple cross-functional stakeholders

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose: We are seeking a Manager of Contracts and Events (C&E) for the Asia-Pacific region .  This is a person who is passionate about delivering successful events, achieving the dual objectives of great participants’ experience and effective cost management. The events are primarily professional development (PD) events for IB educators across the Asia-Pacific region. An event will have multiple PD workshops running concurrently, the largest event having around 40 concurrent workshops. As the manager, you will partner very closely with the manager of PD. Broadly, the manager of PD looks after the upstream activities of scheduling workshops and events, while you look after the downstream activities relating to events execution. The two managers must partner closely to deliver the growth of PD in the Asia-Pacific region, producing educators ready to deliver IB’s style of education and generates income to support IB’s operations and growth.  There are about 900 schools that offer IB’s programmes across the Asia-Pacific region. Teachers of IB programmes must be upskilled via IB PD workshops. The PD department delivers approximately 1,400 workshops from a catalogue of 200 titles, educating 20,000 teachers annually. The workshops can be delivered as In-School Workshops, which are produced individually and on-demand for a specific school. Or as Regional Events, each a portfolio of multiple workshops that draws teachers from different schools across a region. The PD department delivers approximately 60 PD Regional Events annually. Typically, the Regional Events are hosted by IB schools and to a lesser extent in commercial venues. To be effective, you need to possess strong partnering skills as the IB schools are also one of the most important stakeholders of IB. Your expertise will be instrumental in leading and shaping a team of three Event Associates and one Event Administrator. This position reports to the Global Head of Professional Development Delivery.  Job Duties:   Manage the quality of events, partner with the Quality Assurance team to gather participants’ experience data, manage the process and team to elevate quality.   Manage the contracting and payment of suppliers, ensuring that they adhere to IB’s policies and processes. Put in place effective controls for risk and fraud management.   Manage the events’ budgets, put in place effective processes to produce effective expenditure forecasts and ongoing expenditure monitoring and management.   Manage the partnering process with IB schools or commercial venues to ensure timely commitment of schedule and capacity, in order to assist the PD manager in the production and ongoing update of the regional workshop calendar.   Overall responsibility in managing the operating budget of the C&E department   Manage the Event Associates to gather market intelligence to assist the PD manager to project and target PD demand.   Partner with managers of PD Delivery departments of the other regions to improve process alignment and achieve better effectiveness and efficiency.   Partner with other departments for the appointment of workshop leaders, development and packaging of PD products.   Partner with the Data Analytics team to develop analytic tools, reports and dashboards to support business growth.   Partner with IT to improve existing participant registrations and customer relationship management systems and process.   Partner with the PD manager to explore new delivery models to grow the PD business  Requirements Bachelors’ degree required and a combination of experience, education and training that would provide the level of knowledge and ability required for the position.  Some understanding of education administration and professional development of educators is advantageous.   At least 5 years of experience in managing a team to execute large scale events   At least 5 years of direct experience managing large scale events   At least 5 years of experience in supplier management.   Advanced level of analytical, strategic thinking, data interpretation, and problem-solving skills   Highly proficient in MS Office applications   Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills   Experience working in a global organization and partnering with other departments to deliver results   Ability to handle and drive change   Some travel is required

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis position will be responsible to focus on building Centre of Excellence (CoE) for Talent Acquisition ensuring that the University continues to attract the best talent to support its strategic goals. This role will report to the Chief Human Resource Officer. Responsibilities  Own governance & policies of recruitment / employment / transfer and candidate value proposition for NTU branding.  Responsible for all end-to-end recruitment for senior hires across all admin functions and drive high potential recruitment.  Build strong partnership with functional heads to develop and execute talent acquisition strategies in hiring best talents to accelerate University’s growth. Develop recruitment strategies and solutions, execute and deliver outstanding recruiting services aimed at increasing candidate and internal stakeholder experience. Develop and implement talent pipeline strategies via passive candidate management to fill talent gaps. Champion strategic initiatives including employer branding by leveraging social media tools, recruitment data analytics, onboarding, internships, talent builder and leadership program. Build up talent acquisition capabilities by providing coaching and training to the hiring manages and shared services team to upskill capabilities in interviewing and selection. RequirementsRequirements  Bachelor Degree in Human Resources or related discipline At least 10 years of relevant progressive HR experience, preferably in a business partnering role with focus in talent acquisition space Experience in managing framework, programs and initiatives at CoE level Good understanding and practical application of local employment law and HR practices, and be familiar with the emerging HR trends Proven interpersonal skills and ability to influence, negotiate and communicate in building strategic relationships with senior stakeholders Demonstrated leadership experience in managing teams to deliver HR outcomes Ability to manage multiple priorities and navigate in a complex organization environment Versatile and resourceful with proven track record in delivering objectives Excellent communication and presentation skills Self-motivated team player with strong problem solving skills  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose: We are seeking a Manager of Professional Development Delivery for the Asia-Pacific region. This is a person who is passionate about the growth of IB education in the region and understands the importance of Professional Development (PD) in supporting this growth. PD produces educators ready to deliver IB’s style of education and generates income to support IB’s operations and growth. The person needs to think of PD as “a business with a noble mission” and has the fortitude to improve its system and governance to deliver strong growth. There are about 900 schools that offer IB’s programmes across the Asia-Pacific region. Teachers of IB programmes must be upskilled via IB PD workshops. The PD department delivers approximately 1,400 workshops from a catalogue of 200 titles, educating 20,000 teachers annually. The workshops can be delivered as In-School Workshops, which are produced individually and on-demand for a specific school. Or as Regional Events, each a portfolio of multiple workshops that draws teachers from different schools across a region. The PD department delivers approximately 60 PD Regional Events annually.  You will work in close partnership with teams across IB to develop, schedule and promote PD products, in order to grow and capture market demand. Overall, the PD Manager is responsible for increasing the enrolment for PD workshops, improve the learning outcome and increasing our income from them. Your expertise will be instrumental in leading and shaping a team of three that will support the responsibilities of the Manager of Professional Development Delivery. This position reports to the Global Head of Professional Development Delivery.  Job Duties:   Develop and deliver annual forecasts of PD volumes   Develop and execute the strategy that meets the forecast and grows the PD business   Maintain and improve PD workshops within the IB Asia-Pacific region, ensure the IB quality assurance framework is adhered to. Review and respond to workshop Quality Assurance Framework evaluations in order to maintain highest quality PD trainings   Manage external providers and their workshops, serve as PD point of contact for all external providers’ workshop inquiries   Manage the PD department and improve its systems and processes to support business growth   Budget, forecast and reporting of workshop income   Overall responsibility in achieving/surpassing budgeted income   Overall responsibility in managing the operating budget of the PD department   Project demand to schedule an annual calendar of regional workshops; placing the right titles at the right place and time. Regularly updating the calendar to adapt to changes in demand   Partner with the Marketing department to grow and capture workshop demand.   Partner with managers of PD Delivery departments of the other regions to improve process alignment and achieve better effectiveness and efficiency.   Partner with other departments for the appointment of workshop leaders, development and packaging of PD products.   Partner with the Data Analytics team to develop analytic tools, reports and dashboards to support business growth.   Partner with IT to improve existing participant registrations and customer relationship management systems and process.   Explore new delivery models to grow the PD business  Requirements Ability to communicate with a diverse group to gather information and provide team support. Initiative and the ability to work without supervision Positive attitude and ability to operate in a culturally diverse team environment Excellent organizational skills Ability to manage concurrent multiple assignments Ability to work within a fast paced environment Good computer skills and background including MS Word and Excel and some database management. General diploma in office administration would be an advantage Experience: secretarial/office administration would be an advantage. Knowledge of the IB, IB Programmes or being an IB Alumnus is a plus.  *The International Baccalaureate is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer*

job_title: O&T - CRS APAC Real Estate Strategy Head (18043550)
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description:  The Real Estate Strategy Head is envisaged to be a key role within the corporate real estate function at Citi, helping to enable the Firm to establish and execute upon its near and longer term strategic real estate objectives Citi places tremendous value on its real estate network and its ability to provide an operation base that embodies the it’s values of progress, openness and stability together with providing a source of competitive advantage Citi seeks to review its real estate needs to ensure that it retains a leadership position within the industry and to ready itself for the future. The abovementioned role will cut across all primary functions of real estate including leasing, transactions, design & construction, operations and finance. Working in concert with functional and country heads, the Real Estate Strategy Head will help design and deliver upon multi-year strategic initiatives aimed to achieve financial, operational and service excellence. Upon production of an agreed strategic direction, executable initiatives that are supported by robust business cases should be developed then tracked through to realisation. The Real Estate Strategy Head will define, mobilse and manage the resources necessary to achieve targeted outcomes Performance improvement will primarily relate to long term portfolio optimisation through minimising vacancy and increasing utilisation together with location strategy in key markets. The Real Estate Strategy Head will also help drive continued evolution of the optimal workplace, exploring latest design and technology solutions for future integration within the Bank’s real estate network Harnessing the use of data and improving the effectiveness of management information systems will be a key area of focus, using analytics to inform and measure strategic endeavours. Indeed the utilisation of such data should increasingly be integrated within daily operations, the Real Estate Strategy Head is expected to take a leading position in advancing this The Real Estate Strategy Head will report directly to the APAC CRS Head.  Requirements/Skills:  A creative and an analytical thinker, ability to formulate enhancement ideas and corresponding execution plans Ability to harness data analytics to identify and quantify improvement opportunities Track record of delivering positive outcomes within a corporate environment Strong communicator, able to effectively articulate complex matters clearly and succinctly Ability to communicate to senior leadership and to all other seniority levels Form effective relationships with all stakeholders, both within the bank and third parties Conduct oneself with complete integrity, works well under pressure and in a fast paced dynamic environment Internally and externally recognized resource that influences the way things are done Frequent and effective interaction with senior stakeholders and with other internal support organizations including Technology, HR and Procurement Deep knowledge of the core drivers of value and risk within large, international and dynamic real estate portfolios Ability to manage and prioritise a series key initiatives at any one time Chartered professional or equivalent Real estate or finance related degree from a top ranked Universit. Roles & ResponsibilitiesMesh Bio is a digital health start up that uses data analytics approaches to provide predictive, actionable health insights. We are looking for motivated, independent individuals to join our fast growing team to work with our experienced founders to solve global healthcare problems. We are building a team of developers, who will design, build, customize and integrate data analysis servers into heterogeneous network infrastructure of healthcare organizations. The position will be working in a cross functional teams of engineers, scientists and clinicians to develop and deploy software solutions for customers. There will be opportunities for learning and mentorship in the fast growing field of machine learning, data science and health AI.  RequirementsSoft skills:  Efficient and thoughtful development practices Willingness and ability to find elegant solutions  High proficiency in at least two of the following:  HTTP and web sockets Scalable servers in Python; XML and JSON data processing Javascript for frontend development (framework-less) LAN and internet security in Linux  Bonus: experience in any of the following:  EHR LIMS Medical applications development

Roles & ResponsibilitiesKey responsibilities Marketing executives oversee many aspects of a campaign throughout the entire lifespan of a product, service or idea. As such executives are likely to have a great deal of responsibility early on and will be required to manage their time and duties themselves. These responsibilities can include:  overseeing and developing marketing campaigns conducting research and analysing data to identify and define audiences devising and presenting ideas and strategies promotional activities compiling and distributing financial and statistical information writing and proofreading creative copy maintaining websites and looking at data analytics organising events and product exhibitions updating databases and using a customer relationship management (CRM) system coordinating internal marketing and an organisation’s culture monitoring performance managing campaigns on social media. RequirementsRequirements of the role  Degree in Marketing would be an advantage as would CIM qualification. Previous experience in a similar role. Strong project management/organisational skills. Ability to use spreadsheets to analyse data and spot trends. Understanding of customer segmentation. Minimum 3 years of relevant workign experience prefered Salary commesurates with experience & qualifications

Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou'll join our regional Finance team, based out of Singapore and supporting both local and APAC teams. One of the key strengths of the finance team is people from diverse backgrounds working together to deliver consistent results. This in turn enables Finance to be a strong business partner to the Regional/Global operations run out of the Singapore office. The opportunity and the challenge • Broad finance role covering a wide range of financial management and commercial aspects of the advertising business • Exposure to the end to end process from cross border billing arrangements, managing/mitigating foreign exchange and tax risks through to receivable management. • Opportunity to work across a network of agency finance and other IPG financial controller teams. • Opportunity to gain an understanding of each local agency’s business model, operating structure and clientele etc. • Opportunity to lead projects within Agency that contribute to better processes and efficiency. Key elements of the role Client Finance • Lead the timely completion of quarterly cross border billing computation of fees for the region, out of pockets (client billable expenses), incentives and ad hoc production. • Analyze any withholding tax and VAT deductions that arise on cross border settlements - where appropriate building a case to recover the tax from clients • Review monthly regional receivable reports and identify and support resolution of late/payment issues with client (regional and local Asia Pacific markets). • Prepare working capital reports to analyze and manage AR/Debtor and WIP status across the region and report key issues from external (client) and internal (Lowe and IPG Treasury/Shared Services) stakeholder’s perspective. • Review month end foreign exchange position to minimize FX losses. • Analyse client profitability across the region, with special focus on Unilever. Commercial Finance • Manage revenue accounting end to end, from cradle to grave for a few of the brands. • Engage the business leads for client on structuring efficient commercial deals to minimize transaction costs in the form of FX losses and irrecoverable indirect costs such as VAT/GST, withholding taxes etc. • Manage working capital utilization efficiently and ensure positive cash flow at all times by requiring advance billing to customers. • Manage WIP accounts at a project level-track and ensure the Business leads are appraised of any issues that need resolution. • Review production and job related invoices and reconcile costs against pre-billing with TV & Creative Services departments within 3 months of last activity. • Review the process of raising Project cost estimates to customers to prevent agency from being out of pocket on incidental expenses such as local transportation, cell phone costs etc. • Follow up with business leads on additional projects to maximize actual revenue vs. projections and maintain a tracker to support the budgeting and forecasting process. Others • Support Regional Finance or agency specific assignments or special projects as required from time to time • Assist in development of new reports / scorecards, as required, to optimise efficiency and accuracy of business reporting. • Provide regional support on IPG Internal and External Audits. Key skills • Excel – advanced skills typical of a senior level financial analyst to ensure dynamic reporting in a fast paced numbers environment. Computation and data analytics/manipulation. • Report writing & presentations – ability to distill financial information together with a rigorous understanding of which numbers are relevant and why; explaining the story that drives the variances. • Finance systems – experience in extracting financial information in an Enterprise-wide finance system environment such as Hyperion, SAP, Longview etc. would be an advantage.  RequirementsEducation/Qualifications/Experience  • Qualified accountant (ACA or ACCA) – ideally Big 4 trained • Bachelor’s degree in Finance. • 2 - 3 years of commercial experience. Prior experience in the advertising industry would be an advantage. • This role is open to Singaporean/PR candidates only

company: AIMIA PROPRIETARY LOYALTY SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhat is the focus of this role? To provide data analytics and customer insight support to AIMIA’s clients and Marketing teams.  Responsibilities include: Strategy  Which business drivers have the biggest impact on customer relationship strength and business results? What KPIs really matter to the client’s business? How can AIMIA track these KPIs on an ongoing basis?  Planning  Determine which customers to target for marketing campaigns using techniques including statistical clustering and RFM segmentation Predict when and what customers will buy and redeem Identify types of customer promotions required to enable upsell, engagement, recognition and win back    Execution  Track client KPI performance Track member quality and migration Track effectiveness of promotions RequirementsEssential skills and experience:  A highly motivated individual with an interest in data-driven marketing insights Proficiency in SQL, R/Python, Tableau Prior experience predictive modelling (churn, segmentation, forecasting etc.) Strong Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint skills Minimum 3 years of analytical working experience CRM & Marketing knowledge preferred  Useful characteristics include:  Quantitative and comfortable working with large amounts of data A self-starter with analytical astuteness, able to work with tight deadlines Significant client contact and presentation aptitude  Team player who can work in a cross-functional environment Good verbal and written communication skills along with high attention to detail Ability to provide recommendations based on analytical findings  What is success in the role?   Deliver insights and meet tight deadlines Deliver on account specific KPIs and program performance targets Introduce new analytical methodologies to gain greater client satisfaction Take ownership and responsibility of projects and accounts  Why would you not take the role?  Not looking to be a deep-dive analytics expert No interest in developing your statistical software skills Not interested in detail and prefer to focus on the big picture  Why would you take the role?   Looking for analytical experience within a growing global organization Love data and deep dive exploratory analysis Have a passion for marketing & customer analytics Enjoy variety and want to work on multiple account across different geographies Looking to lead projects and mentor junior analysts Enjoy working with statistical software Want to focus on the technical side of analytics Enjoy internal and client interactions Take satisfaction from seeing your recommendations implemented by our clients

Help your clients with wealth planning through our proven methodology and leads generating activities via different platforms. You can expect basic salary/allowance, commission, bonuses, trailer fees, etc to help you build up your residual income and gain financial freedom. You will take charge of your career progression, where the sky is the limit!   Sales Activity & Conversion   Generate sales ideas and action plan to increase sales activity Build and enlarge clientele base with “Project 100” Provide financial advice based on clients’ financial and protection needs Provide recommendation to clients on wealth accumulation, preservation and legacy planning Engage with COI in achieving the target number of referrals and conversion Participate in roadshow duties (including weekends and PH) Participate in canvassing and telethon projects    Customer Management   Accord excellent customer service interaction with clients Perform systematic portfolio review for existing policyholders Attend to customer enquiries promptly and professionally Engage with customers for signup at roadshows and marketing events Conduct data analytics for clients management Personal marketing and social media platforms for exposure and client acquisition    Mentorship for Management   Mentorship from sales veteran with 20 years of experience Structured career path via apprenticeship and management training courses We talk the walk and walk the talk RequirementsYour profile  No fresh graduates Minimum Degree Holder At least 5 years of relevant financial sales experience    Traits  Excellent people skills with strong interpersonal and communication ability Self-motivator and entrepreneurial spirit Proactive, hungry for success and willing to learn Good compliance and professional conduct Fast thinking, meticulous, active listener

Roles & Responsibilities� Fast Growing Bank  � New Economy Customer Experience   � Transformation Leadership Role  Our client is a fast growing bank which has garnered strong industry accolades. There is now an exceptional opportunity for a dynamic service excellence leader to drive the bank's efforts in delivering best-in-class service to delight customers and achieve strong brand loyalty. Job Responsibilities This is an exciting leadership role where you will be responsible for the bank's service excellence strategy and driving its transformation journey. Managing a team, you will develop the service excellence strategy and roadmap, and drive the implementation of global best practices through robust frameworks, policies, processes, data analytics and service culture transformation. You will work with customer experience research on customer experience design (including processes, complaints management and customer journeys), as well as with branches, the contact centre, corporate communications and human resources on ensuring consistent delivery of the strategy.    Requirements/Qualifications You are degree qualified with a demonstrated track record in service excellence leadership roles in consumer focused or B2C companies with strong reputation for delighting customers in the new economy. You are a strong user of data analytics in driving analysis, decisioning and performance management of customer experience. You are innovative, results driven and passionate about reimagining customer experience in the new economy. You possess strong leadership, presentation and influencing skills, and is a strategic yet hands on manager.Requirements**Apply here** https://www.bluechipcareers-asia.com/jobDetails/3904/head-of-customer-service-transformation For more Banking and Finance Jobs, visit us at https://www.bluechipcareers-asia.com/

Roles & Responsibilities Supporting subsidiary leadership as they execute compliance as a foundational & cultural pillar of their rhythm of business. Continuous feedback loop with controls testing, Corp C&C and also support teams (e.g. Buy Center, Accounts Payable) to improve the risk elimination achieved by the 3rd party work.   Conduct data analytics and produce actionable insights to focus the compliance efforts on the highest risk areas, leveraging Compliance Analytics Program. Coordinate and manage internal audits from start to end and monitor implementation of remediation Assist in identifying topics, preparation of deck, follow up on action items for APAC Executive Compliance Committee Contribute as a team member in developing Subject Matter Expertise (SME) for identified key risk areas   Requirements 6-8 yrs relevant experience in any industry Bachelors in finance, accounting or internal audit Possess CPA & CIA certificate Good Workig attitude Excellent communication skills as the person is to deal with middle management on high interaction Attention to detail ad well organized MS Office – Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint
