effectively handles difficult requests A desire to work in and adapt to a dynamic environment Highly disciplined and able to work with limited supervision and deliver on tight deadlines

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSenior Change Assurance Specialist – APAC #110095 Credit Suisse Company Overview Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clients—and to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together.   Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com  We Offer…      At Credit Suisse in Asia Pacific, we’re proud that Internal Audit is seen a key strategic partner to the business. Our risk-based methodology is reflected in truly dynamic audit plans that ensure that the function stays completely relevant and that we have the ability to flex to meet the evolving strategy of this key growth business. Our Auditors have the opportunity to build and maintain direct and lasting relationships with the Bank’s leadership and are actively sought out for the meaningful advice and insights. Reflecting the Bank’s entrepreneurial spirit, our Internal Audit function is also innovating; we’re investing in new technologies, data analytics, and the latest training techniques, to ensure that both people and platforms are best in class. The Credit Suisse Internal Audit department has 350 staff based in various locations with the vision of being a compelling voice inspiring confidence in the ability of the Bank to deliver its strategy. We play a pivotal role in safeguarding the Bank’s control environment, seeking to deliver value-adding insights through audits and continuous risk monitoring activities to build confidence in the Bank’s control framework and ability to achieve objectives. We are seeking talented, dedicated and high-energy professionals to join the audit team in Asia and support management by providing assurance on the control environment supporting various Credit Suisse Group activities. The Change Specialist role, within the APAC Internal Audit function, is passionate about providing assurance over the APAC Change Portfolio and major Change Programs across the APAC region. The role is key to ensuring that our audit work makes a valuable and timely impact, improving the strengths of our Business, Technology and SME audit professionals. Key responsibilities include:  Building and maintaining positive relationships, in partnership with the Heads of Audit, with key partners engaged in delivering Change across the APAC region and related global functions and programs. Maintaining an overview of the APAC Change Portfolio governance and risk profile. Maintaining an overview of key Change programs in the APAC region and sharing insights with relevant Heads of Audit and business partners to support Continuous Risk Monitoring. Defining the audit coverage strategy for APAC Change, ensuring that there are appropriate plans in place for Change Assurance Reviews and Continuous Risk Monitoring over the Bank’s Top Initiatives. Supporting the APAC Heads of Audit and Global Head of Audit, Change Assurance with quarterly risk assessments relating to change risk across the APAC Businesses, Functions and SME areas. Executing Change Assurance Reviews, demonstrating an ability to effectively prioritize completing dedications in order to ensure efficient delivery against agreed timeframes. You will demonstrate effective risk awareness, and build an appropriate risk based, adequate and effective audit coverage to the audit assignments. You are going to be providing support and challenge to colleagues engaged in Change Assurance Reviews, both regionally and globally. You are going to lead Business and/or Functional audits as an Audit Manager or provide Auditor support, as required.  In the first year you will be expected to have provided demonstrable value in the area of control for the bank’s main change assurance programs.  Supervise audit teams, you will craft on the job training during job assignments, and provide necessary oversight and mentorship to ensure the Change Assurance Review and/or Audit is completed against relevant targets (e.g. budget, fieldwork timing, report clearance etc). Responsible for the detailed planning, scoping, managing and delivery of Change Assurance Reviews and Audits. Completion and documentation of assigned audit work within budgeted time constraints and in accordance with Change Assurance and Audit methodology. Drafting of Change Assurance Review and Audit reports, and clearance of Change Assurance and Audit issues with senior management. You will provide assignment feedbacks of the audit team members on assignment. In partnership with Heads of Audit, execute continuous risk monitoring on an ongoing basis to drive appropriate focus on identifying and responding to emerging risks, handling partner relationships with senior business management, and advise business management of audit insights and ongoing issues. Liaison with other team members, regional and global audit management during audit and continuous risk monitoring as required. You will support the Heads of Audit on risk assessments.   RequirementsYou Offer…  You possess a Degree educated to either Master's or Bachelor's level. You have a strong background of at least 5 years’ experience gained within a Change Assurance or Program Delivery environment, including relevant experience working with or within Internal Audit functions. You should have experience of risk and control within the Financial Services industry or relevant portable skills and experience of complex program delivery in a highly regulated environment. You have strong communication, organisational and interpersonal skills - excellent track record in client relationship management. You have the ability to develop/improve teams, and work within a team environment. You are self-motivated, dedicated and results orientated professional.  EEO statement                                                         Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

job_title: Technology Risk Manager (Data Analytics), Advisory, Singapore
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur clients rely on us in providing them with a candid and reliable overview of their risk landscape and the controls in place. You will be part of the team that helps our clients conduct assessments and assurance reviews on the effectiveness of controls in their processes and systems. As a data analytics professional supporting this team, you will be responsible for leading the team in performing data driven analysis to help identify areas to enhance process and technology controls, improve IT operations and compliance processes as well as to achieve company-wide cost efficiencies. Our structured career framework means you’ll continue to develop, whatever level you’re at. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.    The opportunity In this role, you lead a team to work on client-facing projects to perform data driven analysis in identifying areas of improvement in their processes and controls from data. We will be looking to you to apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and on-the-job training.RequirementsYour key responsibilities As a team manager of the data analytics team, you will be responsible for coordinating and managing the planning, execution and delivery of data analytics projects. You will lead the data analytics team to support you in the development analytics test procedures and statistical models and algorithms to analyse client’s data to identify instances of process or control gaps, occurrences of unauthorised or non-compliant activities within the organization and cost optimization opportunities. You will also be required to assist in business development activities such as thought leadership, go-to-market materials and business proposals. You will bring a level of data analytics knowledge to our clients and play an important role in communicating the solution in client meetings and workshops by providing high level understanding of data analytics in the risk domain and responding to client queries.   Skills and attributes for success   Ability to network and build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external clients   Strong project management and leadership skills with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently   Strong presentation and communication skills   Thrive under pressure and handle ambiguous situations     To qualify for the role you must have   At least a recognized university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics or any other relevant discipline   At least 5 years of work experience, with at least 2 years as a project lead responsible for delivering data analytics projects preferably in an advisory role.   Good knowledge of data analytics modelling techniques and statistical analysis and proficient in data analytics tools such SPSS, R, Python or SQL   Good communications skills and be able to explain analysis, both verbally and in writing, to others and translate analysis into a clear business plan   Proficiency in computer software (Word/ Excel/ Outlook)     Ideally, you’ll also have   Knowledge of process risk and controls concepts   What we look for We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe're looking for passionate, design-driven people to join our proven team as a Lead UI/UX Designer based in Singapore.   Some things to know before you apply  We have big plans to disrupt the traditional fundraising process for private businesses through the use of our online investment/capital raising platform (fundnel.com) You will work with a diverse team of former investment bankers, product engineers and specialists, and data analysts in developing, monitoring and improving the platform to facilitate the activity of private investing More specifically, you will be leading all design-related work for Fundnel, working closely with our product team consisting a product owner, UI designer, data analytics manager, and a full stack engineering and QA team You will be required to travel on a monthly/quarterly basis to be on-location with our product team based in Jakarta, Indonesia for product and sprint planning and reviews    Roles & Responsibilities  Lead and manage design thinking of UI development, underpinned by UX as reason for build, for all front-end and back-end features on the platform to assist investors in discovery, due diligence and evaluation of all investment opportunities, and business owners in creation and maintenance of all capital raising activities:     work with other inhouse UI/UX designers to lead design thinking and UI development of all upcoming product features in accordance with timelines established together with the product owner develop web-ready, hi-fidelity prototypes and other supporting assets for implementation on the platform on, making use of tools such as Sketch, Craft and Invision (across desktop, mobile and tablet interfaces) enforce and ensure robust design quality and viability in line with the product roadmap, working in fixed-interval design sprints to ensure continuous development of the platform consistently and continuously engage, trial, test and prove design thinking and prototypes with internal and external stakeholders work through UX thinking, storyboarding and design best practice to test and validate UI concepts (do not design for design sake, every UI design must be validated through UX) establish, document and help your design team maintain overarching UX and UI standards to create a unified design framework for Fundnel by 4Q 2018   Work with other inhouse designers to lend a hand and support business divisions with design, branding and sales and marketing collaterals Work with the marketing manager to apply design consistencies to all forms of marketing and communication:     visuals support for all outgoing marketing campaigns (internal and external stakeholders) media and press enquiry support     RequirementsSkills & Experience Required  3-5 years of user experience and user interface design Experience in the finance / fintech sector is a bonus Experience in B2B, platform and SaaS, with system and process design thinking will set you apart Design agency experience a bonus Strong experience with AGILE methodologies Timeline driven Experience working with a product team (product owner, designers, engineers, QA) Technical proficiency in design software (Adobe suite) and prototyping tools (Sketch, Craft, Invision is required A Diploma or Degree in Interaction Design, Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Systems, Visual Design & Communications, or equivalent    The ideal candidate should be  Be interested to work in the small business (startup) environment Possess a strong interest in fintech / financial services Strong UI design skills and implementation Trained in UX experiential thinking Get stuck-in to learn and run with design thinking practices from the get go Challenge conventional thinking and push design to achieve functionality and beauty Have a basic understanding of terms in financial statements and financial ratios

Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsible to actively engage with internal and external stakeholders to establish a collaborative working relationship for the achievement of business and supply chain objectives. He/she is accountable to the supply chain processes of key customer including but not limited to warehouse capacity management, freight forwarder management, customs process management, client management,  driving operation efficiencies, participating in continuous process improvement activities that drive best in class supply chain metrics, cost, service, inventory, and cycle time. By leveraging on data analytics, he/she will also minimize supply chain risks (operation, freight and customs) by working closely with all related departments.  Main duties and responsibilities will be as follows:-    Supervise all movements (inbound, storage, VAS, outbound, freight) along the supply chain. Be the single contact point of key customer and attend to all enquiries/escalations, follow through internally/externally up to the closure of all enquiries/escalations. Lead any project initiative/process improvement initiated internally/externally and ensure successful implementation, which include but not limited to project management, SOP drafting and revision etc. Capacity Management - Actively review production backlog and work with customer, warehouse manager in capacity and shipment planning, critically propose shipment re-scheduling if necessary. Work closely with customer to increase operation efficiency and uplift overall customer service level. Monitor and drive order linearity by country and by product category against customer’s target. Operation Process Improvement – Constantly review operation processes to identify potential gap or room for improvement. Drives process change and automation to improve end-to-end supply chain efficiencies and to meet key supply chain metrics in term of cost, service, inventory, and cycle time. Monitor warehouse productivities and drive cost control initiatives and order fulfillment. Liaise with customers and clients of customers via e-mail & telephone for any escalation matters regarding inbound supply, storage, quality (discrepancies and damages), value added service, capacity, outbound transport, outbound freight, customs processes, IT related enquiries, and follow through to close the matters. Communicate and coordinate abovementioned enquiries/escalations internally with functional department such as IT, Customs Brokerage, Transport and Freight department. KPI reporting and ensuring Key Performance Indexes are met. Attend meetings regarding operations/alignment/improvement initiatives and prepare materials for presentation if necessary. Perform other job-related functions as and when assigned by the next-in-line manager/country manager.    Requirements Degree in Logistics/Supply Chain/Warehouse Management and/or Industrial Engineering 3 - 5 years of relevant working experience in warehouse/logistics/freight forwarding.  Experience in professional customer service, shipping process and documentation. Knowledge about bonded warehouse operation and related customs processes will be an advantage. Knowledge on shipping related documents such as FTA Documents, MSDS. Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, MS Visio and WMS system. Ability to work in fast pace and dynamic environment. Willing to embrace change and ability to think quickly and perform problem solving tasks, even with changing conditions. Reaction time to multiple tasks with ability to prioritize. Good analytical and mathematical skills including data evaluation, identification, solution development and implementation. Self-motivated and goal oriented, with a positive proactive attitude and a high degree of initiative. Good communications, interpersonal skills and ability to build strong relationships both internally and externally. Good command of written and spoken in English. Influencing and collaborative skills across various levels in the organization.  Work location: 10 Bulim Avenue Transport provided at Boon Lay, Jurong East & Choa Chu Kang MRT

job_title: Sr. Associate, Strategy & Planning - International Business Development
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Role We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it. For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer. And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next. What You’ll Do  Develop global and regional business development strategy, including opportunity sizing and prioritization of resources (BD, Product, Operations, Marketing) in collaboration with the Heads of Business Development Strategy & Planning Evaluate partnership opportunities across several industries, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses Drive team accountability by managing the deal pipeline and review process, ensuring deals serve company strategy, accounting for risk appropriately, monitoring competitive developments, and conducting impact assessments / readouts in collaboration with the data analytics team Routinely present results of financial modeling and analysis and act as a thought partner to various Business Development team leads globally Interface with external executives alongside seasoned Business Development professionals to forge complex deals and relationships RequirementsWhat We're Looking for  3 - 6 years as an analyst at a leading investment bank, private equity, consulting firm, or tech company in an analytical role Highly analytical with strong financial modeling and complex problem solving skills Effective oral and written communication skills Familiarity collaborating with and presenting to senior executives Ability to work in cross functional teams (Business Development, Legal, Finance, Accounting, etc.) Ability to multi-task and deal with time pressure in an unstructured environment; ability to work through uncertainty Undergraduate degree from a top school, with demonstrated strong academic performance SQL capability or willingness to learn is a plus

categories: Admin / Secretarial, Others, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & Responsibilities Formulate and review policy positions, frameworks and strategies relating to AI and data, ethics and the protection of personal data Conduct policy discussions, engagements and consultations with stakeholders (e.g. public, industry, government agencies) and address stakeholder feedback in the review and formulation of strategies, regulatory policies and frameworks Undertake horizon scanning, research and analyses on current and emerging trends and developments in the area of AI and data analytics, regulatory policies and technologies relating to AI and data, ethics and the protection of personal Coordinate and execute key initiatives by the Advisory Council on the Ethical Use of AI and Data. This includes planning the Council’s agenda, preparing discussion and background papers for the Council’s deliberation, providing regular updates and reports to the Council, and drafting recommendations, guidelines and codes of practice to be issued by the Council Engage key stakeholders and drive advocacy of Singapore’s thought leadership on issues, proposals and recommendations relating to data, the protection of personal data, and the ethics of AI and data use via key local and international platforms Drive strategic research collaborations with key partners and organisation of events/seminars under the Research Programme on Governance of AI and Data Use Requirements Masters or good bachelor’s degree in any relevant discipline (e.g., economics, sociology, philosophy, political science, computer science, technology studies) At least 5-7 years of experience in research or policy analyses, preferably in technology-related fields such as AI and data technologies Strong aptitude and interest in ethics, data science and technologies Strong planning and project management skills, able to prioritise tasks to meet tight deadlines while maintaining high standard of accuracy and attention to details Excellent writing and communication skills and ability to engage various stakeholders Self-driven, able to work independently as well as in a team Individuals with experience in a similar or related role (e.g., Secretariat, think-tank, international organisation, policy advocacy) are welcome to apply

job_title: Internal Audit Associate (Data Analytics), Advisory, Singapore
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesManagement and boards of directors rely heavily on internal audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. As an internal audit professional, you will be leading engagements to identify control enhancements, operational and compliance process improvement and efficiency opportunities, as well as company-wide cost improvements. EY is a global leading service provider in this space, with a reputation for high quality and cost-effective innovative offerings.   Our structured career framework means you’ll continue to develop, whatever level you’re at. And with a network stretching around the globe, you’ll gain valuable insight across industries and geographies. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.     The opportunity   As part of the Internal Audit team, you will be working with the colleagues on using analytics to deliver quality engagements to our clients and also to drive the adoption of analytics in the team. You will be driving the Data Analytics functionality for the Internal Audit team by partnering with team members to improve the adoption of analytics. You will also provide support to engagement teams on using analytics to deliver quality engagements.   Your key responsibilities In this role, you will work on client-facing projects to perform data driven analysis in identifying areas of improvement in their processes and controls from data. We will be looking to you to apply your knowledge and experience to help shape our services. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and on-the-job training.  RequirementsSkills and attributes for success   Familiar with data sourcing, data capture, data transformation and data preparation techniques   Knowledge of  ACL, Power BI and hands on experience / theoretical knowledge in SQL including writing stored procedures and data extraction / manipulation using queries   Ability to manage the execution of data analytics projects for engagements to drive value and gain insight from information   Analyze and review the use of advanced data analysis techniques that leverage technology to process large volumes of data, and perform complex computations in a scalable, reproducible and automated manner.   Perform data analytics to identify and mitigate audit risks and achieve data automation, reconciliation, traceability, lineage and transparency.   Use data analytics to provide actionable, timely and accurate data to drive business insights around regulatory risk, compliance, operations and finance.   Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge.   Excellent verbal/written communication skills   Strong organizational, project management and analytical skills      To qualify for the role you must have   Recognized Bachelor's or Master's degree in Economics, Econometrics, Engineering, Physics, (Applied) Mathematics, Accounting, Business or Information Systems   At least 1 complete year of relevant experience.   Candidates who have done Internal Audit work using visualization or intelligent automation tools are also welcomed to apply   Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview, etc   Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills   Excellent command of spoken and written English   Willingness to travel on overseas assignments     Ideally, you’ll also have   Experience relating to Business process automation     What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:   Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around   Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career   The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you     About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

job_title: Risk Assurance Senior Associate (Data analytics) - Advisory, Singapore
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur clients rely on us in providing them with a candid and reliable overview of their risk landscape and the controls in place. You will be part of the team that helps our clients conduct assessments and assurance reviews on the effectiveness of controls in their processes and systems. As a data analytics professional supporting this team, you will be responsible for performing data driven analysis to help identify areas to enhance process and technology controls, improve IT operations and compliance processes as well as to achieve company-wide cost efficiencies. EY is a global leading service provider in this space, with a reputation for high quality and cost-effective innovative offerings. Our structured career framework means you’ll continue to develop, whatever level you’re at. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.     The opportunity In this role, you will be working client-facing projects where your expertise can be leveraged to perform data driven analysis in identifying areas of improvement in their processes and controls from data. You’ll apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues.RequirementsYour key responsibilities As part of the data analytics professional in the risk assurance team, you will be working closely with the broader risk assurance teams to support them in conducting data driven analysis. This will include the development analytics test procedures, statistical models and algorithms to analyse client’s data to identify instances of process or control gaps, occurrences of unauthorised or non-compliant activities within the organization and cost optimization opportunities.   Skills and attributes for success   Ability to network and build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external clients   Able to work and perform the data analysis independently with minimal supervision   Thrive under pressure and handle ambiguous situations   Willing to learn continuously on the job and work on new areas of learning     To qualify for the role you must have   At least a recognized university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics or any other relevant discipline   At least 2 years of work experience in data mining, data cleansing and developing predictive and statistical models   Strong analytics and problem-solving capabilities required, including advanced skills in statistical analysis.   Proficient in data analytics tools such SPSS, R, Python or SQL   Good communications skills and be able to explain analysis, both verbally and in writing, to others and translate analysis into a clear business plan   Proficiency in computer software (Word/ Excel/ Outlook)     Ideally, you’ll also have   Appreciation of risk and controls concepts   Strong time management and organizational skills to gather and make use of data (both internal and external).   Familiarity with data visualisation software like Tableau, Spotfire and Qlikview     What we look for We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:   Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around   Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career   The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you     About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

job_title: Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (FIDS) Senior Manager, Assurance Services, Singapore
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJoin Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (FIDS) within Assurance and you will help clients work through complex issues of fraud, regulatory compliance and business disputes. You will be part of a multidisciplinary, culturally aligned team that works with clients and their legal advisors.   The opportunity You will experience ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   Skills and attributes for success  Work on client engagement teams in carrying out both reactive and proactive forensic analysis of large amounts of structured and unstructured data involving a wide range of database management software, statistical and predictive machine learning software, and link analysis and data visualization software. Involve in project activities including data collection and load, data quality assessment, data cleansing and enhancing, complex data transformation, relationship profiling, sampling and extrapolation, segmentation, statistical modelling, segmentation, structured data mining, text mining and analytical matching. Work in our specialist forensic technology data analytics lab and on site to help clients leverage knowledge from their data for measurement of fraud risks and losses, prevention, continuous monitoring, detection and investigation of occupational fraud, waste and abuse, financial crime and other form non-compliant activities. Work with clients, fraud examiners, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sometimes sensitive and adversarial situations. Help to prepare sections of expert reports, including review, analysis and verification of evidence data and identifying key issues. Be willing to learn, and with time develop and improve leading edge methodologies applied to forensic data analytics engagement that are both reactive and proactive. RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  Strong academic record with a degree in a relevant field At least eight years of experience in auditing, forensic accounting, investigation or litigation support. Candidates with compliance experience within Life Science industry is encouraged to apply Ability to run forensic assignments across multiple jurisdictions Experience in case management and managing portfolio of clients A team player with an investigative mindset Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent command of spoken and written English Traveling expected    What we look for We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you’re serious about forensic investigations and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities Specialize in applying data analytics, machine learning, and data mining technology in power system analysis. Specialize in data collection, database technology and data modeling system/product design. Specialize in power system economics and planning, optimization and economic dispatch. Familiar with PLC application, power grid communication technology. Familiar with actual grid operation and energy management/SCADA system. Familiar with standard/codes or practical experience in modern power system such as Microgrid and smartgrid, energy storage system would be advantageous. To support industry projects, research grant call projects and internal projects in power system related topics. To prepare detailed technical analysis reports as required. To work with team member for experimentation of research work at EPGC facility. Requirements PhD in Power System operation and analysis or Computer Science 3-4 years' research and/or industry experience in big data analytics related to power system operation and optimization Knowledge in power market operation and optimization Knowledgeable in database language and design e.g. MS SQL database. Proficiency in data analytics programming language e.g. R, C/C++, Python, MATLAB. Effective learning, communication and project management skills Ability to work with a team Willing to work in Jurong Island. (Shuttle-buses are available at various locations)  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Officer, Business Operations, Chief Technology Office
company: ALEXANDER MANN BPO SOLUTIONS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Bank of America Merrill Lynch:  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 40 countries. In the U.S alone, we serve almost all Fortune 500 companies and approximately 59 million consumers and small-business customers. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.                              Connecting Asia Pacific to the World Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 23 offices in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer. Position Description Background: We are looking for a talented professional with experience in Business Operations to fulfil an opening in our CTO COO Business Operations Team. You will help with workforce, reporting and governance, strategy and planning, global and regional coordination, senior management presentations, internal communication, and business operations routines. Our team has an extremely collaborative approach that focuses on personal development; our workload constantly changes based on business demands, so we have to consistently improve and innovate together in order to achieve our goals. In addition to receiving extensive ongoing coaching and training, you will have the opportunity to draw upon the knowledge of experienced individuals from a diverse range of backgrounds, to enhance your skillset and your ability to deliver value in your role. The work you deliver will be an integral part of our future success. Providing governance and driving decisions through managing risk well is foundational to our purpose and values – and to delivering responsible growth. It contributes to the strength and sustainability of our company for the future, and it supports the work we do today to serve our clients, community, shareholders and employees. Key Responsibilities  Supports diverse administrative functions for a large and complex business unit. Responsibilities include (but are not limited to): 	 Support and communicate with team members across business operations functions: finance, workforce, and processes. Produce reports and performing data analytics on large sets of data related to service quality. Measure, track & report key metrics to various internal and external audiences, including senior executives. Support communications strategy to deliver consistent and important information to the organization, in a timely manner. Contribute towards employee engagement activities, making CTO Asia a great place to work.   RequirementsKey Requirements  Minimum 2 years of experience Bachelor’s degree required Power Point and Excel skills - including formulas, graphs, and data manipulation Ability to develop concise and effective presentations Strong data analysis skill set to drive insights and inform recommendations Strong communication skills, both written and oral Strong business acumen, specifically in supporting a technology organization Ability to work independently and work well in a team Adaptable to change Highly organized and efficient individual possessing the ability to multi-task, manage competing priorities and meet deadlines while maintaining attention to detail/accuracy  Desired Job Skills   Ability to work with a team and under the initiative drawn by self Ability to review the procedure for support and to pinpoint opportunities to drive efficiencies Ability to handle sensitive business information Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and willingness to challenge the status quo Sound business acumen and problem solving skills; ability to analyze problems, recommend options, and execute solutions

Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose: Build your career with this first class medical laboratory based in Singapore. If you are looking for a career change with great working conditions then this is the job for you!  Innovative Diagnostics is highly regarded for its personalized service and excellence in laboratory testing. Great career opportunities and rewards await those who are interested to join us as the young business has seen significant growth in the last 7 years. Innovative Diagnostics’ excellent company reputation centers around family values, positive culture and supporting employees for individual success.   Job Description:  Develop and lead strategic sales initiative, new product launches and KOL engagement. Develop, motivate and retain a high performance sales team. Establish a market leadership position for Company products through direct physician sales and strategic alliances with pharmaceutical and research clients. Collect and analyse market intelligence, customer segmentation and marketing data analytics in order to grow the Company’s brand and market access. Other activities and services as assigned by the CEO or senior management of the Company. Requirements Preferably Bachelor of Science (e. g., Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field). At least 5 years related experience with healthcare facilities of similar size and structure (e.g., independent laboratories or hospitals) preferred. Ability to work independently and exercise good time management skills.

company: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be part of the Safety Inspectorate Department of Port Systems Division which leads MPA’s efforts to build a safety-first culture that is critical to maritime safety in the Port of Singapore. You will assist in the development, co-ordination and execution of the Safety@Sea Singapore Master Plan as well as MPA’s Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Plan.
You will work in partnership with the industry stakeholders, associations and professional bodies to jointly raise safety awareness and instil a safety-first culture. In addition, you are required to plan key events such as MPA’s International Safety@Sea Week as well as support key activities such as the National Maritime Safety at Sea Council meetings and MPA-SSA Safety Working Group meetings. You would also need to support MPA’s response team in the management of marine incidents, including the regular analysis of safety-related incidents to develop enhanced safety measures.
You should possess a Certificate of Competency (Deck) Class 1 or a Degree in any discipline, and be a team-player with strong analytical skills, demonstrated ability to make good judgment calls and effective negotiating skills. In addition, you need to be adept in managing both internal and external stakeholders. Candidates with experience in the maritime industry and knowledge of digitalisation and data analytics would have an added advantage.
Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesSenior Executive, Data Management
Job scope:
Collaborate with various stakeholders such as business units, IT teams and vendors to:

define business requirements for the enterprise data warehouse.
identify and implement necessary changes to data, business processes and systems to achieve data harmonisation and consolidation.
develop and deploy the data warehouse solution.
seek visible ways (e.g. data analytics, data visualisation, applications) to apply or leverage data.

Requirements:

Experience in database development, administration and data management technologies.  Practical experience in database design, development and maintenance will be an added advantage.
Degree in Information Technology or Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
Keen interest in working with various types of land data such as land administration, planning, leasing and maintenance.
Team-player with good communication and interpersonal skills, as well as be able to work independently.
Comfortable to work independently in new areas. Pro-active, resourceful and able to suggest solutions.

job_title: Office of Human Resources - Manager  /  Assistant Manager
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Descriptions You will be part of a HR team to support manpower planning, spearhead HR digitalisation efforts and manage other HR functions for RP’s organisation needs. Specifically, you will be responsible for:-  Supporting manpower planning initiatives on RP level as well as public sector level including generating statistics and future projections, coordinating workforce planning exercises Initiating and developing data analytics projects to solve business needs Analysing existing processes and recommending improvements using digitalisation tools such as Robotic Process Automation tools Drafting of policies to meet organisation needs Manage HR operations in one assigned HR function, depending on work experience and department need    Less experienced candidates may be considered for appointment as Senior Executive.     Job Requirements   At least 3 years of experience in HR With strong communication, interpersonal and influencing skills with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels Meticulous, comfortable with numbers and good attention to details Must be IT-savvy and able to use MS-Excel expertly. Experience with digital tools such as Robotics Process Automation, Chatbots and basic programming such as Macro setup will be advantageous Able to take a hands-on approach and manage day-to-day operations independently and with a proven ability to multi-task, with strong planning and organising skills Prior experience in the public sector preferred.

job_title: School of Sports, Health and Leisure - Assistant Manager  /  Deputy Manager  /  Manager  (Continuing Education and Training)
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSchool of Sports, Health and Leisure, whose vision is to be the leading educator in the area of sports, health and leisure, invites applicants to join its motivated and passionate team.   Job Responsibilities:  Support school department in course and student management matters, e.g. time-tabling, trainers scheduling, assessment plan etc. Support school department in course registration and application screening matters Central information depository for schools’ tactical marketing activities, e.g. website updates, social media campaigns Ensure proper documentation for Work-learn Programmes e.g. documentation verification; consolidation of details for funds disbursement Manage business development and course administration processes towards successful closure with partner companies Support in areas of events organisation and management, conduct and participation of outreach programmes/events, promotion of CET through different publicity channels including roadshows and digital platforms    Requirements:  At least 3-5 years of relevant experience in educational administration, preferably with some experience in sales and/or business development of adult training  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in dealing with people of all levels Must be IT-proficient in MS Office, and familiar in operating web and digital marketing platforms    Additional knowledge/skills/experience in the following areas will be an advantage:  Customer Relationship Management System (CRMS), relationship building, customer focus, brand management, data analytics, project management, budgeting and account management, sports, health and wellness industries

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities:           • Assist the Senior Manager in the financial management and reporting of Continuing Education and Training for SkillsFuture Programme• Manage student finance activities, such as collection, refund and financial schemes processing• Monitor projects’ budget and reporting to external funding agencies• Manage month-end and year-end accounts closing• Assist in managing internal and external audits• Involve in system implementation, data analytics and process streamlining• Other ad-hoc projects as assigned         Requirements:     Accounting qualification Those with at least 3 years of working experience in Accounting or Student Finance would be considered favourably Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and familiarity with Oracle financial system Meticulous, good analytical, communication and interpersonal skills Strong sense of urgency and able to meet tight deadlines

job_title: Principal Manager / Senior Manager / Manager, Planning and Programmes Development [Data Analytics Division]
description: Roles & Responsibilities  Responsibilities:  Undertake reviews of strategic employment facilitation policies / programmes (including development of strategy implementation plan), draft review papers and deliver presentation on related matters Gather and collate inputs from internal and external stakeholders from Ministries and Economic Agencies for drafting high-level policy and implementation plan Handle enquiries from and provide inputs to MOM and other Ministries / Agencies on policy issues, including Parliamentary and Committee of Supply (COS) related matters Prepare papers to Minister (Minister of Manpower), PS (Ministry of Manpower) and/or Workforce Singapore Board where necessary Serve as Secretariat for high-level Ministerial, Tripartite committees Identify strategic inputs / parameters for corporate development specific to the Group's area of work Organise the Group's annual work plan sessions Coordinate the dissemination of the Group's work plans and collate data to regularly monitor programmes performance against the KPIs Identify and coordinate annual research priorities for the Group Draft Minister's and Guest of Honour's speeches when necessary  Requirements Knowledge & Skills  Tertiary qualifications Possesses strong analytical skills and conceptual abilities, with the ability to translate broad concepts into discrete policies and key issues of relevance  Abilities / Aptitudes  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Able to work independently, yet collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders Be resilient, which includes openness to change Be committed to the ethos of the Public Service

job_title: Senior  /  Manager, Partners Acquisition [Partners and Operations Division]
description:
Roles & Responsibilities 
Responsibilities:

Solicit strategic employers including SME and non-SME to raise awareness and adoption of WSG programmes
Manage all phases of the process including cold calling, lead generation, partner presentation and relationship management
Identify employers' who are expanding their business operations and would require to manpower resources
Understand employers' hiring process, key hiring requirements and challenges in finding the right talent
Introduce the use of Knowledge, Skills, Attributes Review in the Job Description to attract right talents and assess their competency of potential candidates
Market the pool of local talents from WSG Career Centres and Jobs Bank to hiring employers and provide recruitment solutioning supported with WSG programmes
Responsible for filing and maintaining employers' records, call reports and tracking on hiring outcome
Co-ordinate with internal teams and stakeholders to facilitate the recruitment of employers
Gather sectoral market information, demand for manpower needs and skills requirements and translating data to meaningful information to help job seekers heighten their industry knowledge
Analyse trends and develop strategies for sectoral market expansion and identify new opportunities for emerging sectors
Provide strategic inputs on sectoral skills strategies on workers' programmes based on analysis of employment trends and workforce skills

Requirements

Tertiary qualifications
Minimum 2 years (Manager) to 7 years (Senior Manager) relevant experience in business development, recruitment, implementation and management of new programmes initiatives
Candidates without the required qualifications but with relevant experience are welcome to apply

Knowledge

Workforce segment needs and challenges
Sectoral Manpower skills and trends
Employer needs and challenges in hiring
HR hiring process
National employment policies
Knowledge of WSG programmes will be an added advantage

Skills

Business Development - Ability to identify opportunities to increase employers' database in existing and new emerging sectors
Communication - Effective interpersonal, business writing and presentation skills, and understand body language when communicating with different stakeholders
Creativity - Ability to propose or pilot career matching concept with a primary focus of better matching jobseekers to employers' hiring needs
Critical Thinking - Use logic and reasoning to identify alternative solutions or approaches to problems
Data Analytics - Analyse trends and effectiveness of programmes adoption
InfoComm Technology - Savvy in using Microsoft Office and a quick learner for other software programmes
People Management - Work with internal and external stakeholders to execute different career matching activities
Relationship Management - Ability to deepen relationship with strategic employers and partners to provide employment opportunities for job seekers
Sales - Ability to prospect for leads, present and influence Hiring Managers or C-Level executives hiring decision and adoption of WSG programmes

Ability / Aptitudes

Responsible team player who takes ownership and will seek through tasks
Adaptable and flexible to meet with last minute or unexpected changes
Able to analyse information and make decision or solve problems
Strong desire to always complete tasks at hand and is able to follow through and prioritise to achieve these

Other Characteristics

Established network of industry partners or associations will be an added advantage

job_title: School of Management and Communication - Lecturer (Consumer Behaviour and Research)
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities Facilitate student learning, conduct student-industry collaboration project, develop curricula and/or contribute in various areas(s) such as :• Digital Marketing & E-commerce• Market Research• Business Statistics• Data Analytics & Visualisation• Consumer Psychology• Staff may also be required to take on the role as a mentor to students, and/or advise students on student life activities/developmental activities Requirements • Possess a degree, preferably in the relevant field(s)• Preferably with at least 5 years of relevant industry experience• Experience in market research, digital marketing, e-commerce OR experience in managing data analytics preferred • Proficient in analytics software for business strategies would be an advantage• Self-motivated and enjoy interaction with youths• Has strong industry linkages with consumer brand owners, digital marketing agencies and related field will be an advantage

job_title: School of Engineering - Lecturer (Common Engineering Programme)
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities• Facilitate student learning and develop curriculum, primarily in areas of Mathematics• Duties also include supervising student final year projects, soliciting and supervising student internship and reaching out to various stakeholders such as secondary school students, teachers, parents and universities• Selected candidates are also expected to develop and conduct Continuing Education and Training (CET) classes and take part in R&D/Implementation projects Requirements• Relevant degree in Engineering field or relevant disciplines with at least 2 years of industry experience• Strong interest in development of Mathematics curriculum• Technically competent and have a passion for educating the youth• Experience in using Data Analytics• Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong working relationships with management and employees• Sound planning and organising skills, with a strong sense of responsibility for completing assigned duties on time

job_title: Office of Student and Graduate Affairs - Administration (Procurement) – Senior Executive / Executive
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities The successful job applicant will contribute to the overall procurement, web functions and administrative support of OSG at Republic Polytechnic.• Process purchase requests in GEBIZ Portal and attend to procurement issues so that purchases comply with RP’s and Government IM Guidelines• Monitor Purchase Orders (POs) for department and liaise with requestors to close all Open POs by end of the government financial period• Monitor Period Contracts to ensure utilisation, timely renewal or work with staff to raise new quotation/tender• Identify potential procurement lapses and conduct training/clinic sessions for department on procurement• Support department’s web functions (when needed)• Provide administrative support for the team (e.g. minute taking, department meetings, retreat etc.)• Assist and support in OSG wide events and any other assigned administrative duties Requirements • Relevant academic qualifications with at least 3 years of related working experience (those with prior working experience in government sectors would be an advantage)• Those who are familiar with data analytics would be preferred• Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint)• Must be matured and able to multi-task under pressure and detail-oriented with good communication and writing skills• Excellent team player and able to work with minimum supervision

job_title: School of Engineering - Lecturer (Engineering Design with Business)
categories: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities• Facilitate student learning, develop curriculum and participate in development projects in Mobile App development, Product design, Data analytics and Automation• Duties also include mentoring students, supervising final year projects, soliciting and supervising student internship and reaching out to various stakeholders such as secondary school students, teachers, parents, industry partners and universities• Selected candidates are also expected to conduct Continuing Education and Training (CET) classes, propose and take part in applied research projects and provide consultancy services to the industry Requirements• Qualification in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Electrical / Electronic Engineering. Masters and PhD degree holders in the related fields are welcome• Relevant working experience in software programming, Android or IOS app development, electronic fabrication.• Familiar with practices across different domain from Mobile App programming, Unity Programming, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping and product design• Proficiency in Internet of Things, start-up and business operations will be a plus• Genuine interest and passion to share knowledge and interact with youths• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
